story:
Summary

Hello, I'm Del Chatterson, the author, publisher and entrepreneur behind this project.

Here's my story: about the project, the first novel, who I am, why I'm doing this and why you might be interested to support me in the adventure. (Or at least grab an author-signed advance copy or two of NO EASY MONEY)

Check the Indiegogo perks shown here for all the bonuses available.  Thank you for visiting. 

You can help in three ways

1. Share the fun.

Enjoy the novel! Share it with friends and family. Early readers tell me it's an interesting and entertaining read. Any purchase of the novel, the business books or the other perks listed here will help finance the sales and marketing campaign to share the books and the fun with more readers.

2. Share the message. Join the team. 

Join me and my collaborators, followers, fans and readers in this project to produce a series of crime fiction novels with an entrepreneurial background that are a good read and also help to  promote Enlightened Entrepreneurship. Everyone can contribute by sharing feedback, comments and reviews. 

My intent, as a writer of both crime fiction adventure novels and non-fiction business books, is to help Enlightened Entrepreneurs be better and do better: for themselves and their businesses, their families and employees, their customers and suppliers, their communities and the planet.  Please share the invitation and the link to this Indiegogo campaign with more potential readers and supporters.

3. Share the wealth.

My mission is to promote Enlightened Entrepreneurship that supports the development of better communities and a healthier world. 

So I promise you all, supporters, readers and fans, that 15% of all the net proceeds from this Indiegogo campaign and 15% of all future net royalties from the Dale Hunter Series of novels will be shared with my favourite worthy causes: KIVA, UNICEF, MSF and  Amnesty International. (Links to more info below)*

Please join me in this adventure with Dale Hunter and his new friends.

NO EASY MONEY

"You never win playing by the rules.”

Entrepreneurs face challenges every day from inside the business and from the world around them. It’s hard to be a hero. This is the story of an entrepreneur who wants to win and not play too far outside the rules. 

Dale Hunter is a young entrepreneur in Montreal running a successful business in the 1980s world of personal computers. He’s having fun and making money until the bad guys arrive. Now he has to try to survive without playing by gangster rules. It will require courage and creativity and the support of some new friends.

While fighting off the criminals, he still has to manage challenges from his employees and customers, the bank and his partners, and his two suppliers in Korea and Taiwan.  He has to make deals with them all to survive and save his business and his family.

It starts with a demand for protection money and threats of violence to his family. Hunter agrees to make payments to a gangster named Jacques Talbot. But the pressure increases as Talbot squeezes him for more. Hunter decides to call the cops. That’s a mistake and the criminals raise their demands and the threats to his family. Hunter makes a deal with Frank the Fixer, a tough young Somalian refugee who now works on both sides of the law in Montreal. He can be more creative than the cops, but his first attempt to take out Talbot makes matters worse. Hunter tries to deal with the gangsters himself and only digs himself in deeper again. Frank and Hunter decide the solution is to raise the stakes with and ask the Montreal Mafia to take care of the other gangsters.

Hunter also appeals to his banker, his partners and his suppliers for help, but he is still not safe from the gangsters and he’s now caught between the first gang of thugs and the Mafia.  Somebody is going to get killed. Dale Hunter may never get back to business as usual.

Early Reviews

INDIE READER Review: Rating 4 stars. Delvin Chatterson’s language conveys mayhem with a brevity that practically demands attention. Action sequences are rapid fire and corrosive and are offset by scenes of threatening undertones ​. Verdict: Chatterson pens crime drama that is as fast-paced and involved as the archetypal L.A. potboiler and deftly leaves open the possibilities for his characters to continue their stories in future adventures.

"Great read!!! I can't put it down. … I had to get up in the middle of the night to finish it!!!” Ken Collins (Man. Canada) 

“I read this book in one day, I couldn't put it down. I wanted to know how Dale handled his mounting financial problems and how he would keep his family safe. … How do I get my hands on his next book?” Margaret Heaton (MI, USA)

 

More about the book: An Interview and Excerpts in text & audio:

An interview with the Author by Tellwell: 

Listen at: https://tell-it-well.libsyn.com/episode-9-del-chatterson-on-crafting-business-centred-crime-fiction

Excerpts of NO EASY MONEY:

Free .pdf copies from BookFunnel: 

  • 1st 50 Pages

@ https://dl.bookfunnel.com/ffkyj2czjs

  • Chapter 7, Meet Gino Boncanno

​@ https://dl.bookfunnel.com/4tewucqhd4

Reading of Chapter 7 by Denis Senecal:

 

The Dale Hunter Series of Crime Novels 

The Dale Hunter novels are stories of an entrepreneur's adventures with exciting drama, crime and suspense for an entertaining read by a wide audience. Without detracting from being a good read, the books are also interesting, informative and inspiring for hard-working entrepreneurs, for future entrepreneurs and for critics of entrepreneurs. (That's the subtle hidden agenda. Hopefully, it doesn't spoil your enjoyment of the novels!)

The Author - Delvin Chatterson

Del Chatterson is an entrepreneur and business advisor, consultant, coach and cheerleader for entrepreneurs. He has written extensively on business topics for two decades. He is now writing fiction with a short story collection and this series of Dale Hunter crime novels in progress. 

Del has already published two business books: Don’t Do It the Hard Way, A wise man learns from the mistakes of others, only a fool insists on making his own and The Complete Do-It-Yourself Guide to Business Plans, It's about the process, not the  product. Both business books tell real-life stories of entrepreneurs to share the lessons they have learned.

Like Dale Hunter, Del Chatterson is an engineer from UBC with an MBA from McGill and ran a computer products distribution business in Montreal in the 1980’s.  Some of the stories in his first novel of the Dale Hunter series, No Easy Money, actually happened, most are fiction. “They’re all my worst nightmares,” he says, “that I decided to share through these imagined stories of crime and violence.”   

Originally from the Rocky Mountains of British Columbia, Del has lived and worked for most of the past forty years in the fascinating, multicultural, bilingual, French-Canadian city of Montreal, Quebec. He is dedicated to sharing his ideas, experience and advice with entrepreneurs to help improve their lives and their businesses. He has helped entrepreneurs around the world, including volunteer consulting and financial support in developing economies and in Aboriginal communities. His own life experience includes running nine marathons after the age of fifty (setting no records, but never being last) and running for Member of Parliament in the 2000 Canadian Federal election. (He came second, not last.)

Learn more about Del at his websites: For readers at www.DelvinChatterson.com and for entrepreneurs at www.LearningEntrepreneurship.com. You may also follow Del on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram or LinkedIn.

    The Marketing Plan & Objectives

    I have set an initial "flexible" budget for this campaign at $5000. The marketing opportunities and the potential budget are unlimited, but I'll manage with what I can get. Creative marketing does not require a large budget and I am not expecting instant success. I expect to have to work hard and to grow readership slowly. 

    The current marketing plans are:

    • Continue getting reviews, endorsements and testimonials from recognized authorities and early readers  to be used in the marketing and promotion campaigns. "They loved the book, so will you!" 
    • Launch a Public Relations and Promotion campaign through relevant traditional media, online platforms and social media, as well as book review magazines and resources used by publishers, booksellers and avid readers. 
    • Continue advertising and promotion of the book listings on Amazon (.com and .ca), Indigo/Chapters and Goodreads, plus other online book sales and promotion sites. 
    • Prepare effective marketing materials, posters, bookmarks, postcards for interested readers, booksellers, agents and publishers.
    • Arrange book signings, sales events and media coverage for No Easy Money and the Dale Hunter Series of crime thriller novels. 

    The Objectives are:

    • To increase awareness and create demand for the first novel and the series of Dale Hunter crime thrillers
    • Improve sales results from the time of book launch through the fall of 2018 into 2019 to create demand for the next novels in the series.  
    • To have an impact on a wide international audience of current and future entrepreneurs, as well as their families, friends and critics.
    • To increase awareness of the issues and challenges for Enlightened Entrepreneurship.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    I will assume all risks, financial and operational, with the support of my publishers and service providers.  I will guarantee that the net proceeds of this campaign will be used as planned and that all the books and other perks offered here will be delivered as promised. (Shipping is included for Canadian and U.S. destinations.)

    The first novel, No Easy Money, is finished and is being prepared for printing and distribution to booksellers and readers in the coming weeks. The two business books are already available for delivery from the publisher, bookstores and online book sellers.  

    You will receive what you request through this campaign or subsequently order through standard channels.   

    Thank you!

    Thank you for your interest and support. Don't forget, the main purpose of this campaign is to share the fun!  Please tell a friend. Tweet, post or shout it out!  Or use the Indiegogo share tools on this page!

    Any comments, feedback or reader reviews are much appreciated and I welcome the opportunity to keep in touch with future readers. 

    Thank you!

    Del Chatterson

    *P.S. My favourite worthy causes: KIVA, UNICEF, MSF and  Amnesty International.  

    • KIVA - Lend as little as $25 to help entrepreneurs around the world to realize their potential. https://www.kiva.org/  
    • UNICEF - For every child, a fair chance. https://www.unicef.org/
    • MSF - Médicins sans frontières - Doctors with Borders - An international, independent medical humanitarian organisation providing assistance to people affected by conflict, epidemics, disasters, or excluded from healthcare.  https://www.msf.org/
    • Amnesty International - A global movement campaigning for a world where human rights are enjoyed by all. https://www.amnesty.org/en/

    You can send any one of them a donation now, instead of buying a book. You can buy the book later on Amazon or Indigo.  

    Del

story:
Цель проекта и его бенефициары

Невозможность читать создаёт проблемы в любом возрасте, но особенно важно умение читать длинные тексты и концентрироваться на содержании - для детей и подростков в период обучения. Невозможно переоценить важность  метода или инструмента облегчающего процесс чтения для дислексиков. Шрифт Боэра и набранные с его помощью книги, является одним из таких инструментов. Это практически доказано на примере его англоязычной версии. 

На что требуется деньги

1 Разработать кириллическую версию шрифта Боэра для всех основных компьютерных операционных систем.

2 Сделать кодировку шрифта для основных операционных систем и мобильных устройств.
Разработать по возможности приложение позволяющее использовать шрифт для клавиатуры.

3 Вёрстка и дизайн первых книг с использованием разработанного шрифта

Риски и возможные проблемы

Единственная причина, по которой проект может оказаться нереализован, это невостребованность  кириллической версии шрифта Боэра и книг, набранных с его помощью. Учитывая что английская версия шрифта на практике доказала свою эффективность, надеемся, что вероятность такого результата мала, но если всё-таки это произойдёт все собранные средства будут возвращены спонсорам проекта.  

Другие способы принять участие в проекте

Очень важно чтобы о пректе узнало как можно больше людей которым он может помоь:

  • Если вы знаете кого-то, кто является дислексиком  - расскажите ему о проекте 
  • Если вы имеете странцу в соцсетях или состоитпе в группах в соцсетях, сделайте перепост презентации проекта! https://www.facebook.com/groups/AntiDyslexia/ab...
story_txt:
Цель проекта и его бенефициары
Невозможность читать создаёт проблемы в любом возрасте, но особенно важно умение читать длинные тексты и концентрироваться на содержании - для детей и подростков в период обучения. Невозможно переоценить важность  метода или инструмента облегчающего процесс чтения для дислексиков. Шрифт Боэра и набранные с его помощью книги, является одним из таких инструментов. Это практически доказано на примере его англоязычной версии. 

На что требуется деньги
1 Разработать кириллическую версию шрифта Боэра для всех основных компьютерных операционных систем.2 Сделать кодировку шрифта для основных операционных систем и мобильных устройств.Разработать по возможности приложение позволяющее использовать шрифт для клавиатуры.
3 Вёрстка и дизайн первых книг с использованием разработанного шрифта

Риски и возможные проблемы
Единственная причина, по которой проект может оказаться нереализован, это невостребованность  кириллической версии шрифта Боэра и книг, набранных с его помощью. Учитывая что английская версия шрифта на практике доказала свою эффективность, надеемся, что вероятность такого результата мала, но если всё-таки это произойдёт все собранные средства будут возвращены спонсорам проекта.  

Другие способы принять участие в проекте
Очень важно чтобы о пректе узнало как можно больше людей которым он может помоь:

Если вы знаете кого-то, кто является дислексиком  - расскажите ему о проекте 
Если вы имеете странцу в соцсетях или состоитпе в группах в соцсетях, сделайте перепост презентации проекта! https://www.facebook.com/groups/AntiDyslexia/ab...

story:
Getting "Dragons to Butterflies" into print

“Dragons to Butterflies" is the story of my life. How I endured the loss of my mother at the early age of five, grew up with an angry, sexually confused, alcoholic father, how I battled with my own addictions and alcoholism while also struggling with several mental illness diagnoses and the tools I discovered to recover and heal.

Its intent is to bring a light into the darkness of abuse and bring the hope of healing to the seemingly broken. “Dragons to Butterflies” is not meant to be a self-help “how to” book, it is simply intended to inspire and motivate.
Johnnie Calloway, the Author.

In addition to this IndieGoGo campaign, the Dragons to Butterflies team is offering the blog DragonsToButterflies.com as a place to share your input for how you cope and your healing practices, as well as a forum for discussing our trials and victories. There is “a thought for the day” posted and I encourage any and all to share. You can even read the first chapter on DragonsToButterflies.com.

What others have said…

The comments on DragonsToButterflies.com show that people are moved by this story. We have been told that it is uncommon for a man to tell a story like this, at all. Usually not even in private or to their therapist!

"You have a strong voice and are a gifted writer Johnnie. Your story needs to be told..."
Chip St. Clair, author of "The Butterfly Garden",
another biography from an abuse-survivor.

Our sincere hope is that "Dragons to Butterflies" will enrich lives. We trust it will help others come to terms with their lives, to open up and to have a chance to take strides on the road to greater happiness and freedom.

"Johnnie Calloway is a gifted story-teller, and has written a superb personal account of his harrowing childhood, and adult life. Although he retells his experiences of emotional and physical abuse, neglect, heartache, and betrayal, and later, his own addictions and struggles with mental illness, he manages to keep the reader thoroughly engaged and inspired by his strength and wisdom, throughout this page-turner. Johnnie's willingness to be soul-baringly honest throughout this book as he traces his earliest memories into his teens and then adult years is truly unIike anything I have ever read. I have no doubt that his display of courage and his determination to go to any lengths necessary for his own healing will serve as a guiding light for countless readers. It is a story of hope and love, forgiveness, and healing. I only wish it had been available when I was a practicing addictions counselor. I would have made it required reading.”
Callie Chappell, retired addictions counselor.

What you are helping with

By contributing to the publication of "Dragons to Butterflies" we believe you will make a positive impact in the lives of those who suffer from child abuse, addictions and a variety of mental health issues such as depression, ADHD, ADD and Bi-Polar by providing a glimmer of hope, support and insight and an influence that will make the world a better place, directly for that person and indirectly for you.

Once the book is published and gets into print, it will be distributed through the regular channels. At the same time, we will keep telling others about the book, and we hope you will too. This IndieGoGo project is only the start.

The math: We need to pre-sell 714 books to get started

We need to raise $15,000 for “Dragons to Butterflies”, to cover publishing, first printing, and initial promotion.

The cost to publish the book is $4300. (That is how the industry works; the author pays the cost up front to get from manuscript to book form.) Add to that: printing costs, credit card processing fees, shipping, and getting a review by “Kirkus Book Reviews”.

The book will sell for 16 dollars (plus $5 Shipping & Handling) = $21

To get started, if we only sold books at the $21-level, we need to pre-sell 714 books to cover these costs.

Risks & Challenges

We are well prepared for this project. I, Johnnie the author, am not alone. Good, capable friends are helping out, volunteering. We support each other. We don’t foresee any major challenges.

  • "Dragons to Butterflies" is already written, all 22 chapters.
  • The manuscript has been edited and proof read, a few times already.
  • The cover art is finished.
  • We have chosen our publisher, Balboa Press (a division of Hay House) and they are currently evaluating the content.
  • We are having local fundraising events where people can go online and contribute to this project, and tell their friends about it.
  • This is my second book, so I am familiar with upcoming protocol and procedures

In case we don't reach our IndieGoGo target

If we do not reach our target, this is what we are going to do:

The first order of business is to pay the publishing cost, so that we can print the book. After that we will print as many copies of "Dragons to Butterflies" as the funds allow.

Johnnie will sign them all, with affection and appreciation and they will be distributed in order by the date of donation or purchase. Those who do not receive a printed book will receive the full manuscript delivered by email, as soon as possible after the IndieGoGo campaign is closed. Making sure you get the whole story is the least we can do to show our appreciation for your support.

And rest assured, we are committed;“Dragons to Butterflies” will be published and printed! So even if we don’t reach our IndieGoGo goal, we will continue in other ways to ensure the publication, printing and distribution, and you will get your signed copy (or copies).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have been moved by what you see here, and on the blog, DragonsToButterflies.com, please let others know. Talk to your friends about "Dragons to Butterflies", email them the link to this page, and the blog. Share this project on Facebook, Twitter, using all those buttons at the bottom of this page.

Send people here, to this IndieGoGo campaign, and to www.DragonsToButterflies.com, where the whole first chapter is available for anybody to read online. Here is one paragraph:

"The driveway at my Grandmother’s house was gravel and you could hear immediately when someone pulled on to that drive. I was eleven years old before I stopped going to the front door, when someone pulled into our driveway, to see if it was Momma coming home."
Excerpt from Chapter 1 of "Dragons To Butterflies" 

All you who contribute to this campaign will get the first 6 chapters of the manuscript by email, soon, during the campaign. Feel free to share the first six chapters with your friends and family. If they are so moved, the links are in the PDF, and hopefully they will contribute as well.

Finally, Johnnie and the “Dragons to Butterflies” team are available for speaking engagements, classes and workshops. Contact Johnnie by email: jcalloway@dragonstobutterflies.com.

We trust the substance of the true story in "Dragons to Butterflies" will create a buzz. Help us buzz.

"I believe with all of my heart that my entire life has been lived for the words that came pouring out of me onto these pages. My greatest hope is that some will find solace in my writings and learn they can endure and they are not alone."
Johnnie Calloway, author of "Dragons to Butterflies"

story:
What is Coffee Break? 

Coffee Break is a book.  However, it is also an avenue to help women embrace their truth (flaws and all), in order to walk freely as the individual God created them to be.  Coffee Break was created to recover hope, courage, and strength.  Coffee Break was created to restore value and worth where they have been depleted.  Coffee Break was created to be and to give rest after much labor.  Coffee Break was created to show women how to inhale and exhale in the freedom of living life abundantly.  And, in this freedom, women combine their unique individuality with other distinctive individuals for a collaborative effort in building unity among both women and men. 

 Simply put…Coffee Break is more than just a book; it’s a united movement. 


Where did Coffee Break come from?

Coffee Break began as an intimate woman-to-woman break from everyday life.  It was a way for two women to connect and get to know one another apart from the labor of nurturing others.  Eventually, those coffee breaks revealed how each individual woman first needed to get to know the woman in the mirror.  Who is that woman? 

 Most women learn more about others before they discover the true essence of who they are.  They learn to nurture and develop the dreams of those they love before realizing that God created them to dream as well.  Most times women relinquish the spirit of their truth to cultivate the truth of another.  I was once that woman.  Yet, in August 2014 I finally looked at the woman in the mirror.  I was on vacation in Chicago with my family and I woke up one morning feeling I had given all I could.  I was frustrated, resentful, angry, and hurt.  So, I went to the mirror and asked the Lord, “What about me?”  His answer was sweet and simple, “I have not forgotten.  Now write.”  And, Coffee Break was born. 

 As I began to write, I began to see the need for me to learn me, to love me, and to purposely listen to He who is within me.  God’s truth of who I AM was exposed every time I took a break from life to write.  The more I did what I was purposed to do, the more I discovered my true character.  As I surrendered and embraced each individual part of my truth, I was empowered by His Spirit.  Now, I AM whole and empowered by God to empower others. 

 

 Read an Excerpt & More About Coffee Break 

Coffee Break: Let the Truth Sting 


Who Am I? 

My name is Letitia Doss aka The Coffee Lady.  I am the LEO of Coffee Break and Double U (W).  W  is a women’s empowerment program created through Verbal Solutions, developed to give a double portion of “Val-U” to women in order for them to see themselves as valuable.  Through the development of W and the writing of Coffee Break, I discovered the truth of who I AM in Christ. 

I AM a wife, an author-prenuer, mother, advocate, sister, caretaker, friend, encourager, consultant, aunt, speaker, daughter, assistant…the list can go on and on, but before I am any of these titles, I AM WOMAN. 

 

What is Woman? 

“And the rib, which the Lord God had taken from man, made He a woman…” 

Genesis 2:22 KJV 

 

Woman’s structural foundation was formed of a rib.  The rib has 3 major functions, which are to protect, to support, and to respire.  It’s structured to enclose and protect the heart, lungs, and other vital organs.  It has a very strong framework to support the muscles that are attached to the shoulder, chest, upper abdomen, and back.  And, the rib is very flexible for the purpose of expanding and contracting for air to flow freely through the respiratory system.  In order for the Body to live effectively, each of these units must function simultaneously.  Yet, what happens if there is a break in the rib? 

A broken or fractured rib is typically caused by a fall or direct blow to the chest.  If a blow to the chest is hard enough to break the ribs, it could also injure the lungs, spleen, blood vessels, and other major parts of the Body.  The most common injury, when there are multiple breaks in the ribs, is a punctured or collapsed lung.  The broken area surrounding the lungs is unable to hold its shape making it difficult for air to flow into the lungs.  Breathing becomes extremely painful because the muscles, used for breathing, pull on the ribs causing abnormalities in breathing.  The abnormal breathing can then lead to feelings of restlessness, anxiety, confusion, and sometimes even fear.  Sound familiar?

The healing process for broken ribs is unique and amazing.  They actually heal on their own over time and are treated in the comfort of one’s home.  During the healing process, it is important to continue with regular activity such as coughing and deep breathing, as this can prevent the risk of pneumonia or a collapsed lung.  Oddly enough, it is best to lie on the injured side, as this allows one to breathe more deeply.  And, the presence of pain is necessary to determine the progress of one’s healing.  “Time heals all wounds.” So as the pain subsides, strength is restored. 

Many women have been broken by the falls and blows of life and have been unable to hold their shape (original nature and form).  This brokenness has lead to a misrepresentation of what it truly means to be woman.  Like the rib, the woman was created to protect what is most vital, love, for sustaining life.  She is fashioned with an array of emotions to support the muscles (relationships) by well-balancing those emotions.  Finally, woman is shaped to be flexible in order to respire (inhale & exhale) so that faith, hope, and love can flow freely through her.  So, what is woman?  Truth: WOMAN – a protector, a supporter, a respirator.  However, the brokenness of woman has falsified the true state of her being; but by His stripes, she is healed! 

Woman, Coffee Break is intended to assist in the healing process.  It is time to go home, back to the beginning, to confront, accept, and embrace your truth.  Then, allow God to reveal His Truth concerning you.  You are stronger than you think.  You have all you need.  You were born for a time such as this.  Listen intently for the Truth.  Release the untruth of the past and present.  Respond only to who God says you are.  Resolve to throw off anything that contradicts what He says.  He created you to be an original.  You are the only you and it pleases our Heavenly Father when we seek to learn His distinctive purpose for our unique life.  His Word is the path to unlocking the secrets He has hidden in each of our hearts.  So, let us take action in searching Him to discover self, then reach out and grab the hand of all those He places in our path and lead them back to Him. 


What Readers are Saying about Coffee Break

"Coffee Break relates to other inspirational literature because it requires an inner search of self.  However, Coffee Break differs because it is not a feminist perspective.  Coffee Break isn't telling women that they are better than men or can do the same things as men.  Coffee Break is identifying women's true nature and how it has been distorted all while offering practical applications and sound doctrine to bring truth to our identity."

After reading Coffee Break...  "I felt encouraged, understood, built up.  It felt like I was being cheered on to a higher level.  It took us on a journey-through our questions, our fears, our doubts and our failures.  After going through the journey we come to the most important truth of who we are - how important we are - how loved we are - how competent we are to walk in this truth.  Coffee Break offers life experiences and godly truths to inspire.  I don't spend a lot of time reading...but one thing I appreciate tremendously is that the book is concise, and yet extremely full - it's like a double espresso."

"I enjoyed the book and can see myself re-reading it for a greater understanding."

What do you think is the central-primary purpose of this book and is it important?  "The purpose of this book is to reach out to women who may have questions about life as it relates to Christ and showing through the authors life no one is perfect, but God loves you through and through.  It is meaningful and important because I think that is the first step toward healing and deliverance." 

Does this edition of Coffee Break have a concluded ending?  "It does, but it also provides a beginning.  This is stated because a clear ending is in the text, but when the author continues with the 'Me Time' and 'Me First' section, it creates a fresh start for the reader.  This was a good edition as it puts the reader in a place to take ownership of her own next steps."


Budget & Cost Breakdown

The display of creativity cost, but the lasting effect of a movement is priceless.  If you believe in what you read, give to help us meet the need.  Our team believes not only in the book Coffee Break, but in the movement of woman empowerment.  Each team member has given financially and is continuously giving in other areas far beyond what has been asked of them.  We are asking those who can give that if you believe as we do, give a little and watch it go a long way.  Not only will you be giving to this great cause, but we are paying it forward as well.  After distribution, we will donate 5% of the $6500 to an Indiegogo project that we also believe in. 





Stretch Goals

The spirit of giving is contagious.  When people believe in what they are giving to, they tend to encourage others to give as well.  Eventually their giving stretches far beyond the initial goal.  In the event this happens during our campaign, we plan to go even further into this united movement by doing the following.

Risk & Challenges

With any project there are always various risk and challenges with most of them being centered on finances and marketing.  Those who financially support the project (including the project founder), take the risk of funding something that may or may not do well.  Then, there is the challenge of properly knowing how to market both the project and the product.  Along with these, there are three possible risks and three possible challenges this project may face in the coming months and beyond.

Three Possible Risks

·  Vulnerability – when one executes a personal project based on uplifting a group of people intertwined with a strong spiritual belief in God, they risk being susceptible to people’s negative opinions.  Therefore, the individual must have a strong support system and truly believe that they are and/or have the solution to a growing problem.

·  Time – there are few things that are truly priceless and time is one of them.  The risk of losing time, wasting time, and running out of time is and always will be a major risk for any project.

·  Misinterpretation – everyone has their own perception of any given thing and because of this, projects like Coffee Break take the risk of being categorized with one’s opinion of similar projects, which actually speak in a completely different tone. 

Three Possible Challenges

·  Remaining Authentic – it is important for this project to listen and regard the ideas of its funders, followers, and fans as their ideas may be the catalyst of this project’s success.  However, it is also imperative that every artist remain genuine to their authentic artistry.  The challenge is balanced by knowing how to shift to meet the needs of the audience while remaining an original.

·  Execution & Management – developing a team of diverse and strategic leaders is an essential element for proper execution and management of any project.  The challenge is embracing ones own weaknesses and learning to trust the strengths of others in order to place the right person in the correct position. 

·  Maintaining Momentum - enthusiasm fades over time when there is a lack of personal engagement.  If properly launched, campaign projects eventually receive quite a bit of public exposure and community involvement, which is a great benefit.  Nevertheless, keeping the community’s interest requires more than zeal and passion, it takes much follow-up and follow-through. 

Accurately identifying risk and challenges before beginning a project leads to proper planning, which prevents poor performance.  The planning of this project was developed by a team of women who truly believe in its success and the ultimate goal of creating a united movement for women and men of all ages and cultures. 


Conclusion

Your support of this project will be greatly appreciated by me and my team.  Yet, more than that, it will be a way for us to improve value and worth in women to strengthen our present and future generations.  Studies show that empowered women, who are strongly supported, positively benefits multiple families, various communities, and other countries.  Simply put, empowering women empowers the whole world.  It is our hope that after reviewing this project it will inspire you to fully and honestly assess your communities.  In this assessment, I am sure you will find there is a great need for women of all ages to be emotionally, mentally, and spiritually empowered. 

Thank you for your time, your desire to give, your contributions and for viewing this campaign! Have a well-balanced day!!!

Much Love, 

The Coffee Lady

through Verbal Solutions, developed to give a double portion of “Val-U” to
women in order for them to see themselves as valuable.  Through the development of W and the
writing of Coffee Break, I discovered the truth of who I AM in Christ.  
I AM a wife, an author-prenuer,
mother, advocate, sister, caretaker, friend, encourager, consultant, aunt,
speaker, daughter, assistant…the list can go on and on, but before I am any of
these titles, I AM WOMAN. 
 

What is Woman?  
“And the rib, which the Lord God
had taken from man, made He a woman…” 

Genesis 2:22 KJV  
 

Woman’s structural foundation was
formed of a rib.  The rib has 3 major
functions, which are to protect, to support, and to respire.  It’s structured to enclose and protect the
heart, lungs, and other vital organs.  It
has a very strong framework to support the muscles that are attached to the
shoulder, chest, upper abdomen, and back. 
And, the rib is very flexible for the purpose of expanding and contracting
for air to flow freely through the respiratory system.  In order for the Body to live effectively,
each of these units must function simultaneously.  Yet, what happens if there is a break
in the rib?  
A broken or fractured rib is
typically caused by a fall or direct blow to the chest.  If a blow to the chest is hard enough to
break the ribs, it could also injure the lungs, spleen, blood vessels, and
other major parts of the Body.  The most
common injury, when there are multiple breaks in the ribs, is a punctured or
collapsed lung.  The broken area
surrounding the lungs is unable to hold its shape making it difficult for air
to flow into the lungs.  Breathing
becomes extremely painful because the muscles, used for breathing, pull on the
ribs causing abnormalities in breathing. 
The abnormal breathing can then lead to feelings of
restlessness, anxiety, confusion, and sometimes even fear.  Sound familiar?
The healing process for broken ribs
is unique and amazing.  They actually
heal on their own over time and are treated in the comfort of one’s home.  During the healing process, it is important
to continue with regular activity such as coughing and deep breathing, as this
can prevent the risk of pneumonia or a collapsed lung.  Oddly enough, it is best to lie on the
injured side, as this allows one to breathe more deeply.  And, the presence of pain is necessary to
determine the progress of one’s healing. 
“Time heals all wounds.” So as the pain subsides, strength is
restored. 
Many women have been broken by the
falls and blows of life and have been unable to hold their shape
(original nature and form).  This
brokenness has lead to a misrepresentation of what it truly means to be
woman.  Like the rib, the woman was
created to protect what is most vital, love, for sustaining life.  She is fashioned with an array of emotions to
support the muscles (relationships) by well-balancing those emotions.  Finally, woman is shaped to be flexible in
order to respire (inhale & exhale) so that faith, hope, and love can flow
freely through her.  So, what is
woman?  Truth: WOMAN – a
protector, a supporter, a respirator. 
However, the brokenness of woman has falsified the true state of her
being; but by His stripes, she is healed! 
Woman, Coffee Break is intended to
assist in the healing process.  It is
time to go home, back to the beginning, to confront, accept, and embrace your
truth.  Then, allow God to reveal His
Truth concerning you.  You are stronger
than you think.  You have all you
need.  You were born for a time such as
this.  Listen intently for the
Truth.  Release the untruth of the past
and present.  Respond only to who God
says you are.  Resolve to throw off
anything that contradicts what He says. 
He created you to be an original. 
You are the only you and it pleases our Heavenly Father when we seek to
learn His distinctive purpose for our unique life.  His Word is the path to unlocking the secrets
He has hidden in each of our hearts.  So,
let us take action in searching Him to discover self, then reach out and grab
the hand of all those He places in our path and lead them back to Him. What
Readers are Saying about Coffee Break
"Coffee Break relates to
other inspirational literature because it requires an inner search of
self.  However, Coffee Break differs
because it is not a feminist perspective. 
Coffee Break isn't telling women that they are better than men or can do
the same things as men.  Coffee Break is
identifying women's true nature and how it has been distorted all while
offering practical applications and sound doctrine to bring truth to our
identity."
After reading Coffee Break...  "I felt encouraged,
understood, built up.  It felt like I was
being cheered on to a higher level.  It
took us on a journey-through our questions, our fears, our doubts and our
failures.  After going through the
journey we come to the most important truth of who we are - how important we
are - how loved we are - how competent we are to walk in this truth.  Coffee Break offers life experiences and
godly truths to inspire.  I don't spend a
lot of time reading...but one thing I appreciate tremendously is that the book
is concise, and yet extremely full - it's like a double espresso."
"I enjoyed the book and can
see myself re-reading it for a greater understanding." 
What do you think is the
central-primary purpose of this book and is it important?  "The purpose of this book is to reach
out to women who may have questions about life as it relates to Christ and
showing through the authors life no one is perfect, but God loves you through
and through.  It is meaningful and
important because I think that is the first step toward healing and
deliverance."  
Does this edition of Coffee Break
have a concluded ending? 
"It does, but it also provides a beginning.  This is stated because a clear ending is in
the text, but when the author continues with the 'Me Time' and 'Me First'
section, it creates a fresh start for the reader.  This was a good edition as it puts the reader
in a place to take ownership of her own next steps."
Budget & Cost Breakdown
The display of creativity cost, but
the lasting effect of a movement is priceless. 
If you believe in what you read, give to help us meet the need.  Our team believes not only in the book Coffee
Break, but in the movement of woman empowerment.  Each team member has given financially and is
continuously giving in other areas far beyond what has been asked of them.  We are asking those who can give that if you
believe as we do, give a little and watch it go a long way.  Not only will you be giving to this great
cause, but we are paying it forward as well. 
After distribution, we will donate 5% of the $6500 to an Indiegogo
project that we also believe in.  


Stretch Goals
The spirit of giving is
contagious.  When people believe in what
they are giving to, they tend to encourage others to give as well.  Eventually their giving stretches far beyond the
initial goal.  In the event this happens
during our campaign, we plan to go even further into this united movement by
doing the following.Risk & Challenges
With any project there are always
various risk and challenges with most of them being centered on finances and
marketing.  Those who financially support
the project (including the project founder), take the risk of funding something
that may or may not do well.  Then, there
is the challenge of properly knowing how to market both the project and the
product.  Along with these, there are
three possible risks and three possible challenges this project may face in the
coming months and beyond.
Three Possible Risks
· 
Vulnerability – when one executes a personal project based
on uplifting a group of people intertwined with a strong spiritual belief in
God, they risk being susceptible to people’s negative opinions.  Therefore, the individual must have a strong
support system and truly believe that they are and/or have the solution to a
growing problem.
· 
Time – there are few things that are truly
priceless and time is one of them.  The
risk of losing time, wasting time, and running out of time is and always will
be a major risk for any project.
· 
Misinterpretation – everyone has their own perception of any
given thing and because of this, projects like Coffee Break take the risk of
being categorized with one’s opinion of similar projects, which actually speak
in a completely different tone.  
Three Possible Challenges
· 
Remaining
Authentic –
it is important for this project to listen and regard the ideas of its funders,
followers, and fans as their ideas may be the catalyst of this project’s
success.  However, it is also imperative
that every artist remain genuine to their authentic artistry.  The challenge is balanced by knowing how to
shift to meet the needs of the audience while remaining an original.
· 
Execution
& Management –
developing a team of diverse and strategic leaders is an essential element for
proper execution and management of any project. 
The challenge is embracing ones own weaknesses and learning to trust the
strengths of others in order to place the right person in the correct position.  
· 
Maintaining
Momentum -
enthusiasm fades over time when there is a lack of personal engagement.  If properly launched, campaign projects
eventually receive quite a bit of public exposure and community involvement,
which is a great benefit.  Nevertheless,
keeping the community’s interest requires more than zeal and passion, it takes
much follow-up and follow-through.  
Accurately identifying risk and
challenges before beginning a project leads to proper planning, which prevents
poor performance.  The planning of this
project was developed by a team of women who truly believe in its success and
the ultimate goal of creating a united movement for women and men of all ages
and cultures.  
Conclusion
Your support of this project will be
greatly appreciated by me and my team. 
Yet, more than that, it will be a way for us to improve value and worth
in women to strengthen our present and future generations.  Studies show that empowered women, who are
strongly supported, positively benefits multiple families, various communities,
and other countries.  Simply put, empowering
women empowers the whole world.  It
is our hope that after reviewing this project it will inspire you to fully and
honestly assess your communities.  In
this assessment, I am sure you will find there is a great need for women of all
ages to be emotionally, mentally, and spiritually empowered. Thank you for your time, your desire to give, your contributions and for viewing this campaign! Have a well-balanced day!!!Much Love, The Coffee Lady

story:
Clan Destine Press

An independent Australian publisher
specialising in genre fiction

www.clandestinepress.com.au


Our Clan already includes:
Kerry Greenwood, Alison Goodman,  
Jason Nahrung, Narrelle M Harris,  
Fin J Ross, David Greagg, Emilie Collyer, Mary Borsellino,
Sarah Evans, Lindy Cameron, Amanda Wrangles,  and many more!

So...

In a fit of lunacy we decided to invite members of our Clan
and a host of other Aussie and Kiwi genre writers
to play in our first adventure anthology sandpit.


And Then... 

the Great Big Book of Awesome Adventure Tales


will be just that – a great big book of cross-genre adventure stories.


We asked the writers to gird the loins of not one, but two heroes.

And then... 

Slap on their white hats – or their black hats or purple turbans; and heft their sword, buckle their swash, or lock&load their explodey things.

And then... 

Raise sails, stoke engines, calibrate warp drives, fuel rockets, saddle horses 
(or camels or alpacas) or dial time machines – in search of adventure.

We asked for stories of 5k to 15k words in any genre or mix of genres; there had
to be 'something' Australian' (or New Zealandy) about the story or its characters,
and it had to be page-turning action. 

Ideally we want to uncover latent passion or nurture an addiction 
for writing cliffhanging adventure tales because – apart from publishing
a kickarse action-packed collection of wonder-filled tales with fabulous
heroes – we are hoping that some authors might be inclined to develop
their characters into an ongoing series of novellas.


What We Have 

You may have noticed that the upper limit of our word count is
15k - that's 15,000 / fifteen thousand - words.

Our (lunatic) reasoning for this was manifold: the stories could be longer, meaning more adventure; the writers could have space to better develop their characters; the book itself really could be a Great Big Book of Awesome!

Mostly, however, it was because the Publisher of Clan Destine Press is a novelist
and can't write a short story to 'save her life'.
She figured many of the other novelists being invited
might be of the same inclination.

We have already accepted submissions from 26 authors.

There are more authors in our inbox awaiting selection.


Who We Have


Alan Baxter

Alan lives among dairy paddocks on the beautiful south coast of NSW where he writes dark fantasy, horror and sci-fi, rides a motorcycle and loves his dog.
He's the author of the Alex Caine series, Bound, Obsidian and Abduction.
He also teaches Kung Fu.   www.warriorscribe.com.


Amanda Pillar

Amanda, an archaeologist by day, lives in Victoria with her husband, and cats Saxon and Lilith. She’s had several short stories published and has co-edited fiction anthologies. Her first novel, Graced, was published in 2015; and the sequel to her first solo anthology, Bloodstones, is due out shortly.


Amanda Wrangles

Amanda bakes cupcakes, writes book reviews and web content; and is currently writing a sci‑fi novel. Her short story 'Plotting Jasper' was published in Crime Factory's Hard Labour; and she won the 2009 Scarlet Stiletto Award with
'Persia Bloom' (in CDP's The Second Cut). Her first novel – a fantastical and sexy comedy – Arrabella Candellarbra & the Questy Thing to End All Questy Things,
was co‑written with Kylie Fox (as A.K. Wrox). 


Andrew Nette

Andrew is a Melbourne crime writer and journalist whose short fiction has appeared in print and on-line. His debut crime novel, Ghost Money, is set in mid-90s Cambodia. Andrew is co-editor of the upcoming Beat Girls, Love Tribes and Real Cool Cats: Pulp Fiction and Youth Culture, 1950 - 1980. www.pulpcurry.com



Dan Rabarts

Dan was the recipient of New Zealand’s 2013 Sir Julius Vogel Award
for Best New Talent. With Lee Murray he co-edited  the multi-award-winning
flash horror anthology Baby Teeth – Bite-sized Tales of Terror; and his
short stories have appeared in numerous anthologies, 
magazines, ezines and podcasts.
www.danrabarts.com


James Hopwood

James Hopwood is the author of retro-spy thrillers, The Librio Defection and
 The Danakil Deception. His short fiction has appeared in several publications. As Jack Tunney, he’s also scribed the Fight Card series: King of the Outback, Rumble in the Jungle and The Iron Fists of Ned Kelly.


David Greagg & Kerry Greenwood  

Kerry and David are a gestalt entity who read each other’s minds and cover each other’s linguistic and musical omissions. She does romance languages while he does Germanic and weird tongues; and she sings soprano so he doesn’t have to. She costumes and makes stuff, while he wears armour and hits people with sticks. They were raised in the forest by benevolent wood-elves and are co-curators
of a Found Cats’ Home. They both write, and finish each other’s sentences.
Kerry is the creator of the Phryne Fisher series;
and for CDP is the author of the ancient history novels Out of the Black Land,
and The Delphic Women trilogy: Medea, Cassandra and Electra.
David writes about Vikings; and gentlemen cats, Dougal’s Diary, 
When We Were Kittens, and Sanctuary.



Emilie Collyer

Emilie writes fiction, plays and poetry. She’s twice won the Cross Genre category in the Scarlet Stiletto crime writing awards; has stories in Allegory and Cosmic Vegetable; and has won awards for her sci-fi play The Good Girl. Emilie has two collections of short fiction, A Clean Job and Autopsy of a Comedian, published with the imprint Clan Destine Fictions. www.betweenthecracks.net.


Fin J Ross

Fin, journalist and creative writing teacher, also runs a cattery. She is the co-author of the true crime anthologies Killer in the Family and Murder in the Family. She’s the author of AKA Fudgepuddle, the ‘true-life’ adventures of a cat called Juno.  
Recently side-tracked into writing crime fiction, she won two prizes
 in the 2014 Scarlet Stiletto Awards.


Jack Dann

Jack is a multi-award winning author and editor of over 75 books, including the international bestsellers The Memory Cathedral and The Silent. Other collections include Promised Land, Timetipping, Visitations and The Fiction Factory.
He is co-editor, with Janeen Webb, of Dreaming Down-Under, which won the World Fantasy Award; and editor of its sequel Dreaming Again. Satalyte has just released a new edition of The Rebel. Jack lives on a farm overlooking the sea. www.jackdann.com



Jason Franks

Jason is the author of the occult rock'n'roll novel Bloody Waters, and writer of graphic novels and comic books, including The Sixsmiths and Left Hand Path. His short fiction has been published in Aurealis, Midnight Echo, After the World, and more. He’s twice been short-listed for an Aurealis Award.  www.jasonfranks.com


Jason Nahrung

Jason grew up on a Queensland cattle property but now lives in Ballarat with his author-wife Kirstyn McDermott. His passion for B-grade horror films is reflected
 in his gothic fiction, The Darkness Within and Salvage; and the outback vampire duology Blood and Dust and The Big Smoke (Clan Destine Press).
www.jasonnahrung.com.


Kat Clay

Kat is a Melbourne writer and photographer whose non-fiction articles have appeared in numerous travel magazines and academic journals.
In 2015, Kat was awarded a Melbourne UNESCO City of Literature Travel Grant,
and also released her first crime novella Double Exposure.


Keith McArdle

Keith grew up reading action thrillers. As a former soldier in the Australian Army, he’s seen active service in the Iraq theatre of war, East Timor and Afghanistan. Keith’s the author of The Reckoning: The Day Australia Fell ,
The Forgotten Land, Assassin and Against the Odds.




Kelly Gardiner

Kelly’s Young Adult novels, Act of Faith and The Sultan’s Eyes, were shortlisted
for the NSW Premier's Literary Awards.
Her books for young readers  include the 'Swashbuckler' pirate adventures,
and the picture book, Billabong Bill's Bushfire Christmas.
Her latest novel, Goddess, is for adults and is based on the life of
 17th century French swordswoman Mademoiselle de Maupin.


Lindy Cameron

Lindy is a National Co-Convenor of Sisters in Crime Australia
and the Publisher of Clan Destine Press.
She's the author of the Kit O’Malley PI novels – Blood Guilt, Bleeding Hearts and Thicker Than Water; the action thriller Redback; the mystery Golden Relic:
and the sci-fi (15k  short story)  Feedback.
She also co-wrote the true crime anthologies Killer in the Family,
Murder in the Family, and Women Who Kill.
She’s currently writing historical fiction featuring time travel,
archaeology and Amazons.
  www.clandestinepress.com.au


Maria Lewis

Maria’s articles have appeared in the New York Post, The Daily Mail and more.
She produced the Eff Yeah Film & Feminism podcast; and wrote and produced George Miller’s documentary Justice League Mortal.
Her debut novel Who’s Afraid? is due for release in 2016.


Mary Borsellino

Mary lives in Melbourne, has lots of tattoos and writes dark YA and adult supernatural/fantasy. She’s author of the YA adventure Thrive, with Clan Destine Press; the five-book The Wolf House series; The Devil's Mixtape;
and CDP's erotic stories Loveless, Min Min Lights, Vanilla and Table for Three.



Michael Pryor

Michael writes fantasy and science fiction, mostly for teenagers. With more than 30 novels and 50-something short stories published, he’s been shortlisted six times for the Aurealis Award, and seven of his books have been CBCA Notable books.  www.michaelpryor.com.au.


Narrelle M Harris

Narrelle is an award-winning Melbourne writer whose books include: Fly by Night, Witch Honour, Witch Faith, The Opposite of Life and Walking Shadows.
She's also written the Holmes/Watson romance, The Adventure of the Colonial Boy, due out in 2016; and the CDP erotic romances Talbott and Burns:
Hammer and Tongue; and Secret Agents, Secret Lives.
www.mortalwords.com.au


Sarah Evans

Sarah writes crime, romance, horror and fantasy. She’s published novels, short stories (some broadcast on ABC Radio), songs and poetry, and a lifestyle-recipe book. With CDP Fictions, she’s published Call of the Wild, Killing Kindness and
New Blood. Sarah teaches creative writing and edits children’s books.
Her latest crime novel (with CDP)  is Operation Paradise.


Sophie Masson

Sophie is an award-winning author of more than 60 books for children, young adults and adults. Her most recent novels are the adult thriller, Trinity: The False Prince, and 2015 YA fantasy Hunter's Moon.



Peter M. Ball

 Peter is the author of Horn, Bleed, and the Flotsam novella series.
He's had short stories in Apex Magazine, Eclipse 4, and Daily Science Fiction.  
Peter is also seriously responsible for GenreCon – Australia's fabulous
cross-genre convention, this year being held in Brisbane at the end of October.
 www.petermball.com

Tansy Rayner Roberts

Tansy, Australian sci-fi and fantasy author, and Hugo Award winning blogger
and podcaster (Galactic Suburbia) also writes crime fiction as Livia Day.
Her latest short fiction is Fake Geek Girl; and her serialised novel,
 Musketeer Space, is free on her blog.
http://tansyrr.com


Tor Roxburgh

Tor currently writes speculative fiction. She’s written 15 books, the latest an epic fantasy, The Light Heart of Stone; and also 12 teen romances and two non‑fiction titles. When avoiding writing, Tor runs an arts-focused homewares business, Omnibus Art Gallery, where she sells up-cycled and re-upholstered furniture.


More authors to come.

And here they are...


Alison Goodman

Alison is the author of bestselling fantasy duology, Eon and Eona; the crime novel, A New Kind of Death; and the Aurealis Award-winning Singing the Dogstar Blues (Best YA novel). Eon also won an Aurealis for Best Fantasy Novel. Alison has been having far too much fun researching 1812 England for her new trilogy featuring Lady Helen. The first book, The Dark Days Club, is out in Australia in December 2015; and the USA and UK in January 2016. www.darkdaysclub.com


 Sulari Gentill

Sulari is the author of the Hero Trilogy, a YA retelling of The Odyssey; and the awarding-winning Rowland Sinclair mystery series, of which the seventh novel, Give the Devil His Due, has just been released. Sulari lives in her pyjamas in the foothills of the Snowy Mountains where she refers to her writing as ‘work’ so that no one will suggest she get a real job.


Lucy Sussex

Lucy was born in New Zealand but now lives in Melbourne. She has published widely; edited five anthologies, written five short story collections, and the award-winning neo-Victorian novel, The Scarlet Rider. Her latest book. Blockbuster: Fergus Hume and the Mystery of a Hansom Cab, won the 2015 Victorian Community History Award.


Cameron Ashley

Cam is the chief editor of Crime Factory (thecrimefactory.com). His articles, interviews and fiction have appeared in numerous places both online and in print. He currently writes a weekly column for Eisner award winning retailer, All Star Comics and is at work on several fiction projects.


Dr Evelyn Tsitas

Evelyn is intrigued by hybrids, art theft, Greek culture, and ambiguity in crime fiction. She has a PhD in Creative Writing and a Sisters in Crime Scarlet Stiletto Award to prove she takes her speculative research, and writing, seriously. Everything she writes has its basis in truth. Honestly.




What We Need

Most of the so-far accepted manuscripts have come in around 
the 10k to 15k – which is great; it's what we wanted...
but now we need to pay everyone. 

The rate we offered was 5 cents per word. That's a lot of little coins for so many fabulous writers who've flung almost-novella-length adventures at us.

It also means that:  

And Then... the great big book of awesome

will probably have to be a two-volume publication.

Which is truly awesome... but we still need to pay everyone.

So, what we need is to raise the funds to pay the contributors.

Each author will also be given an illustrated title page of their very own.

That means we also need to pay an illustrator.

Our illustrator is Vicky Pratt

www.vicpratt.wix.com/vickypratt 

The pencil drawing below 
is the first of our title page illustrations
It's for Come Now, Traveller by Amanda Wrangles..




Everything else – editing, proofing, design & layout, printing – gets done
(as per usual) from the Clan Destine coffers.

So we need $18,000 to cover writers' fees and illustrations

That's where you all come in.


What you get

We have a range of funding levels with a host of perks that go with each.

You all get something for the something you contribute,
depending on the level you opt into. The somethings could be:

* a thank you on our website 
* the eBooks of And Then... 
* the paperbacks of And Then... 
 * eBooks/paperbacks of other Clan Destine Press titles 

* a scene of your own genre fiction critiqued by one of the anthology authors... 

To the Grand Poobah of perks:

* the limited-edition hardcovers of And Then...


Getting the word out

If you can't afford any of the levels but would still like to help get
this Great Big Book of Awesome on the road then feel free
to share our campaign all over social media.
The more mentions, shares, likes and tweets we get, the better.


Visit Clan Destine Press

www.clandestinepress.com.au

linguistic and musical omissions. She does romance languages while he does
Germanic and weird tongues; and she sings soprano so he doesn’t have to. She
costumes and makes stuff, while he wears armour and hits people with sticks.
They were raised in the forest by benevolent wood-elves and are co-curators of
a Found Cats’ Home. They both write, and finish each other’s sentences. Kerry is
the creator of the Phryne Fisher series; and for CDP is the author of the ancient
history novels Out of the Black Land,
and The Delphic Women trilogy: Medea, Cassandra and Electra. David writes about Vikings; and gentlemen cats, Dougal’s Diary, When We Were Kittens, and Sanctuary.




Emilie
Collyer
Emilie writes fiction, plays and poetry. She’s
twice won the Cross Genre category in the Scarlet Stiletto crime writing awards;
has stories in Allegory and Cosmic Vegetable; and has won awards for her
sci-fi play The Good Girl. Emilie has
two collections of short fiction, A Clean
Job and Autopsy of a Comedian, published
with the imprint Clan Destine Fictions. www.betweenthecracks.net.

Fin J Ross
Fin, journalist and creative writing teacher, also
runs a cattery. She is the co-author of the true crime anthologies Killer
in the Family and Murder in the Family. She’s the author of AKA Fudgepuddle, the ‘true-life’
adventures of a cat called Juno.  Recently
side-tracked into writing crime fiction, she won two prizes in the 2014 Scarlet
Stiletto Awards.

Jack
Dann
Jack is a multi-award winning author and
editor of over 75 books, including the international bestsellers The Memory
Cathedral and The Silent. Other
collections include Promised Land, Timetipping, Visitations and The Fiction Factory. He
is co-editor, with Janeen Webb, of Dreaming Down-Under, which won the
World Fantasy Award; and editor of its sequel Dreaming Again. Satalyte has just released a new edition of The Rebel. Jack lives on a farm
overlooking the sea. www.jackdann.com





Jason Franks
Jason
is the author of the occult rock'n'roll novel Bloody Waters, and writer of graphic novels and comic books, including The Sixsmiths and Left Hand Path. His short fiction has been published in Aurealis, Midnight Echo, After the
World, and more. He’s
twice been short-listed for an Aurealis Award.  www.jasonfranks.com

Jason Nahrung
Jason grew
up on a Queensland cattle property but now lives in Ballarat with his author-wife
Kirstyn McDermott. His passion for B-grade horror films is reflected in his gothic
fiction, The Darkness Within and Salvage; and the outback vampire
duology Blood and Dust and The Big Smoke (Clan Destine Press). www.jasonnahrung.com. 

Kat Clay
Kat is a Melbourne writer
and photographer whose non-fiction articles have appeared in numerous travel
magazines and academic journals. In 2015, Kat was awarded a Melbourne UNESCO
City of Literature Travel Grant, and also released her first crime novella Double Exposure.


Keith McArdle
Keith
grew up reading action thrillers. As
a former soldier in the Australian Army, he’s seen active service in the Iraq
theatre of war, East Timor and Afghanistan. Keith’s the author of The Reckoning: The Day Australia Fell , The Forgotten Land, Assassin and Against the Odds.




Kelly Gardiner
Kelly’s Young Adult novels, Act of Faith
and The Sultan’s Eyes, were shortlisted for the NSW Premier's Literary Awards. Her books for young readers  include the 'Swashbuckler' pirate adventures, and the picture book, Billabong Bill's Bushfire Christmas.Her latest novel, Goddess, is for adults and is based on the life of  17th century French swordswoman Mademoiselle de Maupin.

Lindy Cameron
Lindy is a National Co-Convenor of Sisters in Crime
Australia and the Publisher of Clan Destine Press. She's the author of the Kit O’Malley PI novels – Blood Guilt,
Bleeding Hearts and Thicker Than
Water; the action thriller Redback; the mystery Golden Relic: and the sci-fi (15k  short story)  Feedback.She also co-wrote the true crime anthologies Killer in the Family, Murder in the Family, and Women
Who Kill. She’s currently writing historical fiction featuring
time travel, archaeology and Amazons.  www.clandestinepress.com.au


Maria
Lewis
Maria’s articles have appeared in the New York
Post, The Daily Mail and more. She produced the Eff Yeah Film & Feminism podcast; and wrote and produced George
Miller’s documentary Justice League
Mortal. Her debut novel Who’s Afraid?
is due for release in 2016.

Mary Borsellino
Mary lives in Melbourne, has lots of tattoos and writes
dark YA and adult supernatural/fantasy. She’s author of the YA adventure Thrive, with Clan Destine Press; the five-book The Wolf House series; The
Devil's Mixtape; and CDP's erotic stories Loveless, Min Min Lights, Vanilla and Table
for Three. 




Michael Pryor 
Michael
writes fantasy and science fiction, mostly for teenagers. With more than 30 novels
and 50-something short stories published, he’s been shortlisted six times for
the Aurealis Award, and seven of his books have been CBCA Notable books.  www.michaelpryor.com.au.

Narrelle
M Harris
Narrelle is an award-winning Melbourne writer whose books include: Fly by Night,
Witch Honour, Witch Faith, The Opposite of Life and
Walking Shadows. She's also written the Holmes/Watson romance, The Adventure of the Colonial Boy, due out in 2016; and the CDP erotic romances Talbott and Burns:Hammer and Tongue; and Secret Agents, Secret Lives.www.mortalwords.com.au

Sarah
Evans
Sarah writes crime, romance,
horror and fantasy. She’s published novels, short stories (some broadcast on
ABC Radio), songs and poetry, and a lifestyle-recipe book. With CDP Fictions,
she’s published Call of the Wild, Killing Kindness and New Blood. Sarah teaches creative
writing and edits children’s books. Her latest crime novel (with CDP)  is Operation Paradise.


Sophie
Masson
Sophie is an award-winning author of more
than 60 books for children, young adults and adults. Her most recent novels
are the adult thriller, Trinity: The
False Prince, and 2015 YA fantasy Hunter's
Moon.




Peter M. Ball
 Peter is the author of Horn, Bleed, and the Flotsam novella series.He's had short stories in Apex Magazine, Eclipse 4, and Daily Science Fiction.  Peter is also seriously responsible for GenreCon – Australia's fabulous cross-genre convention, this year being held in Brisbane at the end of October. www.petermball.com
Tansy Rayner Roberts
Tansy, Australian sci-fi and fantasy author, and
Hugo Award winning blogger and podcaster (Galactic Suburbia) also writes crime fiction as Livia Day. Her
latest short fiction is Fake Geek Girl; and her serialised novel, Musketeer Space, is free on her blog. http://tansyrr.com

Tor Roxburgh
Tor currently writes
speculative fiction. She’s written 15 books, the latest an epic fantasy, The
Light Heart of Stone; and also 12 teen romances and two non‑fiction
titles. When avoiding writing, Tor runs an arts-focused homewares business,
Omnibus Art Gallery, where she sells up-cycled and re-upholstered furniture.





More authors to come.
And here they are...


Alison
Goodman
Alison is the author of bestselling
fantasy duology, Eon and Eona; the crime novel, A New Kind of Death; and the Aurealis
Award-winning Singing the Dogstar Blues
(Best YA novel). Eon also won an Aurealis for Best Fantasy Novel. Alison has
been having far too much fun researching 1812 England for her new trilogy
featuring Lady Helen. The first book, The
Dark Days Club, is out in Australia in December 2015; and the USA and UK in
January 2016. www.darkdaysclub.com

 Sulari Gentill
Sulari is
the author of the Hero Trilogy, a YA retelling of The Odyssey; and the awarding-winning
Rowland Sinclair mystery series, of which the seventh novel, Give the Devil His Due, has just been
released. Sulari lives in her pyjamas in the foothills of the Snowy Mountains
where she refers to her writing as ‘work’ so that no one will suggest she get a
real job.

Lucy
Sussex
Lucy was born in New Zealand but now lives
in Melbourne. She has published widely; edited five anthologies, written five
short story collections, and the award-winning neo-Victorian novel, The Scarlet Rider. Her latest book. Blockbuster: Fergus Hume and the Mystery of
a Hansom Cab, won the 2015 Victorian Community History Award.

Cameron Ashley
Cam
is the chief editor of Crime Factory
(thecrimefactory.com). His articles, interviews and fiction have appeared in
numerous places both online and in print. He currently writes a weekly column
for Eisner award winning retailer, All Star
Comics and is at work on several fiction projects.

Dr Evelyn Tsitas

Evelyn is intrigued by
hybrids, art theft, Greek culture, and ambiguity in crime fiction. She has a
PhD in Creative Writing and a Sisters in Crime Scarlet Stiletto Award to prove
she takes her speculative research, and writing, seriously. Everything she
writes has its basis in truth. Honestly.





What We Need
Most of the so-far accepted manuscripts have come in around the 10k to 15k – which is great; it's what we wanted... but now we need to pay everyone. 
The rate we offered was 5 cents per word. That's a lot of little coins for so many fabulous writers who've flung almost-novella-length adventures at us.
It also means that:  
And Then... the great big book of awesome
will probably have to be a two-volume publication.
Which is truly awesome... but we still need to pay everyone.
So, what we need is to raise the funds to pay the contributors.
Each author will also be given an illustrated title page of their very own.
That means we also need to pay an illustrator.
Our illustrator is Vicky Pratt
www.vicpratt.wix.com/vickypratt 
The pencil drawing below is the first of our title page illustrationsIt's for Come Now, Traveller by Amanda Wrangles..




Everything else – editing, proofing, design & layout, printing – gets done(as per usual) from the Clan Destine coffers.
So we need $18,000 to cover writers' fees and illustrations
That's where you all come in.

What you get
We have a range of funding levels with a host of perks that go with each.
You all get something for the something you contribute, depending on the level you opt into. The somethings could be:
* a thank you on our website * the eBooks of And Then... * the paperbacks of And Then...  * eBooks/paperbacks of other Clan Destine Press titles 
* a scene of your own genre fiction critiqued by one of the anthology authors... 
To the Grand Poobah of perks:* the limited-edition hardcovers of And Then...

Getting the word out
 If you can't afford any of the levels but would still like to help get this Great Big Book of Awesome on the road then feel free to share our campaign all over social media. The more mentions, shares, likes and tweets we get, the better.

Visit Clan Destine Press
www.clandestinepress.com.au

story:
Short Summary

As I mention in the intro video, I'm doing this primarily for my children. Even though this project has grown far beyond its original goals, the intention has remained the same: to pass on the story of my life to those I love... and anyone else who cares to read it.

You have seen the pitch video... here are a few (very short) clips from interviews where Duncan does a little story telling.

What We Need & What You Get

This project is initiated by friends of Duncan Stroud to allow him to finish his autobiography, which he has been working on for many years.  We are asking for funding so he can work full time on finishing and publishing his autobiography, which he estimates will take about nine months. The breakdown is pretty simple: approximately $15,000 to cover the most basic living costs,  and the rest for the editors, producers, publishers, and server fees (for the book's website http://legallyblindthebook.com). If the goal is not reached what is available will be used for exactly the same purpose for as long as possible.

As for perks, well, I tried to get as creative as I could given what I have to contribute. The only other thing I could offer was free tango lesson in Buenos Aires, but as this is difficult to redeem, it doesn't really work. However, the offer stands.  If you donate AND you come to Buenos Aires, I'll teach you to dance tango like a true porteño and bring you to the real milongas.


The Impact

Duncan's story is not simply an autobiography—it is an insight into a world we rarely get to see so intimately, the world of those who live in the (autistic) spectrum.  For Duncan this perception of the world did not stop at the borders of reality, but extended into other worlds, other realities. Whether these perceptions were the creations of a fevered brain or true insight into alternative dimensions is left to the reader. What is unquestionable is how our society is unprepared to deal with or understand "Spectrum People" while at the same time desperately in need of what they have to teach us.

For the spiritually minded, Duncan's story is a journey that leads him to the hidden Shangri-La that awaits all of us, eventually.  For the more Cartesian readers, it is the story of a hapless misfit who trips from one unfortunate adventure into another until he finally finds himself at the bottom of deep hole declaring himself "the luckiest man in the world."


Risks & Challenges

Assuming Duncan does not get run over by an Argentine bus driver, the only real risk is that the book itself is simply not that good. This risk in mitigated by the fact that our team includes a business manager, a graphic designer, a journalist, and an editor, who work with Duncan to review his writing and shape the book. 

Here are some links to excerpts from the first draft:

Terrorists and Tango

The Ant God

Boy Scouts

Tannery

Rome

More of the book's excerpts and blog posts by Duncan can be found at the website, http://legallyblindthebook.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

The simplest way you can help is to spread the word and show support via these links

http://www.facebook.com/duncan.stroud.3

http://twitter.com/duncanstroud3

http://youtube.legallyblindthebook.com

http://legallyblindthebook.com

and the Indiegogo share tools!

However, if you want to help Duncan with any of the following "problems" he has, we would love to talk to you.

  • A U.S. citizen currently living (and for the past ten years) in Argentina as an illegal alien
  • Wanted by the U.S. Marshal for a victimless crime
  • Has no passport or other U.S. government ID and has been blacklisted from getting any
  • Is over $1,000,000 in debt
  • A suspected terrorist sympathizer
  • Has heart disease (seven stents) with no access to medical care

story:
Γιατί θέλουμε μια δική μας δημοσκόπηση

Εδώ και πολλά χρόνια αναρωτιόμαστε πως γίνονται οι δημοσκοπήσεις και αν στην πραγματικότητα μας βοηθάνε σε κάτι. Υπάρχει έντονη η αίσθηση ότι οι δημοσκόποι «φτιάχνουν» τις ερωτήσεις και ότι παίζουν παιχνίδια. Στην δύσκολη εκλογική μάχη που έρχεται θέλουμε τη δική μας δημοσκόπηση γιατί:

  • Θέλουμε να την αντιπαραθέσουμε με αυτές των συστημικών ΜΜΕ.
  • Θέλουμε να ρωτήσουμε τον κόσμο κάτι ποιο ουσιαστικό από το τι θα ψηφίσει απλά.
  • Θέλουμε μια δημοσκόπηση φτιαγμένη από τους πολλούς για να απαντήσει στα ερωτήματα των πολλών.

Δυστυχώς όμως το κόστος για μια τέτοια έρευνα ξεπερνάει τις δυνατότητες του ThePressProject, οπότε θα μπορούσαμε να την κάνουμε μόνο εφόσον το θέλετε και εσείς.

Πως είμαστε σίγουροι ότι θα είναι διαφορετική

Πιστεύουμε ότι μπορούμε να διασφαλίσουμε μια αξιόλογη δημοσκόπηση γιατί:

  • Θα την κάνουμε όλοι μαζί. Θα ακούσουμε τις προτάσεις του επιστημονικού μας συνεργάτη και θα θέσουμε τις ερωτήσεις σε διαβούλευση.
  • Θα στοχεύσουμε σε ερωτήσεις που πραγματικά προβληματίζουν τον κόσμο και όχι απλά στην εκλογική συμπεριφορά που ενδιαφέρουν τους πολιτικούς και τους σπόνσορές τους.
  • Θα συνεργαστούμε με μια γνωστή και αξιόλογη εταιρία

Πως θα την κάνουμε

Έχουμε επιλέξει την Public Issue και τον Γιάννη Μαυρή καθώς θεωρούμε ότι:

  • Έχει μια από τις καλύτερες δημοσκοπικές εταιρίες στην Ελλάδα
  • Ο κύριος Μαυρής θα μας καθοδηγήσει σωστά ώστε να μην κάνουμε λάθη και θα μας υποδείξει ερωτήσεις που μπορούμε να συγκρίνουμε με το αρχείο του
  • Η Public Issue με το «βαρόμετρο» έχει ήδη συλλέξει πολλά ενδιαφέροντα δημογραφικά και ποιοτικά στοιχεία.

Το κόστος μιας τέτοιας δημοσκόπησης

Το κόστος μιας τέτοιας μεγάλης και ουσιαστικής έρευνας είναι 7000€.
