story:
Here is the story of "One of the finest dining experiences in the world..."

"We've eaten at several of the restaurants rated in the top 10 in the world, and we enjoyed our evening at the Candle as much or more than any..."

How did a tiny, 16 seat restaurant in a town of 636 people with an untrained chef/owner in the panhandle of Idaho and a 17 year old sous chef end up with a world class reputation, and a three month waiting list for reservations?

Part of the mystique is the unconventional way we do things, the love we have for our guests, and our joy for what we do.

Almost 4 years in the making, this book is the fulfillment of a dream, and symbolizes the best of both, as we share our story, and the recipes that have become such favorites with our tribe. 

For anyone who loves cooking, eating or even just drooling over "food porn," this is a project you won't want to miss...

Steak S'mores, Potato Roses, Lobster Cappuccino, Maple Gratin, Pork Arrabiatta… over 250 step by step recipes, including "Home Chef" tips, all accompanied by full color, BEAUTIFUL photographs by acclaimed photographer Lauren Denos. This will be a treasure you will love for years to come, and your support of this program will make the final production possible.

This is going to be a first class, full color, 300+page "coffee table style" book, with "perfect" binding, hard cover, dust cover etc, that we hope to enter in the James Beard Cookbook awards, and you have a chance to secure one of the first copies. 

What we need...

To secure the first 1000 copies of the book will require $33,000, which covers all editing, formatting, publishing, fees and shipping. Any additional funds will go toward additional copies, and the production cost goes down per book the more copies we order. 

The books will retail at $40

So much of the "Candle Experience" is just that - the Experience, and we hope to share that with our supporters with several different packages of our finest!We are hopeful and optimistic that we will reach our fundraising goals, but all funds raised will help offset the initial run of the project and allow us to get it to you sooner.

 

We are asked, basically daily, "when our cookbook is coming out," and now as we near fruition on the project, the feeling of joy is almost indescribable. This project has always been one of passion and love, and we are so guest centered, that the ability to share what we do with our "family" brings tears to our eyes, and joy to our hearts.

We think that food and wine lovers of all sorts, from casual home cooks to talented amateurs to professional chefs will appreciate and be entertained by our story, and will love sharing their versions of our creations with their own friends and family. 

Your contribution will make this project a reality.

The Challenges were worth it!

The biggest hurdle for us was actually coordinating getting almost 300 photo quality recipes and photos finished, and as we said, it took us almost 4 years, but things happen for a reason, and the extra time let us refine what we do, and, in some ways, define who we are. We were able to finish all of the work, to the levels we wanted, and the recipes and photos are "in the can," as they say. We have secured the editing and the formatting, which are already progressing, and are hoping to move forward with the production within 8 weeks, and an initial delivery date to you of October 1, 

We are so thrilled with the quality of the photos - the "Art" - in the book, as well as the many extra little "Quick Diversions" that chat about wine and pairings, knives, pans, seasoning and more, that we hope this will make this book as entertaining as it is beautiful.

Please help us spread the word...

We know that not everyone can contribute, especially with the recent Covid 19 upheaval, and hey, not everyone cooks! Even if you can't contribute directly, we hope that you can perhaps share our project with the wine and food lovers in your life through the Indiegogo tools here.

We thank you for your support and look forward to sharing our "Casual Elegance" with you!

Steak S'mores, Potato Roses, Lobster Cappuccino, Maple Gratin, Pork Arrabiatta… over 250 step by step recipes, including "Home Chef" tips, all accompanied by full color, BEAUTIFUL photographs by acclaimed photographer Lauren Denos. This will be a treasure you will love for years to come, and your support of this program will make the final production possible.
This is going to be a first class, full color, 300+page "coffee table style" book, with "perfect" binding, hard cover, dust cover etc, that we hope to enter in the James Beard Cookbook awards, and you have a chance to secure one of the first copies. 
What we need...
To secure the first 1000 copies of the book will require $33,000, which covers all editing, formatting, publishing, fees and shipping. Any additional funds will go toward additional copies, and the production cost goes down per book the more copies we order. 
The books will retail at $40
So much of the "Candle Experience" is just that - the Experience, and we hope to share that with our supporters with several different packages of our finest!We are hopeful and optimistic that we will reach our fundraising goals, but all funds raised will help offset the initial run of the project and allow us to get it to you sooner.


 
We are asked, basically daily, "when our cookbook is coming out," and now as we near fruition on the project, the feeling of joy is almost indescribable. This project has always been one of passion and love, and we are so guest centered, that the ability to share what we do with our "family" brings tears to our eyes, and joy to our hearts.
We think that food and wine lovers of all sorts, from casual home cooks to talented amateurs to professional chefs will appreciate and be entertained by our story, and will love sharing their versions of our creations with their own friends and family. 
Your contribution will make this project a reality.
The Challenges were worth it!
The biggest hurdle for us was actually coordinating getting almost 300 photo quality recipes and photos finished, and as we said, it took us almost 4 years, but things happen for a reason, and the extra time let us refine what we do, and, in some ways, define who we are. We were able to finish all of the work, to the levels we wanted, and the recipes and photos are "in the can," as they say. We have secured the editing and the formatting, which are already progressing, and are hoping to move forward with the production within 8 weeks, and an initial delivery date to you of October 1, 

We are so thrilled with the quality of the photos - the "Art" - in the book, as well as the many extra little "Quick Diversions" that chat about wine and pairings, knives, pans, seasoning and more, that we hope this will make this book as entertaining as it is beautiful.
Please help us spread the word...

We know that not everyone can contribute, especially with the recent Covid 19 upheaval, and hey, not everyone cooks! Even if you can't contribute directly, we hope that you can perhaps share our project with the wine and food lovers in your life through the Indiegogo tools here.
We thank you for your support and look forward to sharing our "Casual Elegance" with you!

story:
Project Overview

Exposure is a large scale book of images and stories in honor of our humanity––a collection of courage, candor, grace, longing, and heartache. It's a storybook which seeks to bring the human condition out of its steel box of pretense, prejudice, and misunderstanding, and back into the light of an average life and ordinary heart. It asks us to look deep into the face of our authenticity, in order to excavate the beautiful, whole, vibrant people we were each born here to be. 

Our intent has been to explore both the diversity and kinship of the human experience through storytelling and portraiture. The images that fill the pages of this book are breathtaking in both their sincerity and simplicity. It’s as if you’re looking into the eyes of your sister, friend, neighbor, or plumber, and listening to their faithful stories of what it means to be an active participant in this world.

The collaborative process

We've called upon people from a wide range of life experiences, ages, and cultural backgrounds to participate in this project. We asked them to share stories from their lives which signified moments of impact or becoming. We then welcomed every participant into Kelly Shroads' Denver based photography studio to have their picture taken and share their stories with us, which were recorded and later transcribed by April Tierney, to ensure a reliable and unrehearsed rendering.  

Sitting with so many different people and looking into their eyes as they spoke about some of their most precious or painful memories, has been profound. Time and time again we have witnessed the incredible bravery that is required to move through difficult times, and the grace that is needed to navigate our way through this world. We see hundreds of people a day or week for which we know nothing about, and whom are each carrying their own weight in joy or grief. Some stories we have in common, while others we could have never imagined possible. By stepping through the doorway of another's reality, we are welcomed into a kinship with all of life.

Our story

Kelly Shroads graduated from the University of Colorado with a Fine Arts degree in Photography, and has pursued a path in art, portrait and lifestyle photography. Her work has been shown both locally and internationally. April Tierney has been writing poetry and short stories from the moment she could hold a pencil. Her first collection of poems, Singing to the Bones, was published last year. 

Kelly and April originally met in 2009 while working at a yoga studio in Denver, Colorado, and their friendship grew through a path of wellness and creativity. In 2015, Kelly reached out to April for inspiration in helping title some of her pieces. The coffee date started with this intention, but dovetailed into a deeper conversation about the human experience. 

April was a model for fourteen years, so we began to talk about our perspectives of being both in front of and behind the camera. We each expressed our dissatisfaction with the limited exposure to real life stories and images through mainstream media. We also spoke about our longing for there to be more grit, humility, depth and vulnerability within the dominant narrative, and how we wanted to provide other definitions of beauty and humanity through our creative work. At the end of this several-hour, soul-stirring conversation, we realized the seeds for this book were already being planted. Four years and many stories later, we find ourselves here today. 

Why crowdsourcing?

We have put a tremendous amount of trust into the higher purpose of this project, understanding that it is in service to something much greater than ourselves. The first person we interviewed was back in 2015, and since then over seventy people have entrusted their stories to the co-creation of this living, breathing vision. It is our great privilege to bring such a powerful collection out from the shadows, as a prayer that it might ripple out into the world and create meaningful change.  

This is where we ask for your help! 

The quality and standards that we hold for this book are high, as we seek to create a fine art photography collection. The costs needed for the final stages include editing, printing, and marketing. We have spent three years waist-deep in the creative process and another year submitting manuscript proposals to literary agents and publishers. What we discovered is that many publishing companies want predictability over originality. Our book represents something different; an anthology of unique voices which hold the power to cross into new territory and shift culture. All of this has made us realize that we are meant to publish this baby at the grassroots level!

So we are asking for help in raising $20,000 to independently publish Exposure by the spring of 2020. We can no longer do this alone, and would be sincerely humbled and grateful beyond measure for your contribution.

story:
Summary & Impact

This is more than just a children’s book - it’s a tribute to my late husband, Bari Greenberg.  The lessons in the story are the ones Bari would have personally passed on to our son, Aidan, had Bari not died suddenly in 2014.  So part of this is to give Aidan that connection to his father.

But it’s also something I believe children need to hear in this day of super hero popularity.  The message they can be heroic, too, just by being kind, honest, and thoughtful.

Bari was brilliant but socially awkward growing up.  He was bullied and picked on often, but instead of retaliating or turning bitter, he told me he made the conscious choice to always “be the hero”, which I thought was extraordinary for a child to have decided.  When our son was born 5 months after Bari died, I knew I wanted that lesson passed on to Aidan.  It took me 2 years to write the book and another 2 years to find the right artist.

What We Need & What You Get

Now that we are nearing the layout and print stages, it's time to seek funding.  That’s where I'm hoping you come in.  Not only can you get the book for yourself and the children in your life, but you can bring this message to any group of children to whom you wish to gift it.  Teachers are always in need of more books in their classrooms, especially ones with positive messages.  You can give one book to a class, enough for a reading group, or even gift one book to each child in a grade level.

Funds will be used for production costs, and to reimburse what I have already invested in this project, including paying my artist, Kathryn McGehee.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risks are the ones I’ve already taken.  This project is important to me, and while I hope to get back my financial investment, the project will be completed even if I don’t reach my goal.

Other Ways You Can Help


Please share this campaign with anyone you think may be interested!  I would love to see this book in the hands of as many children as possible.

story:
Summary—

I'm Heidi Green: a writer and artist, and I'm writing a book!

This is the incredible story of a Zookeeper's daughter, born in Burma almost a century ago, who is forced to seek refuge in a monastery during WWII. Based on historic events, it is an inspiring story of one girl's journey to find courage, redemption, and even magic, in the midst of war.  

I'm inviting my community to participate in crowdfunding the production of this book because I believe this is a powerful story that the world needs to hear. Rather than simply ask for donations, I'm offering beautiful artworks, prints and books in exchange to those who support.

Artworks will be provided upfront. Presale books will be shipped AFTER the book production is complete. (Artworks are listed at the bottom of the page).
 


What is needed—

Writing and researching a century-old story, based in a closed-off country that has been at war for 80 years, is a challenge. I initially spent one week in Myanmar, undertaking the preliminary research and story outline, but in order to  finish the book, I must now return to Myanmar in February. I'll walk through my story's journey, fact check historic details, research characters and locations on site. I will then need to cover costs of editing, proofing, illustrating and self publishing the book. Basic costs are as follows.



February Research and writing Trip to Myanmar — $4k+ AUD 

Costs include flights ($450AUD), visas ($150AUD), insurance ($50), accommodation ($400++) and travel expenses ($600+) of a one month budget tour of all story locations: to interview, document, research, source historic documents, and fact check. The final portion of this trip ($2500AUD), involves a very unique intensive ten day political/spiritual/cultural tour behind closed doors of Myanmar. I will be introduced to some of the founding monks and monasteries of modern Buddhism, political leaders, and be invited into the private home of Aung San Suu Kyi, Myanmar's political leader and daughter of Major-General Aung San (who led the Burmese rebellion during WWII and will feature in my book). This tour will be joined by my mentor, Alan Clements; a Buddhist monk, political journalist, activist and author of 40 years based in Burma, and the entire trip will play an invaluable role in establishing the hidden stories, culture, locations and  characters of Myanmar, which will shape my story. 


Editing, Illustration + Publishing costs — $6-15k++

The costs of producing any piece of print can vary wildly, depending on volume, printing style, paper and binding. I will be looking at a minimum of $6-10k AUD+ as a starting price for an illustrated book. The more money I raise, the higher the quality of printing and volume. After printing, I will work with a distributor to stock my book in Singapore, Bali and Australia, followed by a promotional campaign and launch (the costs of which are not included here yet). I will also need to raise money to pay for proofreading and editing of the book (costs not included) along with illustrating all images myself based on historic documents, using watercolour canvases. These material costs sit around $300-600. 

In total these costs could be anywhere from $10-20K+ AUD, and these are hard costs, not including my time in writing, illustrating, or getting feedback from my writer friends. So in short, whatever money I raise during this crowdfunding campaign will all help! 
 


Impact—

By supporting this book, you will help me in gifting the world with some of the most powerful, untold stories of Burma and it's history. You will become part of a vision in bringing stories of feminine courage and artistic beauty to a wider audience: encouraging children, adults, and young girls to seek bravery, peace, love and healing amidst a collapsing world. In addition, by supporting this book, you will have the chance to support a debut artist and writer in sharing her craft. I believe that today's world is waiting for stories like this, and I am a vessel. I've always had a special gift in telling and illustrating beautiful stories, and I'd be thrilled to receive your support in bringing that gift to a wider audience.


Risks, Challenges + Experience—

There is always the risk that things won't go according to plan in a complex project like this, however, I have great faith in the process, for several reasons.

Publishing Experience —

Despite being a debut novelist, I have worked for almost two decades in the publishing and design industries, creating numerous publications, books, magazines and print projects from start to finish for agencies, clients, and my own design studio. I've won awards, separately, for all of my illustrations, writing and printed design work. I work well under pressure, and truly believe that the complexity of this project will bring out the best in my diverse skills. 

Mentorship + Peer support —

Beyond my own experience, I have a brilliant peer support when it comes to writing the book. I have many writer and artist friends, including my closest friend (a talented editor and ex BBC journalist), my writing mentor (a long-time political writer and bestselling author in Myanmar), and my long time advertising copywriter colleague (who is also an award-winning screenwriter and best-selling author). The support of these creative peers will hold me powerfully to account, and provide much guidance in proofing outlines, drafts and narratives. 
 





Culture, War, History + Research —

It won't be easy to recreate the landscape, culture and events of Burma a century ago. However I feel well suited to the intensity of this task, especially given my love of history, passed down to me by my father (a historical print dealer). My father also served in the military for a decade, and I descend from many soldiers who served in Asia. Two of my Great Uncles worked on the Burmese Railway. My Grandfather served in Malaysia. My father's namesake was a Colonel in Korea, and my Paternal Grandfather was one of the soldiers involved in famously digging out of a WWII prison camp, popularised by the movie the 'Great Escape'. My understanding of WWII in Asia, and appreciation for colonial and Asian history, is solid. 

Writing the characters —

When it comes to telling the story of a brave little girl who sets off alone in a war, I feel well equipped to draw on my own experiences. I was one of eight children, raised in a nomadic family. We lived in an aboriginal desert community when I was small, and I spent many years exploring the rainforest without adults. At age of 12 I became possibly the youngest unaccompanied child to free-climb a remote 10 kilometre stretch of 15 waterfalls in Queensland. Over the last decade I've been raising my own children across four different countries in the Asia Pacific region; hiking, camping, and travelling extensively.

I also understand monastic life and the path of spirituality, having been raised as a preachers daughter, the niece of a nun, and spending years living in Hindu and Buddhist countries. In almost every way, I believe I'm perfectly slated to tell this story: of a girl who finds peace and courage through adventure, spirituality and war in the tropics. In many ways I feel this story was actually GIFTED to me, and I am very excited to be the vessel to tell it. 


I'd love your support!
However, if you can't donate, here are other ways to help —

1. Get the word out and share my campaign with friends and networks.  
You can do so for the next 60 days! Until the end of February. 

2. Tell your friends to buy my artwork or prepurchase the book.

3. Please consider supporting me as an artist. 
You can do so by purchasing art prints to suit any budget.... 
Either for yourself, or as gifts! 



 

Available Artwork Prints are shown above, rotating clockwise:

1, Bikinis on the reef
2. The Zookeepers Daughter
3. Lost at the Circus,
4. Swimming with Dolphins, dreaming of Eagles
5. Hiking through the Jungle in a crochet Dress 

If you'd like OTHER prints not listed here, I sell them separately. Please contact me. Thats all for now... Thank you my darling friends!!
 

Heidi Green x

story:
A Happy Accident

It's been said that some of the greatest discoveries were made by accident. While believable, I never believed this would happen to me. Until it did.

My name is Richard Coutts. While developing advanced software technology, I accidentally discovered why we dream. Yes. I know. I was skeptical too. So, I spent the past fourteen years investigating my discovery, conducting studies, publishing papers, and reviewing tens of thousands of dreams. In short, I became a dream researcher. I'm now ready to tell the world why we dream.

The Evidence

My theory is called emotional selection. As the name implies, it is a lot like natural selection. However, unlike natural selection, emotional selection employs dreams while you sleep.

For those interested in checking out my other papers and studies, the Wikipedia page has their links. The wiki and my papers are VERY jargony, so typically appeal only to psychiatrists, neurologists, and psychologists.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emotional_selection.

Rest assured! The book is written for all ages and backgrounds. However, it is NOT dumbed-down. Rather, the book form is the ideal form to expand on the ideas and buzzwords behind the theory.

I've also given presentations to Harvard's Center for Sleep and Cognition and at International Association for the Study of Dreams (IASD). Below is a shortened, 25-minute video of these presentations.

 

Dreaming of Needs

My papers and book show empirical evidence that dreams center around our basic human needs as described by the psychologist Abraham Maslow. In other words, we dream about relationships, work, sex, protecting ourselves, etc., because we strive to meet these needs during waking.

 

Dreaming Away Divorce:

A Case Study

My mentor, Dr. Rosalind Cartwright, published an amazing study in 1991 showing people undergoing divorce coped better if they had upsetting dreams about their spouse. As I describe in the book, her findings are beautifully explained by my theory of emotional selection.

Here's a graphic showing how emotional selection helps one of Dr. Cartwright's participants cope with divorce.

When Dreams Come True

    My upcoming study collected the dream reports of over 1600 participants and found that their dream content predicted aspects of their future with statistical significance!

    The book will be timed with the release of my upcoming paper and contain a description of these exciting study findings, and much, much more. As a funder, you will be the first to receive this insight. 

    The Special Edition

    This special, crowdfunding edition will not be available to the general public:

    • Heavy Paper: 60#
    • Perfect Bound Cover: Gloss
    • Additional writing not included in the public release version, including the story behind my accidental discovery and all four scientific papers and three studies supporting the emotional selection theory of dreaming.

    Please Help!

    Discovering and exploring the root source of dreaming was an undertaking much larger than myself. Several people have generously helped me over the years including psychologists, psychiatrists, neurologists. My Somerville writers group, friends, and family have spent countless hours helping me turn my theory into words for a general audience.

    Charles Darwin's theory was simple, so he wrote On The Origin of Species by Means of Natural Selection for the general public. 

    My dream theory is equally simple, so I too wrote Emotional Selection: Dreams, Dreaming, and the Nightly Evolution of your Mind for the general public.

    My book manuscript is done, but I need your help to hire editors and other publishing professionals to make my book a reality.

    Please consider purchasing a perk on this page. If you have friends or family who are interested in dreams or might be interested in helping me attain my dream, please use the share tools on this page to spread the word.

    Thank you!

    -Rich

    P.S.

    If there's a Perk you'd like that's not listed (e.g., bundle X4), or if you'd just like to get in touch, please email me at richard@richardcoutts.com.

story:
The Fourth Dimension:

Haunted Throughout Time

 

In my fourth book I am taking a step away from fiction and will be focusing on true tales of hauntings and ghosts that have plagued myself and my family and friends for generations. What used to be campfire stories for my family will now be available for the world to read.

 

I have spent countless hours collecting stories from my family and friends to include in this installment. In the research required for this book, I was stunned to see how many similarities the stories had and how many "ghosts" visited multiple people at different times.

 

The book will be edited by Amy Mead. Roman Jossart of Studio 605 put together the video for the book pitch. This is truly a group effort from every aspect of my life and I can't wait to share it with the world.

The book will be published in May 2019 and shipped to those who preorder by early June. Each preorder will be signed. The preorder price and the Amazon price will be the same, so if you miss the preorder the book will be available for purchase via Amazon in May.

story:
*Diese Crowdfunding Kampagne ist in englischer Sprache, aber das Buch wird auch auf Deutsch erscheinen. Unter "Einstellungen" lassen sich deutsche Untertitel für das Video einblenden. Alle Informationen befinden sich auf Deutsch meiner Website.

 

Summary

Hi, I’m Caro. I’m a trained communications designer, art psychotherapist and family therapist with a great passion for books. I discovered my dream job by combining the skills of my professional backgrounds to create psychosocial media that benefits young people and the professionals who work with them.

As a therapist I've worked extensively with teenage girls and have supported them through their struggles. I also still remember my own puberty and how frightening it felt when my body started to change. Suddenly there was a great deal of pressure to look a certain way: you had to shave your legs and armpits, stay in shape, wear make-up, ... and then there was menstruation to deal with. Bleeding definitely seemed to be something embarrassing, something one had to hide while it was happening. I still remember a blood stain on the bottom of a fellow student's jeans at school. The whole class was laughing about it. She looked terrified.

Today, times are slowly changing, but many teenage girls are still embarrassed about their bodies and feel the need to hide their cycles. I want to create this book because I strongly believe that girls can learn to embrace their menstruation and develop a sense of pride for who they are. We can all help them gain agency and start a conversation on a wider social level.

Girls can be encouraged to define their very own rite of passage on their journey to womanhood (whatever that may mean to them, individually). My goal is to spread this message as widely as possible and to reach teenage girls in different parts of the world. 
Please support this project in order to help me create and independently publish the book in both German and English.

What We Need & What You Get

By funding my project you will support my work on the following steps:

Step 1: Research – participative workshops with girls, interviews with women & girls, and research of relevant literature 

Step 2: Creation – content design & text, illustration and graphic design 

(as well as regularly checking in with girls to see if they like what I'm doing)

Step 3: Translation between German & English

Step 4: Print, publishing and shipping

I will keep you updated every step of the way on social media. You can follow my progress here: www.instagram.com/kids_cocreate or here: www.facebook.com/kidscocreate

 

There'll also be items for teens (and grown-ups), such as postcards, an eco-friendly tote bag and a personal "Moon Diary". Hopefully, these will help raise even more awareness!

 

The Impact

I decided to turn to crowdfunding because I want to start a healthy conversation about menstruation to stop ignorance and body shaming. Sharing the creation process on social media will hopefully raise awareness for this important topic.  We can all support teenage girls in gaining greater agency through their bodies by embracing their menstruation and cycles.

Your support will help me to create and independently and widely publish the book in both German and English. Self-publishing will allow me to keep full control over the content. This is important to me, as I would like to keep this project free of commercial interference. I have long-standing experience in editorial design as well as an extensive network of professional colleagues (including therapists and human rights workers, amongst others) many of whom have agreed to support this project. I also intend to closely work with girls throughout the entire process. 

To see some of my past work, you can check out some of my recent projects at www.kidscocreate.design

 

Risks & Challenges

I will be personally responsible for each of the steps described above. This project is very dear to my heart, so I intend to create and publish this book under, pretty much, any circumstance. The funds raised will allow me to focus my energy on performing comprehensive research and on creating and publishing the book. My planning includes a very realistic timeline, which allows for a few things to go wrong or for the project to take longer – without jeopardising the delivery date (est. early December 2021).

Of course, there are always things we can't predict in this world but I'll do everything possible to deliver both the project and your rewards, as soon as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support my project financially, please just spread the word and share my campaign. 

This book aims to reflect viewpoints from girls and women (as well as non-binary and transgender teens, boys and men) from a diversity of backgrounds. Please send me an email to caro@kidscocreate.design if you're interested in participating in a research interview or focus group – or if you have another contribution in mind.

Join me on this journey and help me get this book into the hands of the girls (and all other teenagers) who could benefit from it. I deeply believe that we all have much to gain from empowering our future generations!

story:
Short Summary

     This funding campaign is for the first of three books I want to create to preserve the hidden history of my hometown of Coeburn, Virginia. This tiny corner of the Appalachian Mountains has, at various times, been the center of geologic violence, a hunter's paradise, a farmer's haven, and a wild-west boomtown. The sum of the drama that has occurred in this one little spot on the globe is nearly unimaginable. 

     For the past nine years I have sought out every story and fact I could possibly find about the history of Coeburn and surrounding communities. I've scoured online archives, traveled to libraries and courthouses in multiple states, and conducted personal interviews with people in-the-know. Some of my findings, in short form, have already been shared on Coeburn Reflector. But many others have not, especially the longer stories. So I think now is the perfect time to put them to paper and ink, so that others can enjoy them too. 

     This campaign is designed to raise money to complete my research and publish the first of the three volume work. The information for the first volume has been gathered from numerous places over a period of years, and some of it was very difficult to find. Certain info is not available unless you dig through obscure records in courthouses and university archives. And a few of the things learned from interviews and correspondence are totally unique, and unavailable anywhere else. I believe this info should be gathered and put into print form, so that everyone who reads the book will get a better understanding of what life in Coeburn was really like for our ancestors. 

     Your support for this project will help create a special history book that both you and future generations will be able to enjoy. I really hope to see these books being read in local schools, libraries, and many homes. And you get to help make that happen. 


About The Author: 

     I grew up on Caney Ridge, just inside Dickenson County, but attended elementary and high schools in Coeburn. I also lived in Coeburn when I first got married and started a family. So even though I have not resided there for decades, I do still have kinfolk there, and Coeburn will always be my hometown. 

    Almost all my professional experience has been in the engineering and entertainment fields, so I am sure there are others who are more qualified to write a history book. My writing has thus far been limited to a few songs, essays, and short film scripts, and my publishing experience can be summarized as the editing and layout of a single biography and its two subsequent revisions.

     I am also not a trained historian, but local history has been my serious hobby for about thirty years. So a great deal of my free time has gone into digging out tiny nuggets of the past, anywhere I could find them. Now and then, the tedium made it feel a bit like wasting time, but sooner or later I would run across some marvelous story that had been forgotten for ages, and I felt instantly captivated again. 

     "So who were these people that came before us?"  

     "Well, they were exactly like us. Except, different." 

     For me, history seems like a mysterious, fuzzy window into the past, that somehow doubles as a shaky crystal ball into the future. And I love to peek through both. 


What We Need: 

     To make this project work, we will need the support of many others who also feel a connection to Coeburn, Virginia. We need not only your financial support, but also your participation and encouragement. 

     And we certainly need your best gossip. We want you to tell anyone who will listen, "Those people over there are up to something, and you need to see what it is!" 


What You Get: 

     The dollar goal for this campaign is $2,500, which is the minimum I believe it will take to produce and ship the book that I have envisioned. If the campaign should not reach the full dollar amount but does hit the $1,500 mark, then I will still create a book for those who have donated, but will not make any subsequent volumes. And if the campaign should not reach $1,500, then I will either return the funds or extend the campaign deadline. 

     Funds raised will go toward research and travel expenses, publishing costs, shipping supplies, and postage to get the perks to you. Due to the initial expense of purchasing ISBN numbers in small quantities, plus the crowdfunding fees, each copy of this first volume will cost about $5.00 more than I wish it did. But the second volume will be less, since the ISBN number and some of the shipping supplies will already have been purchased. 

     In addition to the book, there are some unique Coeburn perks available for the smaller contributions. I have tried to make the perks unique and available over a wide range of contribution levels. There is a Coeburn bookmark and four different styles of Coeburn posters that are perks for smaller contributions. And on the other end of the scale, there is a lunch-with-the-author package. But the perk that excites me most is the Library Patron package, which lets you get two books, one for yourself and one to be donated to a library in your name. 


Book Design: 

     Instead of making one large, pricey hard-cover book of about 500 pages, I intend to make three smaller soft-cover volumes containing the same material. This will make each volume more economical to produce, quicker to deliver, and more fulfilling to create. Plus, the fans of Coeburn, Virginia will have the option to support either one, two, or all three book projects. 

          This particular funding campaign is ONLY for the first volume, but below are the descriptions for all three book projects: 
 

* Hidden History of Coeburn, Virginia, Volume 1 *

     I have already done most of the research for the first volume, and expect it to be completed within six months. If the project is fully funded, I will travel to the state library in Richmond to gather some specific materials about early Coeburn which have probably not been viewed for a century. Plus, there are a few libraries and courthouses on this end of the state that I want to visit for specific information. 

     The first volume will be a 6" x 9" soft-cover of about 120 pages, with about 20-30% of the pages having images (i.e. photos, drawings, maps, etc.). This should leave room for a text of about 21,000 words. The book will have self-contained articles of varying lengths, so you will not need to read it from cover-to-cover to enjoy it. 
 

* Hidden History of Coeburn, Virginia, Volume 2*

     The second volume will be a continuation of the first, with a similar book design, and should be completed about four months after the first. 

     There will be a separate funding campaign for the second volume. 
 

* Hidden History of Coeburn, Virginia, Volume 3 *

     The third volume has a different design, still a soft-cover 6" x 9", but having approximately 200-400 pages. It will be a collection of biographical sketches, family stories, and family photos of the people who live, or have lived, in Coeburn communities. Materials for this book will be provided by the families who choose to participate. I will provide guidance about the materials, editing of the photos and text for publication, and putting the book together for publication. 

     There will be a separate funding campaign for the third volume. 


Risks & Challenges 

     One challenge in publishing a book is to make sure all images used are cleared for copyright purposes. I expect it will be quite a logistical challenge to get permission for all the images, maps, etc. that I want to use in the book. Fortunately, my engineering background provided me with skills to keep track of a large amount of detailed data.  

     But the trickiest thing might actually be delivering all the perks to the backers. There are potentially hundreds of items to be mailed to hundreds of addresses, which leaves plenty of opportunity for a mistake. But we do promise to be very careful, and to promptly fix anything that should go awry. 


Other Ways You Can Help

     People who can't contribute to the fundraiser can still help with this project: 

     Please share this campaign on Facebook with your family members, friends, co-workers, and anyone else who might be interested in a book about Coeburn. You can easily do this by clicking on the Facebook icon at the top of the page.

Thank y'all so very much for your encouragement and support!

Wade & Dee Kenady

If the project is fully funded, I will travel to the state library in Richmond to gather some specific materials about early Coeburn which have probably not been viewed for a century. Plus, there are a few libraries and courthouses on this end of the state that I want to visit for specific information. 
     The first volume will be a 6" x 9" soft-cover of about 120 pages, with about 20-30% of the pages having images (i.e. photos, drawings, maps, etc.). This should leave room for a text of about 21,000 words. The book will have self-contained articles of varying lengths, so you will not need to read it from cover-to-cover to enjoy it.  
* Hidden History of Coeburn, Virginia, Volume 2*
     The second volume will be a continuation of the first, with a similar book design, and should be completed about four months after the first. 
     There will be a separate funding campaign for the second volume.  
* Hidden History of Coeburn, Virginia, Volume 3 *
     The third volume has a different design, still a soft-cover 6" x 9", but having approximately 200-400 pages. It will be a collection of biographical sketches, family stories, and family photos of the people who live, or have lived, in Coeburn communities. Materials for this book will be provided by the families who choose to participate. I will provide guidance about the materials, editing of the photos and text for publication, and putting the book together for publication. 
     There will be a separate funding campaign for the third volume. 

Risks & Challenges 
     One challenge in publishing a book is to make sure all images used are cleared for copyright purposes. I expect it will be quite a logistical challenge to get permission for all the images, maps, etc. that I want to use in the book. Fortunately, my engineering background provided me with skills to keep track of a large amount of detailed data.  
     But the trickiest thing might actually be delivering all the perks to the backers. There are potentially hundreds of items to be mailed to hundreds of addresses, which leaves plenty of opportunity for a mistake. But we do promise to be very careful, and to promptly fix anything that should go awry. 

Other Ways You Can Help
     People who can't contribute to the fundraiser can still help with this project: 
     Please share this campaign on Facebook with your family members, friends, co-workers, and anyone else who might be interested in a book about Coeburn. You can easily do this by clicking on the Facebook icon at the top of the page.Thank y'all so very much for your encouragement and support!
Wade & Dee Kenady

story:
"I spent the day searching through the galleries of nineteenth century European and American painting again, hoping to find someone depicted there. I was looking for a shade of hair, for a particular kind of nose, for a wry mouth, for the right dates to match the age of the sitter. I needed to recover some lost things; physical objects that might still exist, and might not, and could be anywhere in the world. Outside it was raining cherry blossoms on the dark pavement, and the wet taxis inching down Fifth Avenue were the same bright yellow as the forsythia blooming on the edges of the park. Naturally my search was forensic in nature. I’d need to consult experts. I’d want a 3-D computer recreation of a face like they have on TV shows about ancient emperors or murdered cavemen found in bogs. But no one was murdered in this story. There’s just a woman, who was forgotten, but should not have been..."

The book The Parisian Sphinx, a mystery and a treasure hunt, is the remarkable true story of the life and lost work of French painter and model Victorine Meurent, who burst onto the 19th century Parisian art scene in a swirl of color and scandal, changing the face of modern art forever. Despite being ridiculed in the press by critics who considered her an abomination, the bold and unconventional Victorine devoted herself to her craft until her own work hung in the same galleries as that of the men who painted her

Art historians initially wrote that she died young as an alcoholic prostitute, penniless and old before her time. None of that was true, but it would be fifty years before modern researchers began to piece Victorine's real life back together again, and another forty before her lost paintings would begin to reappear.

Victorine lived through revolutions, barricades, and war. She traveled overseas. She met and befriended some of the most famous creative minds of her time, hung out at the Moulin Rouge, was spotted among the pioneers of the 19th century Parisian lesbian scene, and was said to be in a love triangle with a courtesan and a Russian prince. The clues of her life hint at an epically scaled tale of passion, determination, and a love that the world wasn't ready to accept.

Meticulously researched and told in a novelistic style to evoke the lushness of her lost world, The Parisian Sphinx is a tribute to women, the creative spirit, and the search for truth.

Summer Brennan is an award-winning investigative journalist and author, born and raised in Northern California. She received the 2016 Matthew Power Literary Reporting Award, and was a visiting scholar at the Arthur L. Carter Journalism Institute at New York University. Her first book, The Oyster War: The True Story of a Small Farm, Big Politics, and the Future of Wilderness in America, published in August 2015, was shortlisted for the Orion Book Award and was a finalist for the Northern California Independent Booksellers Award. Her second book, High Heel, part of the Object Lessons series from Bloomsbury, will be published on March 21st 2019. She has written for New York Magazine, The Paris Review, Scientific American, Longreads, Pacific Standard, McSweeneys, The Millions, Lit Hub, Buzzfeed, The Rumpus, The San Francisco Chronicle, and others. She received a bachelor’s from Bennington College, where she studied painting and poetry, and a master’s from NYU’s Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, where she studied journalism and Middle Eastern politics. A longtime communications consultant at the United Nations, she worked on special political issues from 2008 to 2010—including decolonization, atomic radiation, outer space technologies, and the Middle East—and on nuclear weapons, disarmament, and international security from 2011 to 2015. Other UN projects include work on the environment, gender equality, human rights, and the UN Global Ebola Response.

The Parisian Sphinx is already under contract, with an advance, but more funding is needed to complete the reporting and writing process, which has required frequent international travel. She first began working on this project fifteen years ago, in 2004.

While self publishing can be a great avenue for many authors, The Parisian Sphinx is not a self-published book. It will be traditionally published in hardcover by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt, which has been making gorgeous books beloved by readers the world over since 1832. It will have a team of editors, designers, typesetters and indexers, and receive a new, professionally designed cover.

I'm raising funds to help cover the costs of my remaining reporting and writing for The Parisian Sphinx. Books that require lots of international travel and extensive archival research to complete are very expensive to produce. I've been researching the book for many years, and have already done on-the-ground reporting in three countries, facilitated by the Power Award magazine article and my book advance. Thanks to the contributions received through this campaign I have been able to extend my research, and the book will be published in May 2020. I'm asking backers to pre-order the book (or to get other perks) to help me cover about half of the remaining costs to get the book from my brain and laptop to your hands and local bookstores.

    I will receive 52% of all donations to support my writing and reporting, while 40% will go towards the professionally produced, traditionally published books sent as perks and their shipping costs—The Parisian Sphinx will be in hardcover, with a completely new design, and The Oyster War and High Heel are high quality softcover, as pictured. An additional 8% will go to IndieGoGo's percentage and credit card fees.

    Since first learning about her more than fifteen years ago, I have been fascinated by the mystery of what really happened to Victorine Meurent and her lost paintings. I hoped that an investigative journalist would be able to bring a different skillset when it came to reconstructing her biography that could complement what was already being done by curators and art historians. The more I dug into her story and the more I discovered about her life, the clearer it became to me why the patriarchal critics and biographers of her time had tried to erase her. Women, people of color, and members of the LGBTQ community have always been an important part of history, but too often their stories are forgotten or intentionally left out. To uncover what really happened and restore the full impact of these individuals' influence can require a process of painstaking excavation—which is what I am trying to do here. It is important to tell these stories as soon as possible before more of the primary documents needed to do so are lost to time.

    I have done this before. A little less than a year before my first book The Oyster War was published, I found I needed more funds to complete my research. So I did a flexible IndieGoGo campaign to pre-sell books and help cover those costs. Nothing fancy; I didn't have a video and I couldn't do much outreach due to work. I didn't meet my full goal that time, but the funds I did receive helped out a great deal. I am able to purchase my own books at a deep discount, so as soon as the finished books were available I ordered enough copies, inscribed and signed them, and mailed them out to my generous backers.

    The Parisian Sphinx is under contract and is scheduled to be published in May 2020. I cannot promise that every leg of reporting work will yield material that makes it into the book—will the unclaimed painting in X city's museum turn out to be her lost masterpiece? I can't say. Nevertheless, I can promise you that if you pre-order a copy of The Parisian Sphinx, you will receive a beautifully designed hardcover, signed and inscribed by me, as soon as they are available.

    Who is the other woman in Manet's nude painting of Victorine, Olympia, the clothed one holding the bouquet of flowers?

    Her name was Laure, and she was another artist model working in Paris at that time. Manet described her as "une trés belle Negresse" in his sketchbook: "a very beautiful black woman." She is also in the book.

    You have a nice, established publisher. Why are you crowdfunding?

    Book advances are not what they once were, and it is often the case that the book advances given to non-celebrity authors are not actually enough to cover the costs of writing the book. This can be especially true of books that require extensive research or travel—and this book requires both.

    Can't afford a perk but want to help out anyway? Have your perk selected but still want to do more? You can help me tell Victorine's story and find out what happened to her missing paintings by sharing this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr or Instagram, or by emailing it to book-loving friends. You can use Indiegogo's share tools to do this, or you can cut and past the website url. Use the hashtag #ParisianSphinx.  Tag me on Twitter if you like, and I'll do my best to respond <3

    Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my project! It is an honor to be able to pursue professionally a topic filled with so much color and light. My hope is that I can then give that color and light back to you.

    With deepest gratitude,

    Summer

story:
After researching and writing for more than a year, I am near ready to publish The Serpent’s Tail.  At 156 pages, the project traces the rich and fascinating history of Khmer classical dance by examining its roots as a prayer in movement and its more than 1,000-year course of evolution.  Analyzing textual sources and oral stories, sculpture and painting, photography and video, I invoke the art form’s past to offer new possibilities for its present and future.

The Serpent’s Tail will be completely accessible online, free of charge to students, artists, scholars, and enthusiasts all over the world.  It is an extremely meaningful project as, to my knowledge, this is the first time a practitioner will be writing an entire history of the ancient art form. 

The tradition needs you.

The Serpent’s Tail has been a labor of love and devotion initiated without any sources of funding.  It is so necessary as ninety percent of Khmer classical dance artists died during a genocide in the 1970s, taking with them valuable techniques, approaches, and stories.  Since then the art form has existed in a vulnerable and fragile landscape without proper sources of support.  Khmer people, although they cherish and celebrate the tradition, often have very little understanding of it because there are very few written sources of quality. 

How can we claim to love something that we do not know?  And how can we take care of and grow something if we do not comprehend it deep down to its core?  As Chheng Phon, Cambodia’s former Minister of Culture, has said:  

“If you do not know your culture, you cannot bring something new to the culture. People are the masters and the products of their history.”

Elaborating on this, Ted Shawn—the father of modern dance—explains why this art form and its history is important for all: 

"Tagore cried in one of his poems, 'Who can strain the blue from the sky?' How can I then, strain from these dances of ancient Khmer their adorable perfume, color and rhythm and bring them home to America? . . . If the dancing in any one country is truly great, it must have been founded on principles which are true everywhere, and thus the study of these principles is of value to every country."

Illustration by Jacob Kincheloe, courtesy of the artist.

Small Gesture, Big Impacts.

I am seeking 60 good people to donate $50 or more, bringing my base fundraising goal to $3,000.  These funds will be used to:

-       Pay for web hosting fees.  Cost: $200.

-       Pay for the commission of a “cover image” by Jacob Kincheloe, a nationally exhibited visual artist who currently teaches at the San Francisco Art Institute.  Cost: $1,000.

-       Pay for image licensing fees for works by August Rodin, Andy Warhol, and more.  Cost: $800.

-       Pay for translation of The Serpent’s Tail into Khmer.  Cost: $1,000.

All donors will be formally thanked and listed on the website once it goes live.  You will be immortalized as a caretaker of Khmer classical dance, ensuring that people today and those of the future have access to the art form’s compelling history.  Through this, you are cultivating the next generation of artists who will breathe new life and magic into their ancient heritage.  You are nurturing an informed and engaged audience, one that is readily equipped with the foundation and vocabulary to help those artists thrive and succeed.  In sum, you are working with me to transform a legacy of loss into one of wholesome, vibrant rebuilding that pushes for new heights.

A history of quality (reviews of past works).

Dr. Rosemary Candelario, Asian Theatre Journal:

“A sampeah kru ritual of a sort: an offering to teachers living and deceased and to Moni Mekhala [the Goddess of the Ocean] herself.”

Cecily Cook, Senior Program Officer, Asian Cultural Council - New York: 

"[An] enlightening and engaging exploration of one of the most important works in the Cambodian dance drama repertory... A love letter to the character of Moni Mekhala and all of the women who have safeguarded this exquisite art form for generations, this book is a testament to the power of myth in our everyday lives."
Dr. Deborah Wong, Professor of Music, University of California – Riverside:
"This book is profoundly artist-centered and thus offers an utterly unique and intimate account of Khmer classical dance. This is the first book to acknowledge how gender and sexuality can be interrogated through Khmer dance, whether in the distant Cambodian past, in a post-genocide present, or in Long Beach, California."

story:
Hello, My name is J. Cynthia Brooks and I want to thank you so much for visiting my campaign. Some of you know I've been an actor and dancer my entire life, perhaps most notable, I was a contract player on the daytime series Days Of Our Lives. Always pretty healthy.

A few years after I left 'Days', I was diagnosed with cancer. I was told by several oncologists if I didn't get surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation treatments, I would not live beyond 2 years. The cancer was that aggressive and had already made it into some of my lymph nodes. Yet even with all the conventional western medicine treatments, there was no guarantee I would live.

I had been dabbling in what is called Alternative (or natural) medicine for quite some time and after a tremendous amount of research, I decided to treat my cancer using only Alternative medicine.

It worked, I was completely cured of cancer in 8 months and have been cancer free now for the 18 years. I always have fun telling people the lab. had to send my pathology test results back 3 times, they couldn't believe my cell rehabilitation either! They thought they had the wrong patient!

A few months after my clean bill of health, my close friends encouraged me to write a book about my journey through curing myself, not only the miraculous and multiple natural ways I stumbled upon to heal ones body of any disease, but also what I went through emotionally, spiritually and personally. That part was defiantly what I like to call 'Mr. Toad's wild ride'!

I somehow just knew I needed to treat myself mind body and spirit. I went to all kinds of different spiritual, metaphysical and meditation centers. Some of which are controversial still to this day. I was also going through a lot personally, my grandfather (who I adored) was killed, my finances and carrier were crashing and a great deal of heartache over my old boyfriend I was still carrying a torch for who is now a rather famous actor.

I was introduced to a book agent, he took the outline of my book to publishers and they were all interested. But as talks continued more and more I was being told what I could and couldn't say, some of which was very important for other people to know in self-healing. It became clearer and clearer to me this was not the time to publish this book, at least not that way. So I decided to wait.

All these years later, I'm so glad I did. A classic example is 18 years ago, people thought I was insane for taking probiotic's, if they even knew what they were. Now, as you can see in advertising, they are in just about everything!

This year, I felt it was time to publish my book. Whether it be self published or with a publisher that will allow me to tell my truth.

Your contributions will make that happen.

Costs include-

DEVELOPMENTAL EDITING-

$45-65/hour based on the experience of the editor

70,000/250 = 280 pages

280 pages /5 pages per hour = 56 hours

Low end is 56 x $45 = $2,520

High end is = $18,200

COPYEDITING-

2-10 manuscript pages/hour

$25-50/hour based on the experience of the editor

Low end: $840

High end: $7,000 (if it needs a lot of work)

COVER DESIGN. BOOKS ARE JUDGED BY THEIR COVERS-

Low end: $150

High end: $3,500

FORMATTING FOR PRINT AND DIGITAL CONVERSION-

Low end: Free

High end: $2,500 or more based on interactivity and pages, according to book design maven Joel Friedlander.

GETTING REVIEWS PRE-PUBLICATION-

Cost of review from Kirkus: $425

Cost of review from BlueInk Reviews: $396

Cost of review from Publishers Weekly PW Select: $149

Shopping the book to publishers can be very time consuming as well.

I've been assisting others with their journeys through Alternative treatments and success stories just like mine. Knowing some one else healed with Alternative medicine is so helpful to a patient, as it was for me.

My hope is that my book can help those who need it, and let them know they are not alone.

Thank you for your time, blessings!

J. Cynthia Brooks
story_txt: Hello, My name is J. Cynthia Brooks and I want to thank you so much for visiting my campaign. Some of you know I've been an actor and dancer my entire life, perhaps most notable, I was a contract player on the daytime series Days Of Our Lives. Always pretty healthy.   A few years after I left 'Days', I was diagnosed with cancer. I was told by several oncologists if I didn't get surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation treatments, I would not live beyond 2 years. The cancer was that aggressive and had already made it into some of my lymph nodes. Yet even with all the conventional western medicine treatments, there was no guarantee I would live. I had been dabbling in what is called Alternative (or natural) medicine for quite some time and after a tremendous amount of research, I decided to treat my cancer using only Alternative medicine. It worked, I was completely cured of cancer in 8 months and have been cancer free now for the 18 years. I always have fun telling people the lab. had to send my pathology test results back 3 times, they couldn't believe my cell rehabilitation either! They thought they had the wrong patient!  A few months after my clean bill of health, my close friends encouraged me to write a book about my journey through curing myself, not only the miraculous and multiple natural ways I stumbled upon to heal ones body of any disease, but also what I went through emotionally, spiritually and personally. That part was defiantly what I like to call 'Mr. Toad's wild ride'!  I somehow just knew I needed to treat myself mind body and spirit. I went to all kinds of different spiritual, metaphysical and meditation centers. Some of which are controversial still to this day.   I was also going through a lot personally, my grandfather (who I adored) was killed, my finances and carrier were crashing and a great deal of heartache over my old boyfriend I was still carrying a torch for who is now a rather famous actor. I was introduced to a book agent, he took the outline of my book to publishers and they were all interested. But as talks continued more and more I was being told what I could and couldn't say, some of which was very important for other people to know in self-healing.  It became clearer and clearer to me this was not the time to publish this book, at least not that way. So I decided to wait. All these years later, I'm so glad I did. A classic example is 18 years ago, people thought I was insane for taking probiotic's,  if they even knew what they were. Now, as you can see in advertising, they are in just about everything!  This year, I felt it was time to publish my book. Whether it be self published or with a publisher that will allow me to tell my truth. Your contributions will make that happen.Costs include-  DEVELOPMENTAL EDITING- $45-65/hour based on the experience of the editor70,000/250 = 280 pages280 pages /5 pages per hour = 56 hoursLow end is 56 x $45 = $2,520High end is = $18,200 COPYEDITING- 2-10 manuscript pages/hour$25-50/hour based on the experience of the editorLow end: $840High end: $7,000 (if it needs a lot of work)  COVER DESIGN. BOOKS ARE JUDGED BY THEIR COVERS-  Low end: $150High end: $3,500 FORMATTING FOR PRINT AND DIGITAL CONVERSION- Low end: FreeHigh end: $2,500 or more based on interactivity and pages, according to book design maven Joel Friedlander. GETTING REVIEWS PRE-PUBLICATION-Cost of review from Kirkus: $425Cost of review from BlueInk Reviews: $396Cost of review from Publishers Weekly PW Select: $149 Shopping the book to publishers can be very time consuming as well. I've been assisting others with their journeys through Alternative treatments and success stories just like mine. Knowing some one else healed with Alternative medicine is so helpful to a patient, as it was for me. My hope is that my book can help those who need it, and let them know they are not alone. Thank you for your time, blessings! J. Cynthia Brooks

story:
We are now taking pre-orders for "The Complete Unofficial 86th Annual Academy Awards Review Guide!" This in the forth book in the (eventual) 87 book series, and we are proud to be able to sell it to you. This book contains every review of every nominated film for the 86th Annual Academy Awards! This includes reviews for nominated documentaries, animated films, and (something almost no other Oscar book covers) short films!

The book also contains an interview, Top Ten lists, and a special tribute to the late Roger Ebert, whose work inspired the author immensely. Also, only through Indie Go Go will you have the opportunity to get one of the rare hardcover editions of this book, of which there will be only a dozen or so made, and not sold anywhere else! So make sure to pre-order your book today!

story:
Update: The Campaign is Over. Long Live the Campaign

We had a good run with our little fundraising campaign. Sadly, we didn't reach our goal. But we made enough to do the campaign on a smaller scale. I'll be adapting the story to be told in a series of short roadtrips across the Nortwestern United States. The Twitter feed is already active at twitter.com/picturesofmeat. If you weren't able to contribute during the fundraiser, but still want access to the twitter feed, we can do that. Simply paypal $5 to me at johnjdick@yahoo.com. Mention in the comments your twitter handle. Then send a follow request to picturesofmeat.

I still have a couple weeks before the funds from the indiegogo campaign are released to me. Right now, the twitter feed is all about building the character up before I tear him apart. I hope you'll join me for the ride. It's gonna be a good one.



If all this is too much to read: 

The short pitch is that I want to create a table book out of a cross country motorcycle adventure. The plan is to do photoshoots all over the country, where I stage murder scenes. I intend to compile the journey into a table book that people can buy. It'll be a fictional first person account of a serial killer, making his way across the nation and leaving a trail of bodies in his wake. Kind of a murderer's scrapbook.

In addition to the Gallery link at the top of this page, you can find some examples of my work at Viewbug, Deviant Art, a recently started Flickr page, and also scattered around my Facebook gallery. I've also got a Patreon campaign that I use to supplement my monthly photography projects.


Please Allow me to Introduce Myself

My name is John J. Dick. I am an alternative horror photographer and video game voice actor. I also enjoy travelling and have spent a good portion of my adult life on motorcycles. It's been a few years since I've been able to travel, though. I've been destitute and without a motorcycle. It feels like a piece of my soul has been missing. I recently bought a beat up old bike, and am chomping at the bit to have an adventure. I could use your help, though.

I want to take my horror photography on the road. I want to travel across the country, setting up bloody photoshoots in a variety of locations. Some historic locations, some mundane. I want to capture the spirit of this great country through the twisted eyes of a guy who has seen too many horror movies. I will also keep a steady instagram feed of the more mundane adventures I go on... perhaps someone will find the day to day details of my journey inspiring. I do tend to go off on some rather strange tangents at times.

The end game for this adventure is to publish a scrapbook of my journey. The scrapbook will be a fictional account of a serial killer. It'll include pictures of the 'murders', as well as notes and memorabilia. Trying to get into the mind of why horrible people do horrible things. It'll be dark... definitely not everyone's cup of tea. But, I like to think there's a little demon inside all of us who secretly fantasizes about what it would be like to live a completely uninhibited and uncaring life. I also like to think that by creating art that plays with these demons, we give ourselves a safe outlet for them.

But, I digress. I'm getting entirely too meta about understanding human motivation. At the basest level, this is about creating something scary. Putting it into a book that you can leave on your coffee table for unsuspecting guests to look at, and question why the hell you would own such a horrible thing. There will be blood, and nudity, and adventure... and perhaps a little insight into the darkest parts of the human spirit.

But I need your help to make this a reality.

Do I Still Have Your Attention? Good.

I'm asking for $3500 for the campaign. It's a modest amount, when you consider everything going into it. Many of these figures are estimates. The specific plans for the trip will be adjusted according to the amount raised.

  • $600 - Rent and bills while I'm away. I'm going to be taking a break from work for this trip, but still need to make sure I have a place to come back to. I live fairly modestly, and split bills with my roommate. But, I don't want to leave the guy hanging.
  • $500 - Motorcycle maintenance. I want to make sure the bike is in top shape before I leave. Having the trip cut short because the wheels broke down? Not a good situation to be stuck in.
  • $1000 - Printing costs for the books. Obviously, this is a rough estimate. I found a site that has a sale on right now... but I might not be able to find that same rate when it comes time to send off the order. Also, quantity and quality play into the final price a lot. I'm going to try to get the best deal that I can to produce a solid finished product for you. $1000 should be enough to get a print run to cover books for my sponsors, even in the worst of conditions.
  • $1000 - Gas, food and road expenses. Although motorcycles get good gas mileage, we're talking about a lot of distance. Also, I gotta eat along the way. I intend to camp and crash at friend's houses. But, there may be the need to rent the stray hotel room from time to time.
  • $400 - Just a little extra emergency buffer. I probably should make this amount higher, but I'm pretty resourceful about handling emergencies ;)
  • $0 - Fake blood. I've been working on my own recipe for fake blood for the past few years. I have designed an inexpensive powder that you just add water to and cook. I can make a gallon of fake blood for less than a dollar, and I already have a huge amount of the powder stockpiled. As much of the stuff as I'll be using, this is still a negligible expense. I've got this bit more than covered.
Obviously, I'll also be investing a good chunk of my own money into this endeavor as well, to fill the gaps that I haven't listed above.

If I make more than my target amount, any additional money will go toward eating better on the road. Better accommodations. It will allow me to visit more places and do more photoshoots and have more content to give you. It will also go toward buying props for the photoshoots, and making everything generally more and more epic. Perhaps buy a used wedding dress and stage a murdered wedding couple, with a short story of how their happy day ended tragically? Or buy a cheap guitar to use in bludgeoning a metalhead to death (breaking the guitar in the process)?

I'd absolutely LOVE to have enough capital that I don't have to worry about micromanaging my budget on the trip, and can just completely indulge in whatever creative fancy crosses my mind. But, that's probably just a pipe dream :)

What if I Don't Reach My Goal?

Oh, the trip is still happening. I'm still going to do a roadtrip. I'm still going to make a book. I may have to scale things accordingly. The book might be a little lighter on content. I may only be able to stop in a few places, and stay closer to home. I may have to do multiple pages for each murder to flesh things out. But, come hell or high water, SOMETHING is going to happen. It's up to you and your contribution to decide exactly how epic that something is going to be.

Why Travel? Why not just Take These Pics Locally?

Foremost, art needs to be inspired, my friend. I'll be a man on a mission. It's a book about a journey... so I'm going to take a journey. I will use firsthand accounts of things that happen to me along the way to add flavor to the book. I'll take advantage of scenery that can't be found in the Inland Northwest where I live. I'm going to attempt to stage some murders in front of some recognizable areas... though we'll just have to see what I can get away with before the Park Ranger catches me ;)

Other Ways You Can Help

First and foremost: Spread the word. Share the shit out of this campaign. The more visibility I get, the more funding I'll get to help me make this dream a reality.

If you've got a place for me to crash along the way, let me know. Couch space... anything. I have a number of friends all over the country who will be willing to put me up for the night. But having more options is never a bad thing. I can't say at this point exactly where the road will lead me. But, if I'm near you, I'd love to meet up. We can go out and grab a couple beers while I'm there. I love meeting new people and absorbing local flavor. As it gets closer to the time for the trip, I'll have a better idea of the exact route I'll be taking and can let people know when to expect me.

Are you a model? Would you like to be featured in a page of the book? I'm always looking for new models to stage scenes for the book. Let me know if you would like to be involved in a photoshoot. I can get a bit risque'. Many of my photoshoots involve a bit of nudity, if you're comfortable with that. But showing a little skin is entirely optional. I'll stay within your boundaries. Though, you should expect to be covered in a fair bit of fake blood.

If you can aid me along the road, please do feel free to reach out to me. My email is johnjdick@yahoo.com or you can find me on facebook. Or, just contact me if you have any general questions about the campaign that I haven't answered here.

In Conclusion

I'm just a guy who likes to embrace life and live by the seat of my pants. I'm just a guy with a dream. I like to create things, and share experiences. And, I do feel like I have an artistic vision that is worth sharing. I believe in this project. I really really really do. It may not change the world. But I think that by doing this, it will change mine. And maybe in some small way, make the world a little less scared. When we play nice with our demons, they lose their power. So, what do you say? Let's play?

Thank you for your time, and thank you for your support.

story:
Short Summary

I am 5 yrs old this June.  For a long time I have tried to talk but it is very hard.  Sometimes I just stare into space for long periods of time or scare my mother and grandmother by running fast into the street or away from them.  I don't know what danger is.  I love everyone I meet and love to be hugged and held.  The doctors say I have severe autism, seizures, PDD speech delays and a club foot.  

It has been recommended that a service dog would help me.  The lowest price I have found that actually works with autistic children is $25000.00. My mom is in school and cannot afford this for me.  My grandmother lives on social security and cannot afford it either.  There is no one in our lives that can or will help.  

By helping me, you will be enabling me to live a better life without worrying about disappearing, getting hurt and helping me medically as well.  I truly appreciate anything you can or will do.  All funds will go directly toward a service dog for me.  Please tell your friends and associates as every penny counts.  Thank you and Bless you all

My dog info can be found at dog wish.com
