story:
ADD Adventures book/video series

I am so grateful for your support.  

My name is Rusty Johnson and I have struggled with ADD and Dyslexia my entire life.  I am now 44 years old.    I graduated high school with a 2nd grade reading level and had no confidence to try and tackle a college education.  Luckily I found a  path in life different than the "normal" person and immersed myself in learning things hands on instead of in the classroom. 

Wildlife and exploration has always been my passion.  For over 25 years I have been giving presentations at over 3,000 schools, universities, and museums.  My experience with wildlife and exploration has awarded me with being one of the youngest people ever inducted into the world renowned Explorers Club, and I am the main character, co-creator, and a producer on the Travel Channel's TV series
HOTEL AMAZON.  To review my full resume please visit my website

www.RustyJohnson.tv

I am seeking wonderful people to help fund my first book/video in a series  I entitled  ADD Adventures.  Each book will give inspiration and confidence to children and adults struggling with ADD and show how ADD is not a disability, it is a gift. And the different paths that can be taken by people to use their ADD as the asset can give them a wonderful rewarding life most of the "normal" world envies. 

This first book/video will be entitled: ADD Adventures: My Amazon.  The book will be about my 15 years of amazing, exciting, and tragic adventures while being immersed in the Amazon rainforest and its culture. NOTE: Extra funds raised will used to deliver Malaria nets to families in the jungle. 4,000 children a day still die of Malaria.  Malaria nets save lives!

The Challenge!!!

Is that most of the adventures and information are in my head, but due to my ADD I can only get it out in words when I am in complete solitude for long periods of time. My life in New York is so full of distractions from morning to night that it is impossible for me to find the proper writing environment. And when I am guiding in the Amazon 100% of my attention must be paid to caring and catering to my guests.

Your funding will allow me to put myself in the most productive environment to write this book as efficiently as possible. In a hut in the middle Amazon. No phones, no internet, just me, and laptop living off the land. This environment and the wildness around me clears my mind to where the words splash on the pages like a waterfall. The Amazon is a harsh environment but that is what puts my mind in the “now” and inspires me.

Due to my chronic ADD the slightest distraction of the modern world draws my mind blank and it becomes madding to try and struggle through the writing processes. I need complete off the grid solitude to make this happen. While in my jungle “Exile” I will shoot video of my life there and the world around me which will be available for download. I will also include much of my past 15 years worth of video I filmed in the Amazon.

Upon publishing of this first in a series of ADD Adventures I will team up with ADD organizations and support groups to see how we can best get this book into the hands of the children and adults that struggle with ADD and need this inspiration.

This is my dream and a project countless schools have asked me to do. I hope this book will become a dream of yours as well and you decide to help support me. I have wonderful perks for contributors. 

To review some of my past writings please visit:

  http://ezinearticles.com/?expert=Rusty_Johnson

And if you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

www.RustyJohnson.tv

Rusty@RustyJohnson.tv

"Rusty's way with animals, including humans, is magical."  Sylvia Earle, National Geographic

to caring and catering to my guests.


Your funding will allow me
to put myself in the most productive environment to write this book
as efficiently as possible.  In a hut in the middle Amazon.  No
phones, no internet, just me, and laptop living off the land.  This
environment and the wildness around me clears my mind to where the words splash on the pages
like a waterfall. The Amazon is a harsh environment but that is what
puts my mind in the “now” and inspires me.


Due to my chronic ADD the slightest
distraction of the modern world draws my mind blank and it becomes
madding to try and struggle through the writing processes.  I need
complete off the grid solitude to make this happen.  While in my
jungle “Exile”  I will shoot video of my life there and the world
around me which will be available for download.  I will also include
much of my past 15 years worth of video I filmed in the Amazon.


Upon publishing of this first in a
series of ADD Adventures I will team up with ADD organizations and
support groups to see how we can best get this book into the hands of
the children and adults that  struggle with ADD and need this
inspiration.  



This is my dream and a project
countless schools have asked me to do. I hope this book will become a
dream of yours as well and you decide to help support me.  I have
wonderful perks for contributors.  


To review some of my past writings
please visit:
  http://ezinearticles.com/?expert=Rusty_Johnson
And if you have any questions please feel free to contact me.
www.RustyJohnson.tv
Rusty@RustyJohnson.tv
"Rusty's way with animals, including humans, is magical."  Sylvia Earle, National Geographic

story:
Perspectives. Karen West Photography

Hello. My name is Karen West. I am a professional photographer specializing in intimate landscapes. I have been on the road full time for five years creating "The National Parks Road Trip," an intimate landscape portfolio of 70 National Parks, lakeshores, seashores and national park service sites. Susan Ford-West, my partner, has been on the road with me for two years and we have both been members of Sisters on the Fly, the largest outdoor organization for women, now numbering more than 6000. The SOTF have meetups all over the USA, but last year they decided to take a 25 day adventure from Chicago to Santa Monica on Route 66. As soon as we heard about it we knew we wanted to be part of the journey, photograph the experience and chronicle the stories in a coffee table book that would appeal not only to the Sisters, but to anyone who has nostalgia for Route 66 or loves vintage trailers.
This epic journey of over 2400 miles has been a collective journey, but has been the telling of so many individual stories: stories of courage and empowerment, grief and  moving on, sisterhood and camaraderie. Those photos and stories will be celebrated in "Sisters Get Their Kicks on Route 66."
This story is important to tell for a variety of reasons. First, the Sisters on the Fly, is an amazing organization of over 6000 women that empowers women to be girls again! We gather together all over the country, many with vintage trailers, some with tents or more modern trailers, to enjoy the outdoors and one another. The rules are "no men, no kids, no dogs, and be nice."
Route 66 has such an important place in the American landscape. Many books have been written, mostly by men, about the main attractions along the historic route. But this book will have a very different perspective. It will be written by women, the photography will be from the unique perspective of an intimate landscape photographer and the stories of the 300 women who participated in the journey will be shared in the telling of the story.

Publishing "Sisters Get Their Kicks on Route 66"

We have chosen to custom publish this book in order to maintain more creative management over the outcome of the final product. We are working with a wonderful publisher, Sweet Grass Books in Helena, Montana.
Our initial budget of $38,500 includes the development and processing of photography and narrative for the production of an initial print run of 6000 books. This also includes Sweet Grass Books completing the editing and being involved in a great deal of the distribution.
We are hopeful that we will reach our goal to meet our initial print run. If, however, we do not meet this goal, we will still publish the book and all contributions received will be used for that purpose.

What We Need & What You Get

These Sisters are Kickin' It when it comes to Perks!

Check out the Perks section to see what is available to you for your contribution to this project!!! You may receive a Thank You card with a Route 66 Photo, a signed copy of the book or a 20x30 metal print commemorative collage depending on your contribution. You may contribute as little as $20 or as much as $800 and receive acknowledgment on a Gratitude Page in the book. 

And if you are unable to make a monetary donation at this time, please share our campaign with your social media circle so that we can spread the word to others who may be interested.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
¿Quiénes somos?

 

Somos Elisa y Augusto, un matrimonio de artistas católicos que trabajamos para generar recursos de contenido evangelizador, de nuestra propia autoría. Desde hace más de 12 años nos hemos dedicado a componer y producir por nuestros propios medios, música para la evangelización, además de libros, textos reflexivos, programas de radio, videos motivacionales, en ocasiones, acompañados por nuestros cuatro hijos, y otras veces, promoviendo la participación de otros artistas católicos. Hoy todos nuestros trabajos se encausan hacia la promoción de familias misioneras. Queremos fortalecer esos vínculos espirituales y familiares, que tanta falta hacen en nuestra sociedad, desde lo sencillo y cotidiano. Con nuestro hashtag #quieroserfamiliamisionera #ElisayAugusto pueden encontrarnos y seguirnos en las redes sociales.

 

 

¿De qué se trata nuestra propuesta?

 

 Encontramos una manera práctica y concreta de fomentar la cercanía y el diálogo entre padres e hijos, respecto de la catequesis sobre la vida de Jesús y al mismo tiempo, una forma divertida y eficaz para canalizar y representar, en forma gráfica, las oraciones y buenas acciones cotidianas…

Todo esto en una pequeña colección de 4 libritos para leer, colorear y despertar el asombro y la fe, inspirados en los misterios del Santo Rosario, acompañados de textos guías, oraciones, preguntas para habilitar los espacios de meditación y las dinámicas de oración y buenas acciones cotidianas.

Queremos invitarte a que seas parte de esta iniciativa para ayudar a las familias cristianas a tener nuevos recursos para alimentar y defender su fe… Tu aporte y tu oración ¡son impresindibles para que esta obra llegue al fin para el cual fue creada! #quieroserfamiliamisionera

 Elisa y Augusto en ...

 YouTube:   https://www.youtube.com/user/grupoviveoficial

Spotify:  https://open.spotify.com/artist/6ucufyJON1ZSOPNmgW9HYS?si=MfOfNCteR-qO6xZ7ZNOfoQ

Instagram:  https: //www.instagram.com/elisayaugustomusicaca ...

Facebook:  https: //www.facebook.com/search/top/? Q = elisa% 20 ...

 

¿Cómo podrías sumarte a nuestra propuesta?

 

Antes que nada, tomando conciencia de que son tiempos duros para las familias y los valores cristianos... y que es necesario unir fuerzas y sumar recursos espirituales, creativos y económicos para defender y promover la fe en Cristo, como la única fuente que da sustento y sentido a la vida familiar.

a través de la plataforma de INDIEGIOGO estamos recaudando fondos para poder distribuir masivamente los libritos en forma material. Si lo hacemos de este modo, nos hacen precio por cantidad en las imprentas, es por eso que hemos decidido lanzar una pre- venta  de los libritos en formato imprimible, y ofreciendo también en otras opciones de la misma campaña, nuestra música para descargar, en formato MP3, en recompensa a quienes dan su aporte. También, al final de esas opciones, está la posibilidad de donar libremente a partir de $ 1 USD, que con la tarjeta de crédito, el cambio de moneda se hace de modo automático y sencillo.

 

SI SE TE  HACE DIFÍCIL AYUDARNOS 

DE ESTA MANERA, TAMBIÉN PARA NOSOTROS 

ES MUY IMPORTANTE CONTAR CON TU AYUDA,

 DIFUNDIENDO ESTA INFORMACIÓN A QUIENES

 CONSIDERES QUE PUEDA SER DE UTILIDAD.

¡MUCHAS GRACIAS POR TU TIEMPO!

ELISA Y AUGUSTO

story:
Danny Brooks and Lil Miss Debi are two people, who because of their own history of addictions feel compelled to reach out to others, offering hope in what is possibly the darkest period in another’s life.  Addiction!  Having lived and lost, hit bottom and survived, allows Danny and Debi the wisdom, heart and insights into the fear and despair that grabs hold and often time, overwhelms to the point of desperation. 

The Brooks’ believe the books in the Miracles For Breakfast Series will help those struggling with addictions along with their families, corporations with employees who are suffering through their addictions (thus decreasing productivity), along with those who are simply looking for encouragement!  These books are written to encourage dreams, goals and those who are not sure where to start,  how to follow through, gain momentum and succeed with their plans.

In a previous campaign, funds were raised to cover the costs of an editor (partial costs), graphics/design, along with the set up and printing of an initial 500 books.  Danny and Debi wish to reach as many hurting people as possible, it is important that The Journey Continues becomes recognized by a larger audience, more so in these times than ever before!  This will require marketing and promotions in print, and radio as well as digital media.  The need for $3,500 to fulfill these requirements is essential to the success of this campaign.  No matter the final amount raised, the Brooks will move forward to utilize the donations received, to ensure the best marketing campaign possible.  Would you please consider coming along side us, and support us in this endeavor?

WIN A "FREE" HOUSE CONCERT

WIN A "FREE" HOUSE CONCERT

With every $100 (whether through a Perk purchase or donation) given, funder receives 1 entry into a draw for a free house concert with Texassippi Soul Man Danny Brooks and Lil Miss Debi  (two - one hour sets).  The house concert will be held in your home, for any number of friends your space permits (refreshments are the responsibility of host/hostess).  Draw for the house concert will be held during a live FB event (each entry will be displayed and then deposited into container,  shaken and then drawn, thus ensuring correct number of entries into contest for each funder).  Date to be drawn will be released closer to the end of the crowdfunding campaign.  Good luck y'all!

ABOUT THE PERKS

Miracles for Breakfast: The Journey Continues:  We are very excited about this book, the first of a 7 book Miracles For Breakfast Series. This book will inspire, motivate and show that anyone, when equipped with the right mindset can overcome any adversity and achieve their goals. As long as you have breath in you, then you have dreams to realize, regardless your age or circumstances.  Watch for Miracles For Breakfast: The Lonely Battle being published in the spring of 2018.

This World Is Not Your Friend:  This is my first 'Stripped Down' recording with my wife Debi, and we brought in our sub woofer speakers to get the 'live bottom end sound' on our stomp-board/cajon that we get on our live shows. It is 'Down Home/Front Porch Primal Roots Music with me playing assorted guitars/slide/cigar-box/baritone/stomp-tambo-board/harmonica and Debi sings with me playing cajon/percussion. It is basically live off the floor with minimal add on's.

Special Limited Edition Poster:  Created by up and coming artist, Caitlin Julie Marie.   Caitlin is a unique artist/painter/photographer/musician/philosopher, who sees the world through an unusual and original lense.  In her paintings she uses brushes and fingers, and paints mainly in acrylics.  Caitlin's work ranges from Rock & Blues Celebs, Janice Joplin, John Lee Hooker, Bob Marley and others, to the imaginative mind-scape’s.  Her work reflects the thoughts she has that come within her soul and her care about her  fellow world travellers.  Caitlin resides in Edmonton, Alberta and is inspired by the beauty around her.

Hard Working Man:  The Music and Miracles of Danny Brooks - A Blues Harp Production Christopher Darton writes,  "A true chameleon... one part street savy musician;  another part born again preacher, Brooks life and career runs the gamut of all spectrums of life much like his music which chronicles the good times, the bad times, relationships, heaven, hell and salvation.  A man of deep religious belief and conviction, Brooks has an uncanny capacity for reaching out and touching the lives of those around him."  A 75 minute documentary filled with vintage footage, music, interviews and of course Danny...

story:
6 to Tango 

Three artists and three writers locked down around the world have came together virtually to create a page turning book full of poetry, illustrations and short stories.  They joined together to playfully cope with the consequences of having to stay indoors for an extended period of time. 6 to Tango is 100 pages of witty and entertaining creativity with an Argentinian twist! This book is bilingual (English/Spanish) reflecting the background and present of the authors. From Argentina based in London.

What We Need & What You Get

  • To help us do this,  you can pre-order a copy of the book for £15, that is  25% off the retail price.
  • Of course we appreciate any backing in the form of a donation of any chosen amount. 
  • The book will be released in the spring of 2021 to optimistically coming out of this challenging period,
  • 6 to Tango is a book that combines the work of six unique Argentinian creatives. For the first time, the finest mix of three talented writers and three highly regarded illustrators is available to pre-order.
  • The book is bilingual ( Spanish/English). 

Who are the 6 to Tango?

story:
About Covid Action Network

We are a community of journalists & technologists that have come together to put a spotlight on the impact Covid-19 is having on societies at large. For the last 8 months, we have focused on curating an essential, verified feed of news and information. With so much misinformation, we have been determined to help communities better understand the impact Covid-19 is truly having. The pandemic has increased inequality; severely conditioned our mental health, and affected minorities in the starkest way possible, accounting for a proportionally much higher death rate within BAME communities.

Since the start of the pandemic, we have reported on its consequences, but through the lens of a solutions-focused journalism website, newsletter and Zoom In talks. By highlighting people who have helped in their communities, who have found solutions to the multiple problems Covid-19 has created, we have also shown that there is a huge appetite for content on how to build back better. With this in mind, we were able to launch an additional action-focused project: the Sustainability Action Network. Our goal is to continue making a change beyond this pandemic and to continue to seek out solution-driven journalism as we look to help build a more equitable, sustainable world.

What we need & what you get

We have been fortunate enough to be funded by the generosity of a philanthropist until the end of this year; now we need to look for other ways to continue. We have applied for a number of grants which, given the nature of journalism today, have been heavily oversubscribed. We have worked hard, maintained a passion & clarity to our reporting, and we are feeling very proud of what we have accomplished so far with the Covid Action Network and beyond.

That is why we would sincerely appreciate your help to let us continue into 2021.

What you can expect from us

We are designing a series of special workshops to help aspiring journalists to carry on our work into the future. In addition, we are offering one on one tutorials for everything from producing a podcast to newsletter strategy & development to assisting with setting up your social media and branding.

As our team evolved during lockdown we have been fortunate to bring together a unique skill set that takes expertise from all aspects of the media industry, from marketing & PR to communications and journalism. Select days and hours will be made available to those who wish to receive any of these services and donate between now and the end of December. In addition, if you have a business that requires social media promotion and is aligned to Covid-19 and a solution-based output, we can feature you on our social media channels.

You will get regular updates from us about how the campaign is going and you will be invited to a special ‘thank-you’ event at the Frontline Club in London once it is safe enough to gather again in groups.

The impact

Your donation is making a significant change in providing funds for reporting stories that will help build back a better world. In addition to writing articles, we also take action. For example: recently, on World Kindness Day, our team took pizzas to a hospital for frontline workers and to a local homeless shelter in London, and we plan to continue with such endeavours through the PizzasForGood.org project, founded by ourselves and SuspendedCoffees.com. This, however, is only possible with your generosity.

Of paramount importance to us over these next few months is the likely uneven distribution of the vaccine, again contributing to further inequalities. Our main focus will be to raise awareness and find solutions to a fairer and more sustainable distribution.

Examples of our work

We have written numerous articles showcasing people and organisations who helped communities around the world. Please see below just a few examples, and check the rest on our website: Covid Action Network

Refugees in Europe's 'largest refugee camp' self-organise coronavirus awareness campaign as cases rise 

Coronavirus in Italy: Pizza solidarity 

Migrant women & Covid-19

Guardian Angel postcards, a fundraising symbol of The Philippines

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t help by providing a donation, we would appreciate you sharing this campaign with your network. Please visit our site and spread the word.

By highlighting people who have helped in their communities, who have found solutions to the multiple problems Covid-19 has created, we have also shown that there is a huge appetite for content on how to build back better. With this in mind, we were able to launch an additional action-focused project: the Sustainability Action Network. Our goal is to continue making a change beyond this pandemic and to continue to seek out solution-driven journalism as we look to help build a more equitable, sustainable world.What we need & what you getWe have been fortunate enough to be funded by the generosity of a philanthropist until the end of this year; now we need to look for other ways to continue. We have applied for a number of grants which, given the nature of journalism today, have been heavily oversubscribed. We have worked hard, maintained a passion & clarity to our reporting, and we are feeling very proud of what we have accomplished so far with the Covid Action Network and beyond.That is why we would sincerely appreciate your help to let us continue into 2021.What you can expect from usWe are designing a series of special workshops to help aspiring journalists to carry on our work into the future. In addition, we are offering one on one tutorials for everything from producing a podcast to newsletter strategy & development to assisting with setting up your social media and branding.As our team evolved during lockdown we have been fortunate to bring together a unique skill set that takes expertise from all aspects of the media industry, from marketing & PR to communications and journalism. Select days and hours will be made available to those who wish to receive any of these services and donate between now and the end of December. In addition, if you have a business that requires social media promotion and is aligned to Covid-19 and a solution-based output, we can feature you on our social media channels.You will get regular updates from us about how the campaign is going and you will be invited to a special ‘thank-you’ event at the Frontline Club in London once it is safe enough to gather again in groups.The impactYour donation is making a significant change in providing funds for reporting stories that will help build back a better world. In addition to writing articles, we also take action. For example: recently, on World Kindness Day, our team took pizzas to a hospital for frontline workers and to a local homeless shelter in London, and we plan to continue with such endeavours through the PizzasForGood.org project, founded by ourselves and SuspendedCoffees.com. This, however, is only possible with your generosity.Of paramount importance to us over these next few months is the likely uneven distribution of the vaccine, again contributing to further inequalities. Our main focus will be to raise awareness and find solutions to a fairer and more sustainable distribution.Examples of our workWe have written numerous articles showcasing people and organisations who helped communities around the world. Please see below just a few examples, and check the rest on our website: Covid Action NetworkRefugees in Europe's 'largest refugee camp' self-organise coronavirus awareness campaign as cases rise Coronavirus in Italy: Pizza solidarity Migrant women & Covid-19Guardian Angel postcards, a fundraising symbol of The PhilippinesOther Ways You Can HelpIf you can’t help by providing a donation, we would appreciate you sharing this campaign with your network. Please visit our site and spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

It started like many journeys, with the desire to make something. My name is James Grimm, and I wanted to write children's books for my grandchildren. Reluctantly, I learned that I am a lousy artist, and what is a children's book without art? I found out what it would cost to have someone else illustrate a book (USD 1000-4000). While not a backbreaker, my luck, my grandchildren would love books and want more. How can you say no to your grandchildren?

So I spent a year or so wishing the books would illustrate themselves, trying to entice other family members to do it, and realizing my art still stinks. Then I figured maybe other children would like these stories. Yes, I know this is fairly obvious, but self-doubt is really a kicker.

I was lucky enough to have a friend that believed in me and helped me get moving on this. It helped that his wonderful daughter was also a budding artist  (who is on the team!). They got me excited and thinking we could do this.

Over time, I found other friends that liked the idea and signed on to illustrate, create theme music, or translate. We now have four artists, one musician, ten translators, and me as the author. We all are doing this after our day jobs or school, so things run in stops and starts so far.

I have written each artist's stories around their own groups of characters. We will translate each story into ten languages and each combination of languages to create 55 versions of each story. (like Spanish/English, Korean/French, Chinese/German, Japanese/Portuguese, Thai/Tagalog)

Our goal is to publish three books before the end of March 2021. 

 

A summary and blurb from these first three stories:


Same but Different (working title)

Miss Sofie is a teacher assistant who teaches her students to see how we are all the same, even though we are all different.

(drafting image)

"What is a birthmark?" Asks Tia.

They all look at Miss Sofie, waiting for her answer.

"A birthmark is a special mark." Says Miss Sofie.

"Why is it special?" Asks Mika.

"Well, Tia, do you have a birthmark?" Miss Sofie asks.

"No." Says Tia.

"Hmmm, Mika, do you have a birthmark?" Miss Sofie asks.

"No." Says Mika.

Miss Sofie nods and brushes the hair from Luca's face.

"You see, not many people have it, so it is special." She smiles.

--------------------------------------

Making Fun of Others is Bad  (working title)

Meg teaches her younger friends not to tease kids that are using crutches.

(Team image)

"Shin is hurt right now and probably feels bad enough. He will get well and then can play

with everyone," says Meg.

"But, he does look funny with those crutches." Says Chia.

Moku laughs, "Ya, he makes funny noises when he walks too."

Meg sighs, "Be nice. It must hurt him to walk right now."

"Oh, wow, I didn't know it hurts him." Says Moku.

"Why doesn't he say so?" Kai agrees.

Meg smiles, "Maybe he doesn't want you to treat him differently, so he does not tell everyone."

---------------------------------------

Aya's Imagination (working title)

Aya's imagination comes to life. She will learn about early life lessons through her imaginary friends.

(Team image)

"Hello," says Aya. "What are you?"

"I am Meku."

"What is Meku," asks Aya. She had never seen anything like Meku.

"I am not sure," says Meku, as she looks at her hands. "What do I look like to you?" she asks.

"Like a big mud ball with a flower in it," says Aya.

Meku thought for a minute, "Do you like mud balls with flowers in them?"

Aya laughs, "Yes, I like to play with the mud when mommy lets me."

Meku smiles, "Then I am a mud ball."

"Really? But I never heard of a mud ball talking," says Aya.

"Oh, that? You made me," says Meku with a smile.

"I made you? When did I do that?" Asks Aya.

"Just now, when you wanted a friend. I am from your imagination," says Meku.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We ask your help to fund the publishing, marketing, and operations for the next few months.  As mentioned above, each story will have 55 versions and 110 different instances (eBook and print on demand). With these three books, we will publish 330 unique book instances. 

The stories have been written with most of the translations done and in the early to mid-stages of the artwork.  We have not started the publication work and have a lot of work to do on our website. Your funding will help continue work on book completion, the website set up, and then publishing. 

Some of the tools we plan to use for these books have monthly fees based on the number of books published. We have found a publishing aggregator that gives us access to markets across the globe. It just has a monthly cost whether you sell books or not. Also, we have to advertise across markets and languages. If funding is available, we plan to use kids' book online influencers to help promote our books, and usually, there is a fee associated with that. 

Whatever support you believe is appropriate, we genuinely appreciate it. We have selected the following types of rewards as a thank you for your belief and support.

For all contributors, we will include you on our Thank you page, on our website, and sign you up for our newsletter. The Thank You page is a permanent, commemorative page dedicated to those that helped YumeBook Entertainment get its start!

Ebooks - These will be provided in any of the common ebook-reader styles or PDF. We will contact you to determine the style, book, and language(s) you wish to have.

Printed book - We will contact you to determine which book and language(s) you desire.

Signed book - These will be signed by the author. We will contact you to determine which book, and language you desire.

Color Pages PDF (15 images) - This will be a selection of pages from each of these books (maybe 5 each). The pages will be the picture only, with no text or color. We figured a PDF would be best to allow you to print them out as many times as desired. 

YumeBook Entertainment's Commerative First Year History - This book will be delivered in Feb 2022, after our fiscal year's closure in Dec 2021. It will include an expose on each book (3-5 pictures, a summary of the story, team credits, and release tidbits) released by YumeBook before the end of Dec 2021.

 

The Impact

We believe producing our stories in multiple languages and bilingual formats from the start benefit the reader. From what we have read/seen, many books translated into other languages are an afterthought. Text may overrun onto pictures because it was not sized for that language or cultural references do not work in the translated works.

Our process includes a cultural/story review from the translator's native perspective. We are not perfect and probably will miss a few things, but we believe we will resolve more issues than we let through. Our goal is to make each book feel like it was made for each reader, no matter where they live or what language they speak. We are trying to get more translators to ensure each language has multiple perspectives from natives of that language.

As I wanted for my grandchildren, we want each child that reads our stories to smile and laugh as they read or are told our stories.

Eventually, we will put forth language learning books with our character groups helping the young reader learn the other languages.  Our future goal is to use Augmented Reality to allow our readers to read, see, and hear these stories.

Another future goal, once we get a physical presence established, is to work with schools or charities to get books to those that might not have the ability to pay for them. We will need to establish storage, printer relations, and distribution methods. Sign up for our newsletter to keep tabs on this and other news from our company.

Risks & Challenges

One of the main risks of publishing any book is getting lost in the sea of choices. With my first two books, I learned about marketing and sold a few hundred copies between them. 

I learned you need to spend money on marketing. Another way is to have many offerings to boost your chances of being discovered and then have follow-on purchases made. With your contributions, we will spend money on marketing. With many versions of our books and different stories, we hope to boost our chances of being discovered.

What are our challenges? If we do not receive enough contributions, we will have to reduce our efforts to live within our budget. Additionally, the rest of our team is working "best-effort" and can have periods when they cannot work on their tasks. 

These issues will slow us down, not stop us. We will still work on things, but our chances of getting everything out promptly diminish.

Another risk is being able to afford the services that make things more efficient or give us access.  Instead of using our publishing aggregator, we will have to manually publish on each platform. Some platforms no longer allow new contributors. Others do not use English to post, thus requiring us to get our translators to help figure out how to publish. This will limit our reach, at least until we have funds to pay the aggregators.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some folks just can't contribute, no worries, the world is in turmoil, we completely understand. But that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share on FB, Twitter, Instagram, etc... Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Sign up for our newsletter, on our website. It will let you know when our books are out - then help share the word!
  • Check out, like, and subscribe to our YouTube channel.  We will add content about each book nearing publication. We are also considering performing readings of the stories.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
(Español abajo.)

Help us make space for voices the world needs to hear.

Three friends, mothers and community journalism advocates have joined forces to create a new, bilingual media organization for and from Costa Rica. We're pooling our combined experience to support independent journalists and tourism-dependent communities at a time when both need urgent support so they can guide us out of the crises we face. 

(Prefer to use PayPal? Donate on PayPal here.)

Your support will allow us to get El Colectivo 506 off the ground by funding:

  • Costa Rican collaborators who will design and build our website and brand (launch date: January 2021).
  • The creation of a national directory for Costa Rica's nonprofits and rural tourism entrepreneurs. We will donate initial access to communities struggling to recover from the economic crisis caused by COVID-19 restrictions.
  • Support for independent journalists who will create our first in-depth stories.

Ad-free, community-based, journalist-owned.

We believe that, today more than ever, journalists need authority and ownership in media companies to ensure independent news and opinion. We also believe that media companies should hold themselves to the highest standards of ethics, transparency and responsibility. That's why we're building our company around reader and community contributions. We also aspire to become a Certified B Corporation, which would make us the first news site in Latin America to meet rigorous requirements for positive social and environmental impact.

Building communities' capacity to connect with the world. 

The rural enterprises and nonprofits that join our directory will not only be able to connect with local and international readers, but also gain access to communications coaching to help them expand their reach and contribute more content to El Colectivo 506. The COVID-19 crisis has shown us that the ability to communicate and tell stories online is essential for communities and nonprofits to react to crises and disasters. Part of our mission is to help them build and develop those skills. We'll donate this service to communities in the initial phase of the project as we emerge from the crisis.

Spread the word!

If you can't donate, you can still join El Colectivo 506 and make this dream a reality! Please share this campaign with friends who love Costa Rica, travel and quality journalism - and follow El Colectivo 506 on our website, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter. Or donate via Paypal here!

Thank you so much for joining El Colectivo 506!

Un abrazo fuerte desde Costa Rica,

Katherine, Mónica and Pippa

Co-Founders, El Colectivo 506

Queremos crear un espacio para las voces que el mundo necesita escuchar. ¡Acompáñenos!

Tres amigas, madres, y promotoras del periodismo comunitario hemos unido esfuerzos para crear un medio bilingüe por y para Costa Rica. Estamos combinando nuestra experiencia para apoyar a periodistas independientes y comunidades que dependen del turismo, en momentos cuando ambos necesitan ayuda urgente para guiarnos a salir de las crisis que enfrentamos. 

(Prefiere PayPal? Done via PayPal aquí.)

Su apoyo ayudará a lanzar El Colectivo 506 financiando:

  • Colaboradores costarricenses que están diseñando y construyendo nuestro sitio web y marca (lanzamiento: Enero 2021). 
  • La creación de un directorio nacional para emprendimientos de turismo rural, y organizaciones sin fines de lucro. Donaremos acceso gratuito inicial a comunidades que han sido más afectadas por la crisis económica causada por el COVID-19.
  • Apoyo para los periodistas independientes que crearán nuestras primeras historias. 

Sin anuncios, desde las comunidades, moldeado por periodistas.

Nosotras creemos que, hoy más que nunca, los periodistas necesitamos autoridad y control sobre los medios donde laboramos para mejorar la independencia de las noticias. También creemos que los medios deben mantener los estándares más altos de ética, transparencia y responsabilidad. Por eso estamos basando nuestra empresa en las contribuciones de lectores y comunidades. También planeamos certificarnos como Empresa B, lo cual nos haría el primer medio de latinoamérica en lograr estándares rigurosos de impacto positivo social y ambiental.

Creando capacidad comunitaria para conectar y comunicar.

Los emprendimientos rurales y organizaciones sin fines de lucro que se unan a nuestro directorio se conectarán con lectores nacionales e internacionales, pero no nos detendremos allí. También tendrán acceso al acompañamiento en comunicación, para que puedan expandir su alcance y audiencia. La crisis COVID-19 nos ha demostrado que la capacidad para conectar con el público meta en línea es esencial para que las comunidades puedan reaccionar a crisis y desastres. Parte de nuestra misión es ayudarles a fortalecer esas destrezas. Donaremos este servicio a comunidades de Costa Rica en la primera etapa del proyecto, mientras salimos de la crisis.  

Otras formas de ayudar.

Si no puede donar, ¡puede ayudarnos a correr la voz y convertir este sueño en una realidad! Por favor comparta esta campaña con amantes de Costa Rica, de viajar, o el periodismo de calidad - y siga a El Colectivo 506 en nuestro sitio web, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn y Twitter.

¡Gracias por subirse a El Colectivo 506!

Un abrazo fuerte,

Katherine, Mónica y Pippa

Co-Fundadoras, El Colectivo 506

La crisis COVID-19 nos ha demostrado que la capacidad para conectar con el público meta en línea es esencial para que las comunidades puedan reaccionar a crisis y desastres. Parte de nuestra misión es ayudarles a fortalecer esas destrezas. Donaremos este servicio a comunidades de Costa Rica en la primera etapa del proyecto, mientras salimos de la crisis.  Otras formas de ayudar.Si no puede donar, ¡puede ayudarnos a correr la voz y convertir este sueño en una realidad! Por favor comparta esta campaña con amantes de Costa Rica, de viajar, o el periodismo de calidad - y siga a El Colectivo 506 en nuestro sitio web, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn y Twitter.¡Gracias por subirse a El Colectivo 506!Un abrazo fuerte,Katherine, Mónica y PippaCo-Fundadoras, El Colectivo 506

story:
Art by Alan Saint Clark

About 

New Transmissions from the Dark Fantastic Continuum, Volume I is a community-generated, multi-genre, speculative collection by Black content creators based in and around Oakland, California. 

To showcase the diversity of our community's talent across speculative genres, this collection includes a book review, short stories, a graphic novel excerpt, poetry, flash fiction, and novel excerpts.

​This volume contains creative work from members of the Afrosurreal Writers Workshop of Oakland and The Association of Black and Brown Writers.

Contributors include (in alphabetical order):

Radhiyah Ayobami, Alan Saint Clark, Thaddeus Howze, Trey Keeve, Desi Lenc, Raina J. León, Rochelle Spencer, Jasmine Wade, Audrey T. Williams, and Dera R. Williams.

 

Over the past 5 years, we have:

  • collectively produced performances and maintained a consistent presence at LitQuake and other Bay Area literary festivals and conventions such as SF by the Bay and FogCON
  • read our work in local cafes, coffee shops, and too many venues to name
  • received community support from like-minded friends at Nomadic Press, The Speculative Literature Foundation, SF in SF, and Tachyon Publications
  • started a mentorship program that matches emerging BIPOC writers working in the speculative genres with seasoned, professional writers

 

Read an interview from our last group performance, published by Fiyah Magazine.  

 

About Ancestral Futures Press

Jasmine Wade and Audrey T. Williams are the Co-Founders of Ancestral Futures, a speculative literary arts nonprofit whose mission is to elevate BIPOC voices across the speculative genres. Jasmine and Audrey also co-chair the Speculative Literature Foundation's San Francisco Bay Area Chapter, along with Becca Gomez Farrell. 

 

Budget

The objective of this campaign is to raise $5500 so we can:

  • Pay all contributors at professional rates
  • Cover editorial fees (line edits, proofreading)
  • Hire an eBook layout designer
  • Create marketing materials
  • Commission cover art

 

We have some exciting one-of-a-kind perks that will be added soon!

 

How You Can Help

We are committed to co-creating and supporting bespoke platforms to elevate our #ownvoices.

Help us realize our dream of paying professional rates to our contributors by donating and/or by boosting this campaign on your social media.  

Please share the link far and wide across your networks!
 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Hi! My name is Rebecca. I am now a strong woman of faith and courage with a love of God. I am a survivor. It wasn’t always easy.  As I was given up for adoption when I was a baby, my self-esteem challenges began as a young girl struggling with my identity as a biracial child adopted by a white family. My adopted family loved and nurtured me and I’m thankful that God brought me into their family. I recently discovered my biological families. Learning about my biological parents' background revealed the love and grace of God in placing me with my adoptive family.

Being adopted has put a heart in me to show women the Father’s heart and love for them. I’ve helped women throughout the years overcome rejection, fear, and betrayal with a goal to start a new life in Christ. My passion for helping women to turn the lemons in life to lemonade led to the creation of the Rebekah Project 3:19. My book, “Living Your Life and Loving Those In It,” is my story of God walking with me and teaching me how to turn the bitter parts of life into a sweet season of growth with Him. This book is part one of my story with a workbook to help readers practically apply the principles I share in my book.

I believe this book will help thousands of other women just like me who struggled with self-esteem, depression, and divorce. The decision to divorce a man whom I loved led to being a single mom of four children, navigating relationships, and having to forgive myself of decisions that can not be changed. More than half of the marriages end up in the heartache of divorce. My heart is to help restore women broken by divorce and dysfunctional decisions and show them the wonderful future they have in the kingdom of God. 

In addition, to teaching middle school, I write and speak. I have a Bachelors’ of Science in Education and a Masters in Educational Leadership. I’m a member of Immanuel New Life Bible Church in Martinsburg, WV where Rev. Dr. A. L. Lambert, Jr. is my Pastor. In my “free time,” I enjoy exercise, the beach, and spending time with family. 

What You Need & What You Get

I’m asking you to invest in reaching women by funding my book. I need to raise $4,000 for the design, printing, and marketing of my book. Every dollar raised will go towards professional design, editing, and printing of my book with 1Voice Global. I already have a contract signed but need to raise the funds to finish the project. If I raise more than $4,000, the funds will go towards the printing of more books.

 

The Impact

 “Living Your Life and Loving Those In It” will help women around the country become restored to go forward in the kingdom of God. A woman discovering her identity and value in Christ alone impacts everyone around her. Her relationships and family benefit from her forgiveness leading to freedom. This book will transform women and their families.

 

Ways You Can Help

Pray. Please pray for the Lord to provide funds for this project.

Share. Share this project on your social media channels and via e-mail with your friends and family.

Give. Please consider making a donation towards this project today.

story:
Short Summary

Most people hate sales. Unfortunately for most people, almost every job, interaction with people, and relationship has elements of sales in it.

From entrepreneurs to non-profit to accountants to... well, you name it, there is an aspect of sales in every single job we do!

This workbook is designed to be a self-guided tour of yourself and find your inner salesperson... even if you HATE the idea! 

Level Up! Is a company started by sales and management coach Stuart Rice who wanted to combine all of his 25 years of sales experience into a fun, easy, and effective method to help people who hate sales to learn to love the opportunity. 

The book is designed to help you uncover:

  • Who you are and what you stand for (Mission/Vision/Values).
  • How to listen to customers so they will talk and talk so customers will listen.
  • Master how a sale works and understand exactly where you are with every interaction.
  • How to easily perform a SWOT analysis.
  • Learn to LOVE sales and LOVE working with people!

Stuart Rice has worked for the top companies in their respective industries and has had success in growing businesses up to 500% from $50M to $250M.

Now, Stuart wants to help you get your business to its next level.

What We Need & What You Get

Publishing is expensive if done right and it is really important to get the book in front of people so that people can give feedback, offer suggestions, and start benefiting immediately. 

  • Ultimately, the hope is to raise $10,000 to get the book published correctly and help fund the last couple of months of writing and editing that needs to happen.
  • You have an option to get the digital copy for a low cost, get an updated digital copy, get the physical copy, get a limited edition physical copy, and even get coaching from Stuart himself.
  • Regardless of whether or not this project gets funded, it will still become a book. If I hit the goal, the book will come out at a reduced price for the masses.

The Impact

Your contribution is really going to allow me to focus on and finish the book and the web series.

Professional sales training for retail and even B2B sales has really gone away. When you go into a store or are approached by salespeople, the training they receive is often on-the-job and usually conducted by a peer... which means that bad habits and behaviors are often shared and allowed. 

Let's bring good customer service and proper selling habits to the masses!

  • Investing in the book now saves you a large amount of money on the product and services.
  • You will be helping create a movement of top-notch sales skills for everyone.
  • Next time you go to the store, you might find yourself in a "Wow!" situation!

Risks & Challenges

I am not going to try to manipulate you here. That's what I am trying to avoid altogether.

Instead, the only risk is that I will have to get a part-time job and might delay the book and web series.

I don't want that. I want to get this book into people's hands and help guide them to a better career and to enjoying their jobs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you:

  • Down to do some editing on the book?
  • Willing to share this? Even if you are not interested, you likely know 3 people that are in sales and struggling in one way or another. This book, genuinely, will help.

I appreciate your time in looking at what I am doing. I would love to be able to deliver a book that is groundbreaking and different from every other book you have ever seen in regards to sales.

story:
Hey gorgeous,

and thanks for checking out my page.

My name is Sinnead Ali and I am a yoga teacher and the author of Moody Nails: The Mudra Guidebook. This book has been created to enhance and inform your meditation practice.

I have always been passionate about wellness for women and have made it my mission to create tools to help them maintain a better quality of mental and emotional health.

I have focused this book on millennials because according to the World Health Organisation half of all mental illnesses begin by the age of 14 and three-quarters by mid-20s. I have seen so many friends "burn out", deal with mental health issues or depend on substances to cope with everyday stress or life-long trauma. Meditation promotes mindfulness and can help us to relax and reset unhealthy emotional habits.

Thanks to meditation I've experienced significant shifts in my life and I want to share the knowledge and beauty of mudra with others.

My mum used to tell me "your nails are your jewels, not your tools"  and as a yoga teacher who also loves a good pamper, I think that they can be both!

What's in the book?

The book details the benefits and how-to of twenty-five mudras that have been photographed in the very Insta-worthy area of Haji Lane in Singapore. All mudras feature nail art by The Nail Social with a breakdown of how to recreate the designs yourself.

Moody Nails also features twenty-five affirmations and several guided meditations. 

Details

  • A5, full colour 90+ page book 
  • Hard cover with TWO cover colour options; mustard/peach
  • 25 stunningly photographed hand mudras featuring nail art by The Nail Social
  • 6 pages for journaling.

Content

 

The Partners

The nail art was designed by The Nail Social - a social enterprise based in the popular Haji Lane in Singapore. The Nail Social employ marginalized women in the area, giving them new skills and fair income. 

Some of the mudras feature jewellery from brands I love in Singapore who all happen to be female-founded. Their brand missions all resonate with Moody Nails be it loving Mother Earth or creating employment for women.

The foreword of the book has been written by Dani Van de Velde and it features guided meditations by yoga and meditation teachers throughout.

Backers

By backing this project you will help to fund the design and printing cost of Moody Nails. With many pledge options available, you can choose the pledge that best suits you and you will receive your reward within one month of the campaign ending- just in time to help create your New Years resolutions with intent.

I believe that we all have the innate ability to heal and manifest - the power is literally in our hands! So become apart of the Moody Nails community by supporting this campaign!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • By fully funding this project we will go into phase two of completing the book design
  • Then, its off to print and shipping straight to your door!
  • I have partnered with some fab brands to spruce up the perks- the more you pledge, the more you get back! Check out the pledge tiers for more info.
  • If we don't reach the goal? *whomp whomp* if we have enough to fund a certain amount of the printing we will go ahead with a smaller batch so all pledges receive their rewards - if not you get your money back. In the meantime your fee stays safely with Indiegogo.com

The Impact

  • Mental health awareness should not be a flash in the pan trend. Let's keep up the conversations and shows the next generation that self-care for mental and emotional health should be as regular as brushing your teeth!
  • Together we can grow a community of women and girls who are passionate about meditation.
  • Future partnerships - depending on the book's success I would look to support advocacy groups and charities working with women and girls in SE Asia.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't pledge with cash? No worries, that doesn't mean you can't help.

Make some noise instead:

  • Know a bookstore, lifestyle cafe or yoga studio that might like to share a project like this or stock the book at a later date? Download the Moody Nails press release to share!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share on social! Don't forget to follow and like our pages!

 

Thank you in advance for your support and I hope to be sending your copy of Moody Nails very soon.

story:
"Recordemos que un libro, un lápiz, un niño y un docente pueden cambiar el mundo." Malala Yousafzai

El libro Dominicanas Fuera de Serie presenta las vidas de dominicanas extraordinarias que han participado activamente en la construcción de nuestra nación a través de 500 años de historia en formato de cuentos infantiles para lectores de +7 años. 

Como país en vías de desarrollo es crucial revisar la narrativa sobre el valor y la relevancia que tiene para toda la sociedad la vida de las dominicanas. Al rescatar y difundir sus invaluables aportes sociales, culturales, económicos y científicos, especialmente en una región como América Latina, donde ocurren más de la mitad de los feminicidios del mundo, colaboramos con una cultura de paz, igualdad y equidad. 

Para contrarrestar esta alarmante realidad, se hace necesario que las jóvenes generaciones y sus familias cuenten con referentes femeninos cercanos y reales, de manera que se modifique gradualmente y desde la infancia la limitada imagen sobre los roles de las niñas y las mujeres del país, de la región y del mundo. La literatura infantil y juvenil especializada puede lograr exactamente esa meta de modo eficaz y contundente.

Al leer sobre las vidas de extraordinarias mujeres criollas reunidas en el libro para niños y niñas “Dominicanas Fuera de Serie: +120 mujeres que transformaron la República Dominicana”, jóvenes del territorio nacional tendrán acceso a ejemplos de enriquecimiento comunitario a través de aportes concretos y transformadores realizados por cada una de las protagonistas, permitiendo que estos modelos sirvan como motivación de empoderamiento, fortaleza y cambio social en la República Dominicana. 

Para lograr nuestra meta de imprimir 2,000 ejemplares del libro en la 1era (primera) edición pautada para publicarse en noviembre del 2018, hemos creado una campaña de recaudación colectiva en esta plataforma de crowdfunding, a través de la cual se pueden realizar donaciones a partir de los $5.00 dólares o su equivalente en pesos dominicanos.

Incluimos en esta publicación a dominicanas de tantas edades, disciplinas y periodos históricos como fuera posible: médicas, biólogas, juezas, espías, chefs, surfistas, poetas, cantantes, etc, para aunar en un solo volumen todo el talento, dedicación, retos e historias de inspiración de estas personas que dieron lo mejor de sí a la comunidad, con la esperanza de que al leerlas, en los lectores surja la idea de igualdad y valorización que tan desesperadamente estamos necesitando como país para beneficio de todos sus ciudadanos, pero especialmente de la niñez y la juventud.

¿​Qué necesitamos y qué obtendrá?

  • Se necesitan US$5,000 para cubrir los costos de producción (+120 biografías, +120 ilustraciones, diseño gráfico/retoques digitales, diagramación, revisión y edición final de aproximadamente 220 páginas tamaño 10.5 x 10. 

  • Se necesitan US$20,000 para cubrir los costos de la 1era (primera) edición del libro, que constará de 2,000 ejemplares, de aproximadamente 220 páginas a tamaño 8.5 x 8.5 en tapa suave, edición paperback/sencilla. 

  • Otros formatos de tapa dura, ediciones posteriores y/o ediciones especiales del mismo libro no estarán sujetos a estos lineamientos. 

  • Hay distintos tipos de contribuciones para elegir dependiendo de sus posibilidades y de lo que recibirá como retribución por su contribución. 

  • Si no alcanzamos la meta completa, los fondos recaudados se usarán para cubrir una 1era edición mínima de 250 ejemplares o máxima según el valor recaudado, que será completada, de ser necesario, por fondos propios de la autora y del equipo editorial. 

  • Esta campaña es válida únicamente para la 1era (primera) edición de este libro a imprimirse en noviembre del año 2018. 

El impacto

  • En ambos casos, si se alcanza o no la meta de recaudación total, se destinará el 15% de las ganancias de las ventas de esta primera (1era) edición a un máximo de tres (3) fundaciones sin fines de lucro que trabajen directamente con sobrevivientes de violencia de género en la República Dominicana. Estas instituciones serán anunciadas el jueves 31 de enero del año 2019.

  • Con su generosa contribución, ayudará a concientizar los jóvenes de escuelas públicas y privadas sobre este tema, con la esperanza de que se creen las condiciones para una nación más igualitaria y democrática. En los colegios privados, a través de la distribución y adquisición del libro en establecimientos comerciales o librerías, y en el caso de las escuelas públicas, a través de donaciones de 100 libros repartidos entre 50 bibliotecas escolares del sector público. Estas donaciones serán realizadas en un periodo trimestral que va desde el 15 de enero al 15 de abril del año 2019.

  • En ambos casos, si se alcanza o no la meta de recaudación, serán donados 2 ejemplares de la 1era edición del libro a 50 bibliotecas escolares del sector público dominicano, repartidos de la siguiente manera:

  • Infórmese y hable sobre el tema de la violencia de género con sus allegados y conocidos. 

  • Acérquese a las organizaciones sin fines de lucro y ofrezca su ayuda como voluntario.
story_txt:
"Recordemos que un libro, un lápiz, un niño y un docente pueden cambiar el mundo." Malala Yousafzai
El libro Dominicanas Fuera de Serie presenta las vidas de dominicanas extraordinarias que han participado activamente en la construcción de nuestra nación a través de 500 años de historia en formato de cuentos infantiles para lectores de +7 años. 
Como país en vías de desarrollo es crucial revisar la narrativa sobre el valor y la relevancia que tiene para toda la sociedad la vida de las dominicanas. Al rescatar y difundir sus invaluables aportes sociales, culturales, económicos y científicos, especialmente en una región como América Latina, donde ocurren más de la mitad de los feminicidios del mundo, colaboramos con una cultura de paz, igualdad y equidad. 
Para contrarrestar esta alarmante realidad, se hace necesario que las jóvenes generaciones y sus familias cuenten con referentes femeninos cercanos y reales, de manera que se modifique gradualmente y desde la infancia la limitada imagen sobre los roles de las niñas y las mujeres del país, de la región y del mundo. La literatura infantil y juvenil especializada puede lograr exactamente esa meta de modo eficaz y contundente.
Al leer sobre las vidas de extraordinarias mujeres criollas reunidas en el libro para niños y niñas “Dominicanas Fuera de Serie: +120 mujeres que transformaron la República Dominicana”, jóvenes del territorio nacional tendrán acceso a ejemplos de enriquecimiento comunitario a través de aportes concretos y transformadores realizados por cada una de las protagonistas, permitiendo que estos modelos sirvan como motivación de empoderamiento, fortaleza y cambio social en la República Dominicana. 
Para lograr nuestra meta de imprimir 2,000 ejemplares del libro en la 1era (primera) edición pautada para publicarse en noviembre del 2018, hemos creado una campaña de recaudación colectiva en esta plataforma de crowdfunding, a través de la cual se pueden realizar donaciones a partir de los $5.00 dólares o su equivalente en pesos dominicanos.
Incluimos en esta publicación a dominicanas de tantas edades, disciplinas y periodos históricos como fuera posible: médicas, biólogas, juezas, espías, chefs, surfistas, poetas, cantantes, etc, para aunar en un solo volumen todo el talento, dedicación, retos e historias de inspiración de estas personas que dieron lo mejor de sí a la comunidad, con la esperanza de que al leerlas, en los lectores surja la idea de igualdad y valorización que tan desesperadamente estamos necesitando como país para beneficio de todos sus ciudadanos, pero especialmente de la niñez y la juventud.
¿​Qué necesitamos y qué obtendrá?

Se necesitan US$5,000 para cubrir los costos de producción (+120 biografías, +120 ilustraciones, diseño gráfico/retoques digitales, diagramación, revisión y edición final de aproximadamente 220 páginas tamaño 10.5 x 10. 
Se necesitan US$20,000 para cubrir los costos de la 1era (primera) edición del libro, que constará de 2,000 ejemplares, de aproximadamente 220 páginas a tamaño 8.5 x 8.5 en tapa suave, edición paperback/sencilla. 
Otros formatos de tapa dura, ediciones posteriores y/o ediciones especiales del mismo libro no estarán sujetos a estos lineamientos. 
Hay distintos tipos de contribuciones para elegir dependiendo de sus posibilidades y de lo que recibirá como retribución por su contribución. 
Si no alcanzamos la meta completa, los fondos recaudados se usarán para cubrir una 1era edición mínima de 250 ejemplares o máxima según el valor recaudado, que será completada, de ser necesario, por fondos propios de la autora y del equipo editorial. 
Esta campaña es válida únicamente para la 1era (primera) edición de este libro a imprimirse en noviembre del año 2018. 

El impacto

En ambos casos, si se alcanza o no la meta de recaudación total, se destinará el 15% de las ganancias de las ventas de esta primera (1era) edición a un máximo de tres (3) fundaciones sin fines de lucro que trabajen directamente con sobrevivientes de violencia de género en la República Dominicana. Estas instituciones serán anunciadas el jueves 31 de enero del año 2019.
Con su generosa contribución, ayudará a concientizar los jóvenes de escuelas públicas y privadas sobre este tema, con la esperanza de que se creen las condiciones para una nación más igualitaria y democrática. En los colegios privados, a través de la distribución y adquisición del libro en establecimientos comerciales o librerías, y en el caso de las escuelas públicas, a través de donaciones de 100 libros repartidos entre 50 bibliotecas escolares del sector público. Estas donaciones serán realizadas en un periodo trimestral que va desde el 15 de enero al 15 de abril del año 2019.
En ambos casos, si se alcanza o no la meta de recaudación, serán donados 2 ejemplares de la 1era edición del libro a 50 bibliotecas escolares del sector público dominicano, repartidos de la siguiente manera: 

En Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional:
1. Escuela República de Haití, Ens. Luperón, Santo Domingo, (2 ejemplares)

story:
This didn't happen to me... but it could have.

 

I'm P. J. Galati and this book started as a dream in 2006. I mean a literal dream. I woke up and wanted to make sense of seeing giant whale-sized, killer catfish attacking a beach. So I started writing, not knowing that ten years later I would have a novel of over 119,000 words! I spent the next two years revising it, asking for opinions, drawing all the chapter artwork and maps, hiring a cover artist, then finally getting a copy printed. Now it's time to move this forward. Below is a little taste of the novel.

John Archer is just an average…well, maybe below average pizza delivery guy, who has nothing happening in his home life, love life or anywhere else. That is, until he accidentally gets trapped in La La Land, the daydream world. Greeted by Cynthia, an extremely sexy local, John enjoys the luxury and safety of La La Land City at first. It’s not until they venture outside of it’s walls for a day at the beach, that John starts down a dangerous path, complete with a cursed forest, a village of cannibalistic pygmies, vicious mythical creatures, elusive powerful magic and all in a place with no weapons to defend himself, not even a dinner fork. Cynthia knows more than she’s letting on, and John eventually picks up on it. Despite being thrown from one crisis to the next, she sticks by John’s side as she’s been in love with him for hundreds of years even though he has no memory of her, or his own deeply hidden past. A darker truth creeps up on John as puzzle pieces fall into place and he figures out that the microverse of La La Land is not only real, but about to be destroyed…on purpose. With the help of a tree elf, a fire demon and God's cousin, John and Cynthia set out to save their entire universe from literally unraveling. 

If you like the Harry Potter series, The Magicians, Alice in Wonderland and The Wizard of Oz, then you will love The Legend of La La Land . The one thing they all have in common is taking an average unsuspecting hero and dropping them into a magical world where they have to quickly adapt to survive. This is what happens to John, he accidentally gets trapped in La La Land and while it seems like a wonderful fantasy at first, he's quickly introduced to the harsh reality that nearly everything there wants to kill him, and an even larger threat looms over the entire land. 

I had a few test readers and all of them agreed that this is an unpredictable story. You will never know what's coming next, but it will keep pulling you forward, deeper into this new, bizarre and oddly familiar world. This fantasy adventure is full of comedy, action and even a little romance.
 

What We Need & What You Get

The Legend of La La Land  is my first completed novel and I'm working on getting this book out to the world. This fundraiser is not to sell the book, it's to raise funds for a book coach, who will help me get a top literary agent (very hard to do) and then the two of them will help me sign a good contract, with a publishing company (harder than finding the agent!). Should I go over my goal, the additional funds will be used for travel related to the book, like book signings and so on. If there's A LOT more, then it will go towards helping me write the second novel in the series, The Return to La La Land. I presently have five books planned in the series, but it could easily double or triple, based on how well it's received.

Here's what I'm offering:

  • At the lowest level of support $10 I am offering a premium full color double sided bookmark. This is 24 point, tripled layered, velvet finished and it feels great on the fingers.

​

  • For $20 you can pick from select chapter artwork, including the map (all hand drawn by me) in the book and I will have prints made on 9" X 13" papyrus (for that cool old look) laser engraved (burned in), mounted on charcoal art paper, hand signed and numbered by me.

  • At $25 you get The Legend of La La Land E-book
  • At $35 you get the Audio Book read by the Author P. J. Galati
  • At $40 you get a print of the book
  • At $45 you get a signed print of the book

  • At $50 you get a signed print of the book, plus the E-Book 
  • At $60 you get a signed print of the book, plus the E-Book, plus the audio book read by me
  • At $75  you get a signed print of the book, plus the E-Book, plus the audio book read by me and a single papyrus print
  • At $100  you get a signed print of the book, plus the E-Book, plus the audio book read by me, two papyrus prints and the book mark
  • Sterling Glowplug Level at $200 you get everything at the $100 level, plus a Video chat with me for an hour 
  • Zaggers Level at $500 You get everything at the $200 level (including 5 papyrus prints) and I will name a character in the second novel after you or you can pick a name.
  • Threat Basher Level at $1,000 Everything from the Zaggers Level, but the video chat is replaced with us going to dinner and you can pick my brain all night about the novel, characters and upcoming secrets!

My goal is to fulfill all the pledges and items (books, bookmarks, E-book, audio book, etc) by December 2019. This is my first time dealing with the publishing world, so this is just a rough estimate. I will continue to post updates as I get them, so you as my supporter, will be well informed. 

Thank you so much,

                             P. J. GalatiBreak it down for folks in more detail:

The Aftermath

The successful funding of this novel will begin a cascade of events:

  • It's my goal to write a series of La La Land novels.
  • As a filmmaker, I'm also on a 5 year plan to take this story to Hollywood and get it made.
  • I plan to expand this process beyond the novel into other media, like a La La Land Video Game.

Risky Business

This entire process is a tricky venture, navigating the ever changing publishing industry nothing is set in stone.

  • This is why I'm choosing to surround myself with experienced people who can guide me to make smart decisions through out the process.
  • I want you to know that even if I can't make everything happen as planned, I will still get everything promised to you supporters, even if I have to self publish the books myself.

Tell Everyone!

If you don't have the funds to support me, you can still help this novel:

  • Please email people you know who'd love this kind of story, send them here.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on Facebook, Instagram and other social media platforms.
  • Go door to door and tell people about the Day Dream World!
  • Start a Legend of La La Land Fan Club!
  • If you've read this far, you are a true gem, the last two were just jokes.

I want you to know that even if I can't make everything happen as planned, I will still get everything promised to you supporters, even if I have to self publish the books myself.


Tell Everyone!
If you don't have the funds to support me, you can still help this novel:

Please email people you know who'd love this kind of story, send them here.
Use the Indiegogo share tools on Facebook, Instagram and other social media platforms.
Go door to door and tell people about the Day Dream World!
Start a Legend of La La Land Fan Club!
If you've read this far, you are a true gem, the last two were just jokes.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Andrea McKenzie Raine and I am an author. I self-published my debut novel Turnstiles through Inkwater Press in December 2013. I have also published poetry. My novel Turnstiles has been very well-received by readers with a 4.8/5 stars on Amazon (21 reviews). Since 2009, I have been writing the prequel novel for Turnstiles, which is titled A Crowded Heart. I am now ready to submit my manuscript for publication, and I would like to publish again through Inkwater Press. I can't afford to self-publish my novel without funding. I also actively trying to find a literary agent to take interest in my writing.

Writing is my passion and I believe it is my calling in life. My ultimate dream is to become a full-time author. I have worked for years on my second novel, as well as my debut novel, and I feel my work deserves to be read by a wider audience. Through crowd funding, my second novel will have the chance to be published, and there are already a number of readers worldwide who are waiting for subsequent books that I've written. I am a serious writer and would like the chance for my books to be professionally published and to reach those readers.


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The basic cost of publishing a paperback book through Inkwater Press is $999 and an extra $200 to also publish an e-book version.
  • If you help me reach my funding goal to self-publish my book, you will receive the following perks:

$5.00 -Turnstiles bookmark

$25.00 - signed copy of Turnstiles and bookmark

$50.00 - signed copy of Turnstiles, bookmark, and a handmade poetry chapbook (choose from Impetus: Ghazals or Waiting: Ghazals -- both are available through Amazon Kindle)

$100 - signed copy of Turnstiles, bookmark, and signed copy of prequel novel A Crowded Heart when it is published.

$200 - signed copy of Turnstiles and A Crowded Heart (when it is published), bookmark, and lunch or dinner with the author (must be in the vicinity of Vancouver Island).

  • All of the funds I receive will be applied towards the basic publishing package for the paperback and e-book publication of my prequel novel, A Crowded Heart.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • I am working to make writing my career.
  • Through reviews of my debut novel, I have learned that I am able to connect with readers through my writing. On Goodreads, Turnstiles has received a rating of 4.53 stars with 40 ratings so far. On Amazon, my debut novel has received a rating of 4.8 out of 5 stars with 21 reviews.
  • My poetry books have also received high ratings (5 stars) from readers.
  • I work full-time, I am a mother to two boys who are aged 5 and 2, and I can't make my dream of writing and publishing books happen without financial assistance. I invested a lot of money in my first novel with publication costs, book tours, and marketing strategies. My second novel is now ready to be submitted for publication, but I am still trying to pay off my the cost of publishing my first novel. At the same time, I am trying to publish through the traditional route, but it is slow-going. Literary agents want proof that an author is writing and selling their books.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • I will never stop writing. I have many more novels, novellas and and poetry books in me that need to be written.
  • I hope to reach my goal, if not surpass it, but if I do not reach my goal I will 'bite the bullet' and pay the necessary costs or find another way to publish my second novel -- hopefully sooner than later.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you are not in a position to help fund my campaign, please share this page and help spread the word about my published novel Turnstiles and my ambition to publish my second novel A Crowded Heart.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
