story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Zsuzsi Hussla and I'm passionate about women's health and educating others about important topics such as how to heal your menstrual cycle, how to handle PMS, why tracking your menstrual cycle is beneficial to your life- not just your fertility, and being a courageous and strong woman. 

My passion grows stronger each day as we face the many issues of women's health being addressed by politician hopefuls in the coming Presidential election. We hear about defunding Planned Parenthood, banning abortions and a general lack of choice when it comes to women's bodies while sex education in schools is failing miserably. Teen pregnancy is at an all time high and begging for attention to the obvious: education is key, particularly for young women and it is the solution to these increasing problems. 

This is why I am publishing this book and sharing my wisdom with women and men alike. I have already completed writing the manuscript and it is currently being edited. I'm just a couple steps from self-publishing my first book!



In my early twenties, I suffered from many menstrual conditions and found myself at a loss for how to deal with my irregular cycle, painful menses and Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome. After years of research, experimentation and spiritual growth, I found healing in my body and spirit that has been profound for my feminine expression as a woman in today's world. 

As a Certified Herbalist, Certified Somatic Movement Therapist, with a Bachelors degree in Dance and Holistic Health, and as a Professional dancer, I have paired my learning through various experiences of following my intuition and higher self and developed a template which can be used by women to release herself from the bonds of what feminine "should be" and allow her true self to shine. 

As a dancer, I have developed a unique dance therapy method called Wombyn's Rhythms- that assists women in unraveling long held beliefs and conditioned patterns in their body about the feminine perspective- specifically around menstruation- and unleashing her inner wise woman. With the funding of this campaign, you will assist me in making these teachings more available to women.


Unraveling Her is a combination memoir and self-discovery template with a journal for discovering your own self-awareness around your perspectives of feminine cycles and how they are being reflected in your life. This book gives hope and inspiration to those suffering from any menstrual conditions, PMS problems, infertility, lack of creativity and desire, as well as building your courage and core values as a woman in today's world.

I am so passionate about this project and these issues because it really is at the forefront of our culture right now and so very important to the evolution of humanity. More than ever, women's issues are being bought and sold on media, in politics and on the streets. It is time to take back the wisdom of the feminine and embody your true purpose as a female at this time on earth. There is no waiting, there is no someday, the time is now for women to step up and be accountable for how they view their body and their life. What if this book could prevent teen pregnancy or heal someone's disgust with their cycle? 

I believe it can. I believe that Unraveling Her is for the new-generation-woman who is tired of feeling out of sorts with her cycle. Tired of being tired. Tired of hating her body and hating her cycle. She's ready for a positive change within herself that allows her to be a greater contribution to the world.


What We Need & What You Get

I'm estimating my current costs at about $5000, here's what your contribution will go towards:

  • Self-publishing package through Balboa Press
  • Color upgrade and adding more images to the book
  • Editing costs
  • Artist payment for images used in the book
  • A dancing stage pole- why the heck do I need a stage pole you ask? As a dancer, a stage pole would allow me to continue training on my own (I currently travel an hour each way for training) and eventually teach other women, as well as perform at venues anywhere which would inspire and create interest for my book and the dance workshops I teach.
  • Fulfilling perks: ordering books from my publisher, supplies and shipping costs
  • Rent a space for teaching Wombyn's Rhythms workshops, events and dance classes- plus have a studio for my personal dance training. in Davis Ca.
Perks will be fulfilled by February of 2016 or sooner. 


Whatever money I receive through this campaign will be used towards paying the book contract first and foremost. The purpose of this campaign is to -deep breath- ask for support in completing the publishing process!
Stretch goals, any money received over my initial goal of $5000 will go towards paying off debt I have accrued while writing this book and furthering my training in women's issues and dance.

The Impact

This project is so important to me because I have been working on it since 2009. It is the culmination of much research and experience, I believe it will be a valuable resource for other women who want to understand themselves better.

There is a serious lack of education around women's health, fertility, cycles, PMS and sex. It saddens me that so many women don't understand their bodies or how their cycles work. This book is just one small step in the direction of bringing awareness of these important issues that women face to the forefront. 

My larger vision is to open a Fertility Dance Center- a resource center for women and men to embrace and enliven their innate fertile creativity for living their potential. This Wombyn's Rhythms center would include classes and workshops on body movement, healthy living, plus a cafe & tea/smoothie bar, an atrium & garden, as well as a space for evening dance events. A sanctuary for the new-generation-wo/man to be revived and remember their true purpose in life.


Risks & Challenges

I don't have much risk involved with this project, especially since I have completed the manuscript and am in the editing process. My contract is already set with Balboa Press and I perceive no known problems. With everything on track, the book will be published in the Winter of 2015/6, likely around the new year.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to donate now, I would love your help getting the word out about this campaign and sharing it on social media or with friends that you feel would benefit from this project!

Thank you so much, I truly appreciate it!!

After years of research, experimentation and spiritual growth, I found healing in my body and spirit that has been profound for my feminine expression as a woman in today's world. 
As a Certified Herbalist, Certified Somatic Movement Therapist, with a Bachelors degree in Dance and Holistic Health, and as a Professional dancer, I have paired my learning through various experiences of following my intuition and higher self and developed a template which can be used by women to release herself from the bonds of what feminine "should be" and allow her true self to shine. 
As a dancer, I have developed a unique dance therapy method called Wombyn's Rhythms- that assists women in unraveling long held beliefs and conditioned patterns in their body about the feminine perspective- specifically around menstruation- and unleashing her inner wise woman. With the funding of this campaign, you will assist me in making these teachings more available to women.


Unraveling Her is a combination memoir and self-discovery template with a journal for discovering your own self-awareness around your perspectives of feminine cycles and how they are being reflected in your life. This book gives hope and inspiration to those suffering from any menstrual conditions, PMS problems, infertility, lack of creativity and desire, as well as building your courage and core values as a woman in today's world.
I am so passionate about this project and these issues because it really is at the forefront of our culture right now and so very important to the evolution of humanity. More than ever, women's issues are being bought and sold on media, in politics and on the streets. It is time to take back the wisdom of the feminine and embody your true purpose as a female at this time on earth. There is no waiting, there is no someday, the time is now for women to step up and be accountable for how they view their body and their life. What if this book could prevent teen pregnancy or heal someone's disgust with their cycle? 
I believe it can. I believe that Unraveling Her is for the new-generation-woman who is tired of feeling out of sorts with her cycle. Tired of being tired. Tired of hating her body and hating her cycle. She's ready for a positive change within herself that allows her to be a greater contribution to the world.   

What We Need & What You Get I'm estimating my current costs at about $5000, here's what your contribution will go towards: 
Self-publishing package through Balboa Press
Color upgrade and adding more images to the book
Editing costs
Artist payment for images used in the book
A dancing stage pole- why the heck do I need a stage pole you ask? As a dancer, a stage pole would allow me to continue training on my own (I currently travel an hour each way for training) and eventually teach other women, as well as perform at venues anywhere which would inspire and create interest for my book and the dance workshops I teach.
Fulfilling perks: ordering books from my publisher, supplies and shipping costs
Rent a space for teaching Wombyn's Rhythms workshops, events and dance classes- plus have a studio for my personal dance training. in Davis Ca.

Perks will be fulfilled by February of 2016 or sooner. 

Whatever money I receive through this campaign will be used towards paying the book contract first and foremost. The purpose of this campaign is to -deep breath- ask for support in completing the publishing process! Stretch goals, any money received over my initial goal of $5000 will go towards paying off debt I have accrued while writing this book and furthering my training in women's issues and dance.  The Impact
This project is so important to me because I have been working on it since 2009. It is the culmination of much research and experience, I believe it will be a valuable resource for other women who want to understand themselves better.
There is a serious lack of education around women's health, fertility, cycles, PMS and sex. It saddens me that so many women don't understand their bodies or how their cycles work. This book is just one small step in the direction of bringing awareness of these important issues that women face to the forefront. 
My larger vision is to open a Fertility Dance Center- a resource center for women and men to embrace and enliven their innate fertile creativity for living their potential. This Wombyn's Rhythms center would include classes and workshops on body movement, healthy living, plus a cafe & tea/smoothie bar, an atrium & garden, as well as a space for evening dance events. A sanctuary for the new-generation-wo/man to be revived and remember their true purpose in life.   
Risks & Challenges I don't have much risk involved with this project, especially since I have completed the manuscript and am in the editing process. My contract is already set with Balboa Press and I perceive no known problems. With everything on track, the book will be published in the Winter of 2015/6, likely around the new year.
    
Other Ways You Can Help If you aren't able to donate now, I would love your help getting the word out about this campaign and sharing it on social media or with friends that you feel would benefit from this project!
   Thank you so much, I truly appreciate it!!

story:
My name is Wesley Mayer, I am a photographer from Traverse City, Michigan. For the past several years I have been following the Syrian Refugee Crisis closely. I have come to truly believe that this is the greatest tragedy of our generation, 4 million people have had to give up their lives and attempt to survive in a world that is hesitant to accept them, and quick to exploit them. Through their travels to find a new place to live, Syrian refugees face discrimination, deportation, and general lack of human care. Many people in the region, instead of providing aid for people in need, see it as an opportunity to make money. Syrians looking for a boat to Greece can expect charges of 1,500 euros per head for an incredibly dangerous boat packed absolutely to the top with people. Taxi rides can cost up to 150 euros for a short ride. Along with the discrimination they face as migrants, the overall situation looks quite bleak.

SOURCE  
UNHCR/G. Gubaeva
I don't want to focus on the negative. My goal is to travel to Turkey, where over 2.1 million refugees are currently stranded, and find stories of people who have provided outstanding human compassion and highlight them. I want to interact directly with the refugees, provide aid where I can, and collect stories and photos to bring back to my community to hopefully help raise even more awareness and aid for those who need it most at this time. 
Any and all help you can give to help me get on the ground in Turkey and make sure I am able to get where I need to go, would be more appreciated than you could ever know. Please take the time to look at my goals and consider making a donation, I want to do something more than I ever would be able to alone, your help will be appreciated for the rest of my life.

My Project Needs and What You Will Get

The money I am raising will be mostly to cover my travel and housing costs, I had hoped to be able to give a solid breakdown of where this money would be going but there is no way to tell specifically what travel and lodging will cost. The goal of $3,500 is based on estimated airfare and the materials I will need, along with some for actual aid. A portion will go towards photography and travel gear directly related towards photojournalism, and another small amount will go to cover personal safety classes for photographers in Istanbul.
A brief breakdown,
$1500 for travel
$1000 for supplies, food and training
$1000 for direct aid and incidentals along the way.
The most important part of your donation however will be that ANY excess funds will go directly to refugees in need. After I have achieved all I need to, I will use all of the money donated to my project to buy aid or help refugees in any way I can. This is the most fantastic part of this donation, as when you donate to a large aid agency it is hard to see the direct impact of your help. With my project, you will see photos of the people whose lives you have made better. You will be able to interact with humans on the other side of the world and know the difference you made. I make that pledge for accountability, whenever I provide aid I will combine it with a story and photos.


SOURCE  
UNHCR/G. Gubaeva


What We Will Achieve

I am an American, and a world citizen. I believe that no matter where we are geographically located we have a responsibility to every good person on Earth to show compassion and care when they are in need. We as Americans have had a degree of separation that those living in the Middle East and Europe have not had, we have kept ourselves fairly disconnected from the crisis. I want to change that, I would like to help bring more Americans to the discussion on how to best help the millions of men, women, and children who need it. Through weaving interactions on a personal basis with refugees and attempting to place my audience in their shoes, I hope to show that refugees are not inhuman subjects of xenophobia, but people who have escaped incredible evil and trauma that deserve a chance to start over. 

I am a self-sufficient traveler, and an accomplished photographer. This will be my first endeavor in photojournalism or large-scale aid effort. I am confident that this project will be hugely successful, I am passionate about my goals and know what I want to achieve. I have been researching and am well aware of the situation that I am trying to improve. This is a project I have been finessing for months and months, I know that with your help we can make a difference in the world. I expect to travel from Turkey through Europe to Germany. I think that every step in the refugees' journey has different components and they are all important. 


SOURCE  
UNHCR/S.Baldwin


Risks & Challenges

Obviously there are many risks and challenges that accompany being so close to an active civil war. Personal safety will be a concern, I will be taking classes in Istanbul that teach specifically safety techniques to photojournalists covering the Syrian Crisis. I am forming connections with different groups on the ground in Turkey and will attempt to stay in groups or in safe areas when possible. 

Besides personal safety there are no foreseeable challenges that would end the project after I have reached my funding goal. I am a versatile and well-experienced traveler, overcoming unforeseen obstacles is a key part of the experience to me.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, no worries! Please share, link, or spread the word in any way you can. The more people involved in this project the greater the results will be. If you can't share, then I will gladly take a hug and a good luck wish.

If you would rather donate to another organization, I would highly suggest that. Below are links to some of the best aid organizations on the ground in areas around Syria, they would be very worthy of your donation.

Thank you so much for considering my project.

Link to the UN Relief Agency, which is in desperate need of further funding.

https://donate.unrefugees.org/ea-action/action?ea.client.id=1873&ea.campaign.id=41888&ea.tracking.id=D15XSJ151XXC&gclid=CN_F2tPBqcgCFQpDaQodR54Ciw&gclsrc=aw.ds

Link to Care International, a leading aid provider in Europe and the Middle East.

http://www.care-international.org

Link to U.S. Aid, an organization that provides aid from the American people.

https://www.usaid.gov/crisis/syria

story:
What is agriCULTURE Magazine?

agriCULTURE is a monthly magazine highlighting five key aspects of Georgia's top industry: farming, gardening, eating, crafting ... and where to go to find all of it. It's brand new to the publishing scene, and specializes in  making the science behind all of our food, farming, gardening and culture accessible!

What we need, and what you get

We're raising $15,000 to get the magazine up and running! Your donation will cover legal fees so that we can become legitimized; access to creative and publishing software from Adobe; the first year of running our subscription management system through PageSuite (which also includes our digital magazine showcase); paying contributing photographers and writers; creating, printing and mailing ad kits to prospective ag-vertisers; and publishing and mailing our first couple of issues. 

There's not a lot of options for people who write what we write, so we're committed to paying our entirely contributor-based staff of writers, photographers and artists. That's pretty important to us, even more so than some of the other costs we've incurred!! 

We've got some sweet backer perks lined up for everything from a $10 donation to a $1,000 one (or more ... we won't argue with ya!). You'll have first dibs on our magazine merch, complimentary subscriptions and more. And because we're working exclusively with Georgia companies and farms for these backer perks, you're supporting multiple levels of local business owners! 

Our perks (yay!)

Special thanks to Pixel & Ink Photo Boutique and Satisfactory Printshop in Athens, Georgia, for partnering with us on our perks!


Why back us?

Why back a brand-new magazine? Aside from the fact that it’s going to be great, we also think our principles are important. You may have heard that the average American is three generations removed from the farm. You may be hearing a lot of buzzwords in the news, not understand what they mean (and don't care to read a research paper or abstract to find out) and wonder if a genetically modified crop or a grain-finished beef animal is an OK part of your diet. You may also buy chicken that's marketed as "raised without added hormones," when in fact all US chickens are raised without added hormones! (That's your fun fact of the day.)

We’re connecting you back to the science behind the food you eat and the clothes you wear by sharing the stories of those who live it every day. We want to be Georgia's premiere source for agricultural storytelling of all aspects, whether it's an organic garlic farmer in north Georgia learning the ins and outs of marketing or a multi-generational producer telling the story of his family's hundred-acre farm and how his cattle travel to a Kansas feedlot to become our beef. 

Think about it. Everything you wear and eat was grown or made by someone. The inputs that went into creating those ingredients, foods and fibers were based on sound scientific research ... which sometimes is hard to find or understand. That's where we come in!

And the coolest part is that our staff is going to be 75 percent contributor-based. There’s not a lot of people out there who dedicate their professions to documenting all of these aspects of Georgia and Southern culture and agriculture. We want to be a paying outlet for those who are, and for those who want a break from daily newspapers to tell a story.

Our editor has nearly nine years writing and publishing agricultural and science stories in newspapers and magazines. She's a past editor in chief of The Red & Black at the University of Georgia; a former director of communications for Georgia Cattleman magazine with Georgia Cattlemen's Association; spent several months as the education and agriculture reporter for The Times in Gainesville, Georgia; and most recently the editor of Farmers and Consumers Market Bulletin, a bi-weekly newspaper published by the Georgia Department of Agriculture. She's also freelanced stories for GEORGIA Magazine published by Georgia EMC and Georgia Cattleman after her time there. 

Why we need your help

Though our editor has nearly a decade's worth of publishing experience and the drive to bring this concept into fruition, she's still a relatively poor college graduate paying off student loans, a car payment and other bills related to being an adult, and some people think she's a little off her rocker for starting a publication when she barely has a retirement account set up.

We have no doubt that the financial obstacles can be overcome with a lot of hard work selling advertising, working to encourage subscriptions (see below!) and the like. However, for agriCULTURE to be the success it's destined to become, starting capital is a necessary beast, especially when there's a full-time staff of one for the time being ... and extra especially when that full-time staff of one has another full-time job at the moment! 

Other ways to help us grow

  • Subscribe! For just $30 a year, agriCULTURE Magazine will be delivered to your mailbox and to your email inbox 12 times a year. There's also an agSPROUTS quarterly magazine geared toward our younger readers, as well as an annual gift guide that will come out in November.
  • ag-vertise! We've got competitive ad rates up now on the website, and there is still plenty of open space in our first two issues, November and December. We'd love to work with you, your business, your farm, your restaurant to help you gain more customers in our subscribership! We're also open to in-kind advertising trade-offs.
  • Stock the 'zine! Do you own an office, restaurant or bookstore that wants to carry agriCULTURE Magazine? Sweet! We'd love to send you copies to have on hand to sell, and a portion of the cover price would you back to you.
  • Follow us! Right now you can find agriCULTURE on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.
  • Share the cause! Share the Indiegogo campaign, our social media pages and our website with  your friends, followers and families.
